So i get to the room and its a pretty old looking room that they just added wall paper to and left the popcorn ceilings. It was neither a luxurious nor relaxing type of room. Its far away from most things like fishermans wharf or union square and the golden gate bridge. Anyhow my wine was not in the room when  i arrived so i went back down to ask for it and the girl seemed annoyed that i would ask. Then she called up her manager saying pretty much that this lady is asking for wine and hung up and looked at me and told me that it'll be a big charge. I was really upset and told her a wonderful woman who i spoke to prior to arriving had set everything up. Then finally after more calling she had our things ready for us when we got back from the Aquarium. This place for the price should have better staffing especially for the price i paid. I could have gotten a room at the W or the Clift and been more relaxed with better sheets and staffing. Ive been to japan and it felt nothing like japan. i wouldn't recommend this place. Also no room service, restaurant or bar/fridge.

review.title: Nice hotel in quiet neighborhood, great restaurant
review.reviewText: The hotel is under renovation but they are doing their best to not disrupt guests. The reception and breakfast room staff were very friendly, room was very comfortable, and the internet worked well. The deep soaking tub and japanese shower were a very pleasant addition to the room. The neighborhood is surrounded by Japan Town which is full of Japanese, Korean, and other restaurants. The nearby mall is convenient.

review.title: Convenient theme hotel
review.reviewText: While it is true that one elevator is not working, there is a service elevator 5 seconds away that one can also use, thus we were not inconvenienced.  There were no other signs of a renovation occurring.  The lobby and room were very clean and appealing, and we had an amazing view from the 16th floor.  Yes, there was some street noise, as can be expected in the middle of a big city but it didn't keep me awake.  We booked a corner tower room and were pleased with the large kabuki panels that slid shut at night in lieu of curtains.  The soaking tub was great.  We did not have any trouble finding the refrigerator or mugs for the coffee maker, as did other guests.  Garage access was excellent and cheap for SF ($23) although no in and out privileges unless you do valet parking for $45.  The garage is well lit and extremely clean, and we felt comfortable keeping what we purchased in the trunk of the car overnight.  Three things can be improved upon:  there is no door to the washbasin and shower area, only to the toilet stall.  Thus, in the middle of the night, the light from the bathroom pours out into the bedroom.  The other is that no matter how many times we thought we had adjusted our room thermostat, the room remained at an overheated 72.  Finally, we had some very loud foreigners in the room next door, and we thought the walls were too thin for this price point.  However, we would definitely stay here again for easy access to Japantown.

review.title: Excellent property in heart of Japantown, San Fran
review.reviewText: Went there for a conference being held on-site. This hotel is about 35-40 mins (based on traffic) from SFO in the heart of Japantown. At first glance, it looks like a normal hotel, but as soon as you enter the courtyard, you start noticing the Japanese influence (in the gardens, lobby). The look is minimalist, yet it is pretty. The staff is super-friendly and greeted me in a very friendly manner and made me feel right at home. My room was ready at check-in and was an easy walk to the room. The room is standard size, but very well maintained. It overlooked the Japanese gardens and was functional. Checkout was painless and taxi/ Uber was easy to find to go back to the airport!

review.title: Business trip, hotel close to the office
review.reviewText:
When we first got to the hotel, there were no one in the front desk, no bell to ring which was annoying.

The restaurant staff, Nancy M wasn't nice, gave me a bill while I was still eating, it wasn't even close to closing time.  Keep checking on me not to refill my coffee or water, she wanted to make sure I signed the check.  I had to say "what's the hurry".  That was pure rude of her.

I went with a co-worker who complained about the noise.  She can hear people shouting on the street or someone flushing the toilet next door.  Luckily I am a deep sleeper, I didn't hear anything at all.

The hotel is close to our office, that's why I chose this hotel.  If I were here on vacation and rented a car, I would choose Marriott closed by the Wharf.  

The doormen are polite and addressed us by our last name which is professional.

review.title: very friendly and pleasant staff and central
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Kabuki in August.  We were greeted by a very friendly reception (i did not get her name) which was quick and efficient.  We stayed for five nights.  Our room was a king room on the 9th floor which was clean and comfortable.  The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood and we used the transit system to get downtown and we walked quite a bit.  The walk down to Union Square was approx. 25 minutes at a brisk pace up and down hills.  The bus 38 which was a block away took us right down town.  Fillmore street is nearby with some nice restaurants and bars or stay in Japan town for noodles. We were happy to stay here and would again if we got the room at the sale price again.  Joe and the other doormen were very helpful and always on standby to call a cab.  The front desk staff very accommodating and pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and accommodating, the bed was comfortable, and quiet neighborhood.  Japanese and Korean restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Fillmore Street, Union Square (1 1/2 Miles away), Japanese and Korean food, convenience store, buses stops.

review.title: Excellent Hotel - Excellent Customer Service!
review.reviewText:
Let me tell you, I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel! First, when I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted  by a cheery, smiling face, upbeat desk clerk, and his name is Domingo. 

I asked if they had a room on a higher floor, and then I sheepishly told him that I did order my hotel from Expedia, but would really appreciate it if he could get me a room on a higher floor. (If you have ever ordered a room from Expedia or another discounted service, then you know that hotels tend to treat you like you are a second rate person - but not a Hotel Kabuki!)  The first words out of Domingo's mouth were, "That's okay if you ordered from Expedia, we treat all of our guests the same!"  I was floored! 

I travel A LOT and have NEVER had a desk clerk say that to me. Domingo gave us a nice room, and he was so accommodating. 

I also decided to stay an extra night, but the hotel was sold out. Again, Domingo managed to find me a room, and he did so with a sense of joy and passion. Domingo is a rare gem, and because of him, he set the tone for me to have an amazing week in San Francisco.

This hotel is convenient to any where you want to go in San Francisco. 

I will stay here again and again, and I highly recommend that you ask for Domingo to help you if you ever call here, or when you go to check in. He was kind, accommodating, and really cared about me having a good experience at the hotel! I highly recommend asking for him if you ever stay here! He is a joy to deal with! I
review.positiveRemarks: I loved Domingo the desk clerk who helped us. Having a caring employee who cared about our having a good experience on our vacation made it priceless!
review.negativeRemarks: Loved everything about the hotel. Wish they could clone Domingo!
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in SF and close to everything!

review.title: An oasis in Japantown
review.reviewText: At the last minute we needed another night in San Francisco.  We found the Kabuki on Expedia and it was a great choice.  Quiet, clean, a bit off the beaten path in Japantown, but on the bus line and close to the Van Ness cable car.  Many restaurants and bars along Post and O'Farrell, and of course lots of Japanese food in and around the Japan Center.  The staff was great and there is reasonable parking under the Japan Center if you don't want the valet parking.  We'd stay there again.

review.title: Boutique hotel in the heart of Japantown.
review.reviewText:
It's a very cute and posh hotel with Japanese architecture, landscaping, and furnishings and yet it's very modern. It has all the amenities -- free wifi, a little fitness center and a business center where you can print out your boarding passes for free. The room we were in was very comfortable, and what I love was how efficient and thorough housekeeping was when cleaning our room.

The bathroom is very interesting --- the toilet is in a separate room so if one wants to shower and the other wants to do a #2, it's possible. :)

It's located a few miles away from Fisherman's Wharf. Very walkable but there is no issue flagging down a taxi. We could hail one in seconds.

As it is in the heart of Japantown, you will have a plethora of sushi and ramen restaurants to choose from. Every meal we had was either sushi or ramen. I loved that about this place!

And it's pet-friendly too!

The staff is warm and welcoming. They attended to our every need (and anticipated a few of them too!). They are the reason why I constantly stay at Kabuki Hotel whenever I'm in SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the soundproofing. At night, (we were in a corner room) we could hear the elevators going off the whole time.

review.title: The aging Grand Dame is still charming
review.reviewText:
I stayed for 5 nights at Kabuki Hotel while traveling for work.  I decided to stay there since I have fond memories of staying at this hotel when it was Miyako Hotel. The glory days of Miyako may be behind us, but I found Kabuki Hotel still charming and pleasant. Although the building has aged somewhat (haven't we all?), all the lovely touches are the same (e.g., the soaking tub, Japanese-inspired decor, koi-pond garden, fruit-infused water and coffee service in the lobby, etc.). 

The front desk staff (Domingo) was highly helpful and very courteous.  The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable.  A definite bonus was the view that I got in my 15th flr room; watching the day break over the city and the sun set on the Bay (I could see a sliver of the water) on my balcony was delightful.  As was the sake-tasting in the lobby on Friday afternoon. 

The location, Japantown, is excellent.  It is accessible to all the areas of interest but is still relatively quiet (it is a city, so it can't be completely quiet) and safe.  There are lots of restaurants and bars in or near the area to choose from. I would definitely stay here again in my next trip to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, staff, decor.
review.negativeRemarks: The building can be updated a bit.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Japantown is close to everything yet safe and relatively quiet.

review.reviewText: This is (I believe) our fourth stay here.  We stayed 6 nights.  We enjoy the location - easy access to bus lines and sights from there.  We particularly like the location in Japantown.  It's not like Japan; we go to Japan several times a year, nevertheless, we enjoy the ambiance and friendliness we find in Japantown.  The thing about our particular room is it was at the front of the hotel - noisy traffic sometimes til 1a.m.  I'm a night owl but it occasionally was loud enough to disturb my reading or TV viewing.   On our 5th night, the smoke detector battery went bad.  Naturally, it started beeping at the inconvenient hour of 3:30 a.m.   I do not fault the hotel for that; in fact, it happened at our own house two nights before we headed to San Francisco!!!   I would commend the staff for taking care of it much quicker than we anticipated and very efficiently - in and out - despite the late hour!  I WOULD, however,  fault the hotel for the very late unannounced delivery (9:45 pm) of a split of wine on our 6th and final night with only one wine glass instead of two and not having it in the room soon after it was cleaned and perhaps sitting in an ice bucket so we could have enjoyed it before dinner or right after.  We had to check out by 7:45 for our shuttle pick up time early the next morning.  Arrival of the wine, obviously, was appreciated but at 9:45 pm on our final night, was not well considered.

review.locationRemarks: Japantown offers convenient dining and fun shopping ops.  Convenient to bus lines that take you anywhere.  Staff, particularly the doormen, great!

review.reviewText: I had the King Deluxe Room. Upon check in I was given the wrong room, it was supposed to have the soaking tub but didn’t, at first the front desk person argued that my room did have the tub but after a short conversation he realized his mistake and quickly corrected it. He told me the number of my new room but when I got there the key wouldn’t open the door; however the guest in that room did, oops! Front desk transposed the number when he told me, the right number was written on the key envelope. No biggie. The Hotel was nicely decorated with its own access to the Japanese mall. Parking was easy with a public parking garage right below the hotel and a dedicated elevator. The room was a bit small, nothing really special but very nicely decorated. The soaking tub was nice and functional. My room had good city views and a distant partial view of the Golden Gate. They have an unexpected and very nicely manicured Japanese garden and Koi pond nestled in between the buildings. And hey! I found out I like Sake they have a complimentary Sake tasting hour from 4-5. Nice touch. Over all I think the place is a bit over priced. I booked through Expedia for $199 which was cheaper than the regular hotel rate. It seems a bit steep for a mid-week rate one night stay (Tuesday night.) But hey! I was there on business so the company picked up the tab! Over all the staff were friendly, great location in Japan town and a slightly above average room.
review.positiveRemarks: Central access to Japan town. The soaking tub, décor and Japanese garden.

review.reviewText: This was a lovely personal hotel to stay in.  Small size hotel, so not too loud or crowded.  Bathroom was a highlight....Japanese style shower and tub.  Not all rooms have the same great bathroom, I was very lucky to get the deep tub, so you might want to request it.  The bed was comfortable and cozy, and I had a great stay.  I even got sick one night, and had to call down for help, and someone took care of my needs quickly.  I definitely recommend this hotel for a quiet stay.  Also, I was there for a training conference, and the room we used was spacious, and the catered breakfasts were yummy!

review.title: Nice hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights at Hotel Kabuki, visiting relatives who live near Japantown.  The hotel is very nice, but showing signs of age.  I understand a renovation is planned in the near future.  The room was pleasant, with comfortable beds, but it was difficult to control the room temperature.  The bathroom needs redesign, as there is a too-small deep soaking tub and a shower outside the tub, which results in water getting all over the floor.  There are sliding doors across the windows, but they are difficult to maneuver.  Our room was quiet, however, and the staff was very pleasant.  All in all, if you are looking for a comfortable hotel in a nice section of San Francisco, away from the madness of downtown (Union Square and Market Street), this is a nice choice.  I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and accommodating front desk staff.  Excellent location.
review.locationRemarks: In Japantown.  One block from Geary, and not far from Union Square (a short bus ride or a pleasant but long walk).

review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel through the years. I'll keep going back  whenever I have to stay in S.F.. I do wish the beds in the Double room were a little roomier for a couple and that the breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was a bit more affordable -- still, all three of us slept like babies and our breakfasts (especially the traditional Japanese one) were delicious for the money.

review.title: Decompressing after Xmas with family
review.reviewText: Love that they provide bathrobes in the room!!! The bath salts provided were a nice touch too. Overall it was the perfect relaxing getaway after our families were done stressing us out about not visiting enough and not making any babies. If I'm being really picky, I didn't love that we were in an ADA room. The shower had a weird chair thing in it and I had a weird feeling that there was someone staying in the hotel who needed that room more than me. There were also a TON of $8 snacks and beverages on the counter tops, which kind of just got in the way because I was not there to binge on junk food in my hotel room. Being right there in Japan town was amazing, and being so close to the mall and so many good places to eat was so convient. Next time I will plan ahead and book some spa treatments. They were all booked when I tried to get something same day. My fault on that one. I will defenitly be staying here again!

review.title: Safe neighborhood
review.reviewText: We were really impressed with the hotel and area. We were able to easily catch the busses or walk a few blocks to good restaurants. Only downside was that the room was warm. I know hotels in San francisco don't always have a/c but this room said it did and wouldn't cool off. It wasn't that bad as we visited during the winter, but if we got too hot at night we couldn't get it cooled off. The rooms were plenty big enough. The walls are thin, so bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper. But again the neighborhood is nice and quiet and you won't be bothered by traffic noise or party animals. The staff were all really nice. Even at a 1am check in from us!  When I come back to SF, I will definitely stay here again.

review.reviewText:

You can tell the property is a bit old, however- the corners of the wallpaper in the bathroom were peeling and some of the features just felt and looked outdated. The room could definitely use some refreshing as far as decor and ambience goes, but overall we had a nice stay. The biggest complaint I have is the street traffic noise occasionally heard in our room, and I suppose that is out of the hotel's hands. 
The hotel is also relatively central to the city, so most attractions are just a quick ride or nice walk away. There are a lot of great shops and eateries in the surrounding Japantown, which were fun to explore. We didn't rent a car, seeing as parking was something like $45/night, and decided to Uber everywhere, which was perfect and way more affordable (most fares were under $10). Definitely recommend that!

It was easy to find dinner and distraction due to the hotel being so close to so many attractions.  The party we attended ended up being boring, but we were able to easily find other things to do that did not take us too far away from the hotel.  

The following morning we ordered room service, and the food came promptly and was hot and delicious.  No one hassled us about our check-out time, because we were running a few minutes late.  I would stay in this hotel again if I was going on another overnight trip to San Francisco.
