We love to showcase the many offerings of our city as much as those of our property, and we're thrilled to have accomplished this for you with such success. Safe travels, and all our best!

review.title: good for the business traveller
review.reviewText: we went with our family on a vacation.  It is not far to all the tourist attractions.  No pool.
review.positiveRemarks: it was clean
review.negativeRemarks: the shower area could have a door to separate it from the sink area so that more than one person could use the washroom at a time.

managementResponses.response: While we're glad to have welcomed you, we're disheartened to hear that elements of your respective room missed the mark. With a variety of room styles available across the property, we aim to afford our guests with one that's tailored to their specific preferences, and we're sorry to have missed the mark in this case. Thank you for sharing this feedback with us, and best wishes from our Hotel Kabuki team.

review.title: Over priced
review.reviewText: The room that I stayed in needs to be painted in the bathroom area. Also, door swings into bath area and you then have to close that door to enter the toilet room. Not a good design for a slight handicap person. This room was way over priced for the condition and lay out. Would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Hotel a little far from center of town.
review.reviewText: Hotel was a little far from center of city, but transportation was available at all times. Hotel was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, needs improvement. (outlets,place to put your make up,etc)
review.locationRemarks: Theather and some retautant, Far from center of city.

review.title: Quiet, comfortable SF hotel
review.reviewText: Our room was ready early. It was on the smaller side, as are rooms in SF, but arranged in a way to be very comfortable and clean. Great neighborhood close to Muni line to downtown and other areas and walkable to Cable Car line as well as being in the middle of the amenities of Japantown. Much more enjoyable than staying near Union Square for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, quiet area, nice neighborhood.  Japanese ambiance makes the hotel experience different from norm.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown shops and restaurants. Easy to catch Muni to downtown or Presidio, etc. Couple of blocks to residential neighborhood shops and restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel but..
review.reviewText: the room was very cold.  Staff checked the t-stat but was still cold.  I set the heater on 85 degrees but it was at best 70 in the room.  Everything else was good.

review.title: Broken TV,shower, slow front desk otherwise nice
review.reviewText:
TV required engineer visit.
I did not have time to address the broken shower head - it barely worked and if they dont fix it the next guests will have issues too.

Front desk was slow to answer phones, and while in front of them, they seemed understaffed as the front desk folks were constantly answering phones.
review.positiveRemarks: was nice, clean.
review.negativeRemarks:
staff front desk better. 
QA the rooms - TV & shower shouldnt have had issues.

review.title: Convenient if you only want to see Japantown
review.reviewText:
The room was a very nice Japanese motif.  Loved the Japanese tub but the shower head splashed water all over.  There is no curtain over the tub, just the washroom's glass door.  Put the bath rug outside of the glass door.
The bed was not the most comfortable, and I have been in a lot of hotels through business travel!
review.positiveRemarks: They had a nice garden.  Front Desk people were very pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was not the most comfortable.  Staff should comprehend English and communicate clearly. Quoting parking rates is not communicating.
review.locationRemarks: Walk through the mall and local restaurant areas.  Avoid the street people the City has in abundance.  The streets of San Francisco are still dirty.

review.title: Minor issues but nice place overall
review.reviewText: The staff was very kind and helpful. They recommended a wonderful little breakfast joint within walking distance called Cafe Murano. Lots of Japanese food restaurants in the vicinity. You will need a car for access to tourist attractions in SF. Hotel is nice enough but a bit run down. No ventilation of any kind in our room. I was told to leave the sliding door open a crack which actually did the trick. They offered to relocate us to another wing but we were already settled. In my opinion any 3-4 star hotel should have A/C in EVERY room. Parking was cheap at $23 nightly compared to other SF hotels. I tried to save money one night by parking on the curb and got ticketed $66 because I didn't notice the sign for "street cleaning on Tues, Thurs, Sunday 6am-8am." Stick with the parking garage which actually takes you right to the hotel elevator. All in all a decent hotel, good for the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice location. Japan town is clean and safe with plenty of retaurants within walking distance. Staff was cordial.
review.negativeRemarks: Spruce up the rooms. New faucets would be nice. Could use more water pressure. Need A/C in every room.
review.locationRemarks: Cafe Murano perfect for breakfast. Good sushi joints nearby. There was also a jazz festival on Fillmore street which looked cool.

review.title: Nice but small
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for just 1 night after watching the July 4th fireworks.
The hotel is extremely clean. Everything looks nice except one small detail. There is no door separating the shower/bath and the bedroom. We have a family of 4. My wife and two kids went to bed earlier while I stayed a little late. There was no way to use the shower and bathroom without disturbing the ones asleep.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanness, comfort
review.negativeRemarks: Add a door separating bathroom and bedroom
review.locationRemarks: It is located at Japan town. We went to see the Jazz festival one morning.

review.title: Very nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel in a great location in Japantown.  Just a block away from the Japantown Mall and blocks away from Some great food.
review.positiveRemarks: the beds were very comfortable and the shower was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Mall and good food

review.title: Nice hotel in Japan Town
review.reviewText: Hotel is close enough to Kaiser Hospital to walk if necessary. $40 a day parking fee.
I had a pleasant stay. The hotel employees were respectful, helpful and informative. My check-in was late due to a long wait at the car rental place. I had no problems with check-in.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the Japanese decor. I liked the hotel had a restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: There was not enough closet space. A cabinet occupied half of closet. There was not enough room for clothes for 2 people.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in Japan town. There are several ethnic eateries nearby. It was easy to access some tourist spots from the hotel.

review.title: OK hotel close to CPMC Hospital with shuttle servi
review.reviewText: Elevator didn't work and handicapped wife on 13th floor. Service elevator had to be used.
review.positiveRemarks: clean
review.negativeRemarks: creamer for coffee in room
review.locationRemarks: lots near SF warf

review.title: The hotel needs a face lift
review.reviewText: The staff was polite and efficient, the location is convenient, but the rooms and hallways need re-doing.  The parking is fine, but if you are going in and out frequently, use the valet.
review.locationRemarks: Fillmore Street has lots of yummy restaurants and cute boutiques.

review.title: Great Hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText:
I am comfortable walking around.  And this hotel is well kept, a nice location and comfortable to walk around.  I'd get a higher up room, there was a fair amount of activity on the street that I could hear.  It was Gay Pride weekend, so maybe just a little noisier.  Breakfast was good in the hotel.

Coffee maker is the k-cup type.  So very easy and quick.

There is a lip in the bathroom to the toilet.  So if you get up during the night, bring a night light for the bathroom. I hit it pretty hard.  I don't drive in SF.  Uber and other ways are just to easy to get around, and parking is expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a great peaceful garden in the center of the hotel.  Loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: A soft night light in the bathroom would be appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown.  Easy to get to downtown SF.   Alamo square is an easy walk, "Painted Ladies."

review.title: great hotel!
review.reviewText: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.  I got a free upgrade to a family suite for no reason whatsover.  the staff is awesome and the rooms are great.
Hotel location is great. But facilities condition remain upgrade.

review.title: Father Son Tip
review.reviewText: Went south the moment I puled up. Wanted valet parking and was told they don't have any it was for guests. The bellman was beyond rude.. He finally said I could have valet parking. Lobby looked great and front desk staff was very nice. That was about it. We paid for an upgrade on expedia and the room was so small if you wanted to change your mind you had to go outside. It needed a deep cleaning for sure. The elevator said it all. Worn paint dirty interior. I must say this hotel has a problem with lack of attention to detail. you know it is an issue when a 10 yr old mentioned these points to me. Not a great experience
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Some TLC and attention to detail
review.locationRemarks: Japan Town is so much fun

review.title: Vey good but expensive hotel
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Kabuki is definitely a 4-star hotel with excellent ambience. The lobby area is pleasant and somewhat spacious. My room was huge and I really enjoyed its lounge to stretch out on. It's pod style coffee/tea maker was nicer than instant coffee.  It's restaurant provided decent American and Japanese style breakfasts but at the usual inflated hotel prices (this turned out to be invaluable as Japan-town restaurants don't open until 11am. But there are good places for breakfast on upper Fillmore).  
I didn't give this hotel 5-stars as it's a bit pricey.
review.negativeRemarks: It's TV didn't have PBS!
review.locationRemarks: It's right in the heart of Japantown, which was interesting for one day, but not the four I spent. It's near a 2 bus stop, which goes by Union Square.

review.title: Great Japantown experience
review.reviewText: We were only in our hotel for one night, but I wish we could have stayed longer. The facilities were neat and clean; definitely a Japanese vibe. There was a fabulous tub in our room. The bed was quite comfortable. The staff were very courteous. We were walking distance to a number of fabulous authentic restaurants. We even were able to walk to our show Saturday in Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, modern, friendly!
review.locationRemarks: Amazing Sweet Potato Latte's across the street. The west side of the "mall" has great little shops. I had the best mochi I've ever tasted!

review.title: Return trip was good
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here before and find the Kabuki to be a very nice hotel, in our needed location and at a rate of good value. Considering SF prices the Kabuki offers real value. At about $170 inc all the many taxes you can't beat what they have to offer. The location is just down the street from Kaiser's heart hospital so an early apt was so convenient. Our Garden room was fresh and loved the deep bath tub. Couldn't make the coffee machine work(?).
Staff was very nice and parking........while sort of next door, was $15 for the night.....a great value in San Francisco.
We recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It is inconvenient that their bar and restaurant is closed on Sunday and Monday.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do and see in Japantown. Nice walking area.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Toilets are old and don't flush well.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things to do in the area: Music, Shopping, sight seeing>>>>

review.reviewText: I've stayed at a few hotels around SF on business trips and this is the best I've stayed in yet. Cool location near fun restaurants in Japantown, clean rooms, friendly staff, neat theme. Will definitely be staying here again on a future trip.

review.title: Moderate hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Comfortable, but a bit "tired" hotel. Could use an update. Toilet barely flushed.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Nice hotel in a quiet part of the city.
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki is a pleasant hotel in Japantown, a quite part of San Francisco. Even though we were in the older part of the hotel (the tower), I was impressed with how clean the room is. The Japanese inspired theme added charm to the room and overall, worth the money. Japantown is not in the heart of the city, but it is quiet and near plenty of public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness and the quite neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: The room has no dresser.
review.locationRemarks: If you like Japanese and Asian inspired food, this is the place. Otherwise, you have to walk a few blocks to Van Ness for more variety.

review.title: Executive Suite w/ Sauna and Japanese Bath..!
review.reviewText:
So my Gf and I live in SF but it was my 29th Bday so I figured, Hell, Let's mixxx it up a bit...!
Executive Suite w/ Sauna and Japanese Bath..!
Access to Kyoto Garen, Primo..!
Extra champagne buckets with Ice as requested. ;)
Highly Recommend it! You've Earned it......!
review.positiveRemarks: Garden with Koi pond and oh yes, the Executive Suite w/ Sauna and Japanese Bath..!
review.negativeRemarks: um, cheaper Mini-fridge options...
review.locationRemarks: Kabuki Cinema! Japan-town shopping, FoodFoodFood....

review.title: Spacious hotel room for business traveler
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki is in Japan Town, San Francisco. The room rate is far better than the ones near Union Square and financial district. There are several bus lines taking to my business meeting near Moscone.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room with work desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Being in the City of San Francisco, street traffic noise.
review.locationRemarks: Located in Japan Town, a lot of restaurants (of all kinds) within walking distance. Frequent bus schedule to take me where wanted to go.

review.title: Nice hotel accessible to SF attractions
review.reviewText: This is a quiet hotel with the excellent Dosa restaurant nearby. There is also a very reasonable priced ramen restaurant across the way. The Ferry Building is reached by the California line, so being away from the main sights is not a problem. There are no major problems with the hotel. For SF, it is reasonably priced. I think the rate would have been better using Expedia's mobile app.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Nice and friendly staff. Clean and good size room for SF. Our new favorite place to stay in town.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Japantown, good size room. Friendly staff. Quiet when close window.

review.title: Glad we stayed
review.reviewText: We wanted a nice hotel, within our budget, centrally located and different from the run of the mill hotel decor/experience. Hotel Kabuki really served us well. Parking downstairs was comparatively cheap and easy (we parked just steps from the elevator gallery). The Lobby was calm and lovely and the staff were professional, positive, friendly, and accommodating. The room decor was just what was shown on the website and yes it is in need of some refreshing, but it was very clean, well maintained, and very comfortable. Our view over Japan Town was an unexpected plus. We didn't eat on site, but wished we had! Although we weren't there for a meeting, the meeting space on the Garden Level seemed well appointed and more enjoyable than most I've seen in hotels. We would definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: We chose Hotel Kabuki for the location, price and because it is a Joie de vivrie hotel. We liked the decor even if it was a bit faded and worn.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the furnishings were a bit worn (our chaise lounge for example), but it was clean, well maintained, and comfortable!
review.locationRemarks: In our experience, Japan Town is an under appreciated part of the City and well worth some time exploring.

review.title: Confortable hotel in Japan Town
review.reviewText: The experience was very fine but the hotel needs a mayor remodelation, is in a good area and easy to access. My room was big enough and also the bathroom, the bed was great. I don't recomend the restaurant.

review.title: very nice hotel..friendly staff
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay here again. very nice, comfortable,& clean rooms. there is an underground parking garage which can be accessed from the hotel elevators, which was convenient.

review.title: Nice hotel, great ambience, centrally located.
review.reviewText: Stayed there for 8 nights, staff was great, room was clean. Very close to multiple MUNI lines, getting to the Golden Gate Bridge, Golden Gate park, Fisherman's Wharf, and China Town was very easy.
review.positiveRemarks: Location: in the middle of Japantown, so there is excellent Japanese, and Korean food very close by, as well as multiple MUNI stations.
review.negativeRemarks: The building next door takes gets very noisy (trash disposal) at about 6am.
review.locationRemarks: Japan Town, multiple MUNI stations within 7-15 minutes to take you to all the tourist destinations.

review.title: Business Trip Stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel for business trip. Wonderful and attentive professional staff. Very nice serene lobby and nicely japeneese decor rooms. Location is safe. I just wish hotel was closer to Powell and Market. I would definately stay there again or at another chain of theirs.

review.title: So -so
review.reviewText: Pretty good location but we stayed in the Garden Wing. Definitely needs updating and was not that clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to many restaurants. Within driving distance to The Painted Ladies and Twin Peaks. About a twenty minute drive to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Make the rooms more modern, cleaner. TV's in the bedroom are so small relative to other competitive hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Located in Japan Town. Close to many restaurants, walking distance to Walgreens. UPS store across the street.

review.title: Our new favorite hotel in the city
review.reviewText: Second stay in the last few months. Super clean, nice bedding, great location for us as we love Japantown.
review.positiveRemarks: Deep soak bathtub, very comfortable king bed. The free wifi was fast enough and reliable.

review.title: An ok experience.
review.reviewText:
i was put int he room beside the noisy street.
the japanese restaurant inside the hotel is very pseudo japanese. go elsewhere for an authentic experience
review.positiveRemarks: The water pressure out of the shower was really nice! that was refreshing!
review.negativeRemarks: my room wasn't stocked properly. i didn't have the 'do not disturb' door hanger and no water was in the room

review.title: Excellent and Elegant
review.reviewText: Art, architecture, facilities special, service excellent
review.positiveRemarks: Ambiance pleasing, considerate, friendly service
review.locationRemarks: Takara restaurant next door was special, also not far to get to Golden Gate Park

review.title: Right on Japan town in san Francisco
review.reviewText: Perfect location with great view it added to the trip will be going back again.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki - a Joie de Vivre Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself has excellent and the bar and the staff were absolutely fantastic, friendly, warm and welcoming. We particularly enjoyed Bill at the bar and the happy hours. The room was adequate, but the shower pressure was very low and could simply not be adjusted. There was no wall insulation and neighbors and bathroom noises were quite easily heard at least in our room.

While my testimony may not be reflective of every room, we like the hotel, the location and the staff and the hotel perhaps needs some much needed enhancements expected out of a hotel of the class of Hotel Kabuki.

review.title: Japanese theme hotel
review.reviewText: On the edge of Japan Town great for the Cherry Blossom celebrations. Reasonably priced and convenient for transport. In a safe quiet area.
review.positiveRemarks: It's decor
review.negativeRemarks: Had a great coffee machine in the room but no tea available, only Green Tea.
review.locationRemarks: On the edge of Japan Town for all things Japanese.

review.title: just a touch of Japan - just
review.reviewText: Have been here before under diff management and it was very very nice. It is nice but not much diff from any other quality hotel in the city. Its location is convenient for Nihonmachi.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice views, clean lobby and pleasant staff (though they could learn something about Japan).
review.negativeRemarks: "green tea" was not green tea- it tasted like dirt and rosemary. Had to brush teeth and tongue twice to get rid of that flavor. small fridge nxt time

review.title: Great situation, Japan town. Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay, only backside is parking... Valet costs 45$ and self 23$.
Best plan is mall downstreet at 1$/h, forget the street...
Beds are good, room was clean. Globally hotel is quite old though, but if u look for downtown, right place.

review.title: Excellent, Central
review.reviewText: Fantastic experience, no problems at all except the toilet clogging...

review.title: Beautiful Japanese style hotel.
review.reviewText: My only complaint would be that there was no breakfast included and our shower did not work in room 403. Other than that, the place is beautiful and the rooms are very comfortable, with good beds. We would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: The showed did not work in room 403

review.title: No Motel Sticks foam rubber pillows
review.reviewText: One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in

review.title: Nice. Great location, clean, safe
review.reviewText: Great location to shops, bars, restaurants, The Filmore

review.title: Japan Town
review.reviewText: Loved the location, great eateries abound. If you like people watching this is a great venue.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, love the location.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to the House of Thai on Larkin, awesome. The Japanese mall was fun to peruse.

review.title: Boutique hotel in SF.....
review.reviewText: My daughter & I stayed here for the second time. The hotel is lovely, tho the rooms are beginning to show a bit of wear. The location is at the start of Japantown so it's a very convenient location to visit museums, Golden Gate Park, etc. If we visit SF next year, we may stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely lobby, garden....friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms a bit.
review.locationRemarks: On Post St at the beginning of Japantown. Next to the Peace Tower, across from the Japanese Malls.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, in a neat quiet neighborhood but also close to hot spots like union square etc.

Very friendly staff, arranged two bed room for my stay even it is my fault booked one bed room.

Nice room facility, though a little bit old, but clean and neat.

Will stay next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, neat but close downtown core and convenient
review.negativeRemarks: All good to me
review.locationRemarks: Japan town, minutes walk to bus and easy transit to all hot spots like Union Square etc.

review.title: "ONE OF THOSE!!"
review.reviewText: THEY DID NOT APPRECIATE MY RESERVATION MADE THRU EXPEDIA.
review.locationRemarks: NICE LOCATION

review.title: A unique experience staying in Japantown.
review.reviewText: I lived many years in Pacific Heights, but rarely frequented Japantown. It seemed so, hmm, constructed. Which it was. In the '60's, fueled by post-war racism, the entire neighborhooed was razed and this unfortunate structure was constructed. I was visiting SF for a conference and I didn't feel like a kitchy Victorian hotel and the financial district seemed overpriced, so I opted for the Kabuki. I was curious and thought it might inspire me to try the baths, which I had always wanted to try. My experience at the Kabuki was excellent. The staff was super helpful with everything and great. I walked everywhere, including to Union Square to meet a friend for lunch, and to the conference in the Civic Center. I mostly explored Japantown, with all of the interesting restaurants, bookstores, and stationery shops. It was quite intriguing. The food was excellent, including the sushi in the market in Japantown. The communal baths were the highlight of the trip. I would definately stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was lovely and the bathroom very large and a deep bathtub. The staff were very pleasant. Excellent location. A lot to explore in Japantown.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is in need of some upgrades and maintenance. Little scuffs, areas where paint is needed, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Japantown. Near Pacific Heights, Polk Street, Hayes Valley.

review.title: Great Hotel in Japan Town
review.reviewText: I really like Kabuki, my only gripe would be that street noise can be quite loud. Parking next door at the Japan center was very convenient. I'd stay again and try to get a room that didn't face onto Post

review.title: We enjoyed it.
review.reviewText: It was magical! I met very special people all around the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Met a very special group of people.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the restaurant and bar were open on Sunday and Monday!
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful sushi all around but we were sad we missed the Korean barbecue.

review.title: interesting in Japantown
review.reviewText:
Hotel is a little out of date and needs to be refreshed. Bed was comfortable and maid service was good. The location of the hotel makes it difficult to get to the main part of San francisco. IF you have a meeting on site it is okay. Need a car or take a taxi. The only restaurants are Japanese
in the area. The hotel has dinner service and breakfast, no lunch.

review.title: Nice hotel, interesting part of town
review.reviewText: Lots to see and do in walking distance, great restaurants and stores

review.title: Great area, nice hotel. Room seemed worn.
review.reviewText:
Have stayed at Kabuki several times. Room (King corner) seemed old and worn (stains on wall, things seemed dingy) Previous room that I stayed seemed newer and cleaner. Staff is great...check-in easy. Parking great deal.

Noise in room next to mine was bad. Group staying in room (sounded like party) continued until about 4 am.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up the rooms...mostly cosmetic.
review.locationRemarks: Tons. Restaurants, music, and more

review.title: Not worth the money.
review.reviewText: I normally trust Expedia's reviews since the majority are usually accurate. But in the case of the Kabuki, I have to side with the minority. There are definitely positives. Every member of the staff we met was friendly and helpful. The location in Japantown was fantastic. But our room looked like it hadn't been used in months. Everything was dusty, the clock was still on daylight savings time from November, the coffee cups had old brown stains in them, and we found an old pack of Marlboros in one drawer. There was no way to adjust the temperature in the room. We were warm the entire time. And the place just looks old and in desperate need of refurbishment. The ceiling in our closet was falling down, screws were missing from the vents, our screen doors barely opened. If this were a motel off the interstate I'd be fine with it. But a place that calls itself a "boutique" hotel, with the prices it charges, forget it. There are much better values in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Fit and finish.
review.locationRemarks: Japan Center had a ton of nice shops and restaurants to try.

review.title: Elegant Japanese Tower Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was a pleasant surprise. The lobby is elegant & refined with a lovely garden and coy pond wrapped around the lobby. The room was up high and has great city views. The bed was comfortable and the interior design was Asian contemporary. There's high- end fnishes in the bathroom and it was designed with people from Japan n mind.
The hotel is within walking distance of Filmore street with all it's trendy shops and restaurants. Japan town is nothing to marvel at, but I believe this hotel is really something special.

review.title: Great Location, very good value.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location. The staff were all very nice and accommodating. Our room was one of the suites that came with a sauna. What a novel idea! Was fun to get a good sweat up in Feb. but probably not something needed in the summer months. The hotel is nice, not a 5 star but a nice quality unique 3 star. You can tell that things need a bit of a refresh but for sure would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Time to paint and or refeseh the rooms a bit.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Japan Town and the Fillmore Shopping district. Great restaurants.

review.title: Best accessible room
review.reviewText: Very pleasant staff. Overall, the room was beautifully decorated with plenty of space to get around in my wheelchair.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room had the best handicapped bathroom that we've ever had at a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: We had to move the coffeemaker to the desk because there was no outlet to plug it in where they had it and there was no sugar & cream packets.
review.locationRemarks: In Japantown so it was great for us; we didn't have to move/use our car.

review.title: not worth it for its price
review.reviewText:
It is very far from anywhere interesting, the front desk staff was not very professional, and the complementary internet is simply a myth since it rarely works. Though you can still pay 5 bucks and get a faster connection.

Just call a spade spade, arlight?

review.title: SF Japantown hotel
review.reviewText: Overall an enjoyable stay. TV was quite small compare to other that charged the same rate. Long distance calling rates are slightly short of robbery. No display anywhere on rates, they just assume you will pay. The manager was quite willing to give me a 50% discount after I complain about it. Didn't need to eat at the hotel restaurant as it was really nothing special and the prices was ..... a tad high. But since it was so close to so many places, I just bring foods and drinks back everyday, eight bucks for a bottle of water.! Not good for finding breakfast as almost all of the places in the area open at 10:30 or later. Early lunch? Andersen bakery was pretty good and they open sat 9am. Housekeeping are almost too eager to clean the room, while you are still in bed, perhaps good for some? It was closed enough to downtown but far enough where you can get some peace and quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location to shops and restaurants, on main bus route to and from union square. Good Japanese soaking tub was perfect after a day walking around S
review.negativeRemarks: A bit run down, old musty carpet, hair dryer doesn't work, sink stopper broken, bad ventilation for sneaky smoker above or below my room.
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from the Japanese shopping center where there are tons of restaurants and shops, just a block west, there is a Japanese supermarket, Nijiya

review.title: Amazing View, amazing time!
review.reviewText: I had corner room on the 16th floor with an incredible view of the city. Everything went really smoothly. The staff was awesome (even let my boyfriend and I "check" our bikes at the front desk). It seemed there was some construction on the garden, which was slightly disappointing as we walked the smaller than imagined designated garden area. But surely it'll be in better condition soon. Pretty early in the morning, we could hear the cleaning staff bumping around in the hallway which was only slightly annoying. Our biggest issue is that we couldn't get the in-room keurig to work (turned out to be broken), so we bought $3 coffee at the restaurant bar. Might be for the best anyway since keurigs aren't really my thing. ;) Purty good, overalll!

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the heart of Japantown. The room is clean with a bed that is comfortable and size is okay however it is a dated.

review.title: Hotel in Japan town SF.
review.reviewText: Great location near multiple restaurants, large quiet shopping area with easy access to downtown SF and pier, Chinatown, or wherever you want to go.
review.positiveRemarks: Ambience, Japanese decor, Japanese style bathrooms, extremely pleasant staff, close to everything I love in Japan town.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe updating rooms a bit although mine was very clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: As noted above.

review.title: Theme experience
review.reviewText: A quiet, comfortable, hospitable place to stay while spending most of my time with my daughter who had surgery at UCSF.
review.positiveRemarks: A comfortable walk to the UCSF shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown and all it has to offer.

review.title: Great location for overnight stay visit.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kabuki is a nice boutique japanese style hotel and offers a unique room and bath experience. The street noise was the only issue. Recommend to book a room as high from street level as possible. Hotel staff was very helpful and professional.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel ambiance was very nice. The bed was comfortable w/ the shoji screens in bedroom area. A deep bath tub in our room accomodation was unique..
review.negativeRemarks: Stayed on the 15th floor and did not have ice machine. A call to the front desk directed us to 14th or 16th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to restaurants in filmore and japantown locals.Hotel location provides easy walking distance to restaurants and entertaiment.

review.title: A hotel gem in Japantown
review.reviewText: I always recommend the Kabuki to friends and family. It's not in downtown or touristy Fisherman's Wharf which I like. It's also close to buses, and all the activities in Japantown and the local Fillmore neighborhood. The bar/restaurant is very good offering drinks made from fresh ingredients.
review.positiveRemarks: The Kabuki has a neighborhood feel. It is in Japantown and has a Zen feel about it.The lobby has a koi pond with a waterfall.
review.locationRemarks: Near Japantown, theaters, restaurants, and upscale shops.

review.title: wonderful view
review.reviewText: For our anniversary trip we stayed in a King's Deluxe Corner room, which came with a private balcony. The view was wonderful, the layout of the room and amenities meet our needs for a one night stay; however, the only drawback was the smell of the hotel in general. My sister's fiance is Japanese and she had always complained of his house smelling of moth balls. I didn't understand her until now. Yes, that indescribable scent that left us wondering with confusion was, indeed, moth balls. Although the scent was light, it made us feel as if the room wasn't hygienic.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and pillows rocked our world, as well as the peaceful atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good experience, beatifull location, little bite far from donwtown city

review.title: Great hotel, convenient location.
review.reviewText: This is the fourth or fifth time I've stayed at the Kabuki. I appreciate the cleanliness and tranquil feeling of the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: It's convenient location, clean rooms and tranquil decor.
review.negativeRemarks: I shared a room with my 88 year old mother. The bathroom having only one door was a bit awkward for her.

review.title: nice hotel close to Mt Zion med center
review.reviewText:
FRIENDLY ACCOMIDATING HOTEL AND STAFF

GOOD BREAKFAST BUFFET

review.title: Center of Japantown
review.reviewText:
We always stay here in trips to SF.
Staff, amenities, tasteful Japanese garden, excellent breakfast and valet parking with in-and-out privileges 24/7 (for a fee).

review.title: Appreciate how staff accommodated us
review.reviewText: Nice place, nice location. Appreciated staff accommodating us.

review.title: Great location in Japan Town
review.reviewText: Had a comfortable stay, work out gym is very nice and private with all the things I need.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathroom is great, hot showers
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are thin, Foreign hotel guests like to smoke a lot. My smoke detector was covered by a plastic bag. :( No Microwave in room, fridge is tiny
review.locationRemarks: Great Japanese restaurants and mall on same block as hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel. Excellent location.
review.reviewText: The room was clean and very comfortable. We did not get to try the restaurant as it was closed on the day we stayed. But there are plenty of excellent restaurants near by. We really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Convenient and Quiet Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is convenient to all neighborhoods in San Francisco and situated in an area of Japantown with many restaurants and shops. Like many hotels attempting to survive in the recent recession they have cut some of the extras like refilling the Kleenex and putting out mouthwash when the first one is used up. The rheostat controlling the temp in the room was locked on "econ" most of the time but the outside temps were moderate so I was only slightly cold in the room. Breakfast was good in the downstairs bar and the staff was very courteous and friendly. The setting was nice and quiet, which for San Francisco is saying something because I have laid awake at night downtown while the street noise roared to all hours. Overall, I think Hotel Kabuki provide a good value in a safe and handy location.

review.title: Nice hotel near the Kaiser heart center.
review.reviewText:
There are not many hotels in this part of town so the Kabuki was a great find.
We had to be at the hospital at 6am so the in and especially the "out" needed to be quick
and easy, and it was.
The staff was very understanding and helpful.
Room was nice and no noise from the outside area. The room areas were very quiet.
The rate through Expedia was great. There is a parking fee but it was only $17.00 for the
evening and night.
Japantown is interesting for a stroll before dinner.
The hotel eatery was good. A short casual menu is offered. Food and service was very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and quiet room areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Age might be a factor but things looked a little tired.
review.locationRemarks: The location off Geary was perfect for us. The overall area is tight for space but once you learn your way around it is not an issue. Japantown.

review.title: Good for the price
review.locationRemarks: Not a very good location for tourist.

review.title: Great place to stay in Japantown!
review.reviewText:
We like eating and shopping in Japantown, and we spend a lot of time on that side of the city.

Hotel Kabuki is a delightful place to stay. Our room had an ofuru deep tub to soak in, and we both checked that out - superb. Great bed and bed linens. Very clean, very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Eat sushi! Shop Japantown !

review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, friendly staff. Nice view of San Francisco. Convienently located next to Japan town.

review.title: Too small, not for a luxury stay
review.reviewText: I was expecting more than a tiny room and for the price I would go somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Decoration.
review.negativeRemarks: Solving hotel policies.
Air vents/ducts need to be cleaned out. Rooms need to be dusted.

review.title: Nice hotel and friendly staff.
review.reviewText: We stay at the Hotel Kabuki three or four times a year. The staff is very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost effective hotel most times of the year.

review.reviewText: The only positive comment I can give about this hotel is that the sheets were clean. Room was outdated and shabby for the price. Also, for convenience we ordered breakfast via room service. Very overpriced for very poor quality food.

review.contentCodes: CRMD REMOD PD CSN HMP MMD
review.reviewText:
Run down hotel. We stayed because they allow dogs and had great rates, which is terrific... however, we will gladly pay more to stay in a nicer place more centrally located. Rooms are very small.
Also, beware, Expedia rep said that the hotel parking was included ( I asked him 3x and he replied yes all 3x)
and it cost us an additional 28 bucks. I then spoke with a supervisor/manager at Expedia who checked the call (which was recorded) and he apologized and offered to pay for the parking (terrific!). He sent me an email with a fax number. so i can send him a copy of the parking receipt for reimbursement. The hotel reception attempted to send the fax and the fax number was not in service and i could not locate the manager again. The call center was located in the Philippines and there was really nothing i could do. I felt powerless. It wasn't the 28 dollars... I don't like to feel duped and powerless.
Expedia sent me a questionnaire about my experience booking through their site. I explained everything in detail and sent them a copy of the email correspondence with their manager. I received no response... No acknowledgement, whatsoever. Guess they don't care about my experience enough to even reach out... it's all good, I just won't use their service any longer.
review.positiveRemarks: Dog friendly

review.title: Nice hotel close to The Fillmore
Great place
review.reviewText: Great location and staff
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff
review.locationRemarks: Japanese shopping center

review.title: Perfect for what I needed
review.reviewText: Great spot for a one night stay-cation in SF. Away from the craziness of downtown but easy to get to and from. Reasonable parking fee compared to other hotels. Very comfortable and spacious room for 2 people for 1 night. No complaints.

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText:
Very close to Fillmore, union square, convenient shopping at Japan town.
Hotel is very clean,friendly staff, good parking.

review.title: clean hotel in japantown
review.reviewText: we got the kabuki club room. it was in the other building. we were on the 5th floor and we had to swipe our key card to work the elevator to the 5th floor. nice little lobby area on 5th floor. we were told our club room was larger than the regular rooms. i dont know because i've never been to the other rooms. room was clean. we got a very comfy king bed. bathroom was fine. marble everything. the jet tub was fine but only 4 jets. the lobby guy didnt tell me about inserting my key card into the slot by the door to activate the tv's and other lights. ice machine by the elevator lobby on same floor. if you have more people in your party ask for rooms next door because they have the in-between doors to pass thru conveniently. but walls were a bit thin. we could hear the people next door especially the jet tubs. make sure you ask for the key to the little refrigerator. the hotel lay out snacks, water and alcohol/soda in the fridge but charge you if you use it. hotel is in japantown. we parked in garage on geary blvd and saved $$. just take the elevator to and from japantown mall and hotel and garage. we took the muni bus around only. we left our car in the garage the whole time.
review.positiveRemarks: conveniently located in japantown. close to muni bus. plenty of shops and restaurants in japantown mall. clean hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel didnt have a pool. no vents in the bathrooms. jet tub could use more jets and be bigger.
review.locationRemarks: conveniently located in japantown. close to muni bus which can take you to all the tourist places. plenty of shops and restaurants in japantown mall

review.title: Unique, but a little dated.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and especially liked the beautiful gardens and in-room sauna. While some of the room elements were worn out or a little dated feeling, many aspects of the room and facility felt recently updated. Perhaps there is a gradual upgrade in progress. I hope that they complete it soon. Note that the hotel parking lot is relatively small and sometimes they have no room for guests. Luckily there is a parking garage next door that is 1/2 of the price and nearly as convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: The gardens, location, in-room sauna.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath fixtures were worn out / damaged. The suite had two TVs, one remote kept turning both tvs on at the same time.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is very interesting with many amenities. The Fillmore Jazz district is very close and offers many music and food options.

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Clean, but somewhat dated room. Definitely would stay here again and/or recommend to someone else.

The description said room for 3 adults, but while there was lots of space, there was only space for 2 adults to sleep. This was the big and only disappointment. We very much enjoyed the Japanese food, room decor and surroundings.
review.positiveRemarks: see above
review.negativeRemarks: Provide sleeping facilities for the 3 adults as advertised.
Attention to detail in cleanliness.

review.positiveRemarks: convenient to Opera house
review.negativeRemarks: rooms need to be updated. Rooms were a bit dirty.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Theater district. Good Restaurants

review.title: Nice location centered in San Francisco Japantown.
review.reviewText: We were in town for a celebratory dinner and the location was a short cab drive away. It worked out perfectly. Nice ambiance.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice Asian hospitality.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing stands out. An outlet by the mirror near the entry.
review.locationRemarks: We were not there long enough to do much in the area.

review.title: Attractive, comfortable hotel close to daughter.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the quiet in the midst of city energy, close to cafes with good coffee, and also to the shops of Japantown. During this particular visit, we experienced an unexpected health challenge. The hotel staff responded with impressive consideration and anticipation of all that we required.
review.positiveRemarks: We enjoyed the lovely, serene decor, the peaceful atmosphere, the quiet garden, nearby restaurants. I liked the complimentary detoxifying bath salts.
review.negativeRemarks: Though we don't usually watch tv while visiting San Francisco, we did search for a PBS station on television, and missed a favorite program.
review.locationRemarks: The proximity to Japan Center gave us hours of enjoyable browsing, shopping, tasting. We tried afternoon tea at a tea shop. We could walk everywhere.

review.reviewText: Fairly priced well located hotel with reasonably priced park and lock availability on site. The rooms are attractively decorated with beautiful views.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a good choice for me based on my above experience and close to family.
review.negativeRemarks: Because there is no shower curtain or glass partition on the tub/shower, a lot of water splashes out. Even a small partition would be appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Kabuki is well located especially with a car available. It's fairly central in the city.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great experience returning for Christmas holiday!
review.positiveRemarks: The calming environment and tone of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: There is a wide variety of shops and eateries within walking distance!!

review.title: Very pleasant & nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Having stayed at the Kubuki on a number of occasions, we enjoyed it. It is very clean, comfortable bed, a nice view into SF, and quiet. We also love that we can open the window and step out onto a small deck.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean room, efficient, comfortable bed. Room pleasing to the eye.
review.negativeRemarks: More explanation about how things work. Didn't know the room key was also a card that needed to stay in the slot in order to have a heated room.
review.locationRemarks: Love that we can walk to the Fillmore corridor, restaurants, shops, even to the Marina. Great views, public transportation is easily accessible

review.title: Nice hotel in Japan town, good hotel restaurant
review.positiveRemarks: My room had an excellent view and was very quiet. Friendly staff, great location
review.negativeRemarks: My room need one comfortable chair in addition to the swivel chair at the desk; the chair provided was uncomfortable
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the heart of Japan town next to the mall and there are literally 100+ restaurants in a 5 minute walk out the door.

review.title: Wonderfully calm and quiet but dated
review.reviewText: an urban oasis but the bathroom needs updating and the mattress was poor.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby, room decor
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom is really old, the mattress was quite uncomfortable, and the desk was too small for all they had on it - TV, Keurig, big lamp.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is interesting for shopping and eating. Unfortunately nothing opens very early so that didn't help an E. Coaster looking for breakfast.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION AND STAFF
review.reviewText: REALLY ENJOYED THE HOTEL; STAFF IS VERY HELPFUL. LOCATED ON JAPAN CENTER, MANY GREAT RESTAURANTS WITHIN TWO BLOCKS WALK. THE BATHS ARE A MUST. CLOSE TO MANY BUS ROUTES. WILL STAY THERE AGAIN.

review.title: Quiet Gem in Japantown
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hotel Kabuki for our wedding/honeymoon getaway in San Francisco in November 2013. We wanted a nice place to stay that wasn't overly snobby so we'd feel special but comfortable - and the Hotel Kabuki was perfect. We didn't make many extra requests, but those we did were answered quickly; from an extra bathrobe to a band-aid.

The feel is very America-does-Japan, so it is familiar and comfortable, but it is located next to the Japan Center, which has the complete feel of actually being in Japan (and has some of the most amazing food in the city!).

The only thing we weren't impressed with was the hotel restaurant. My husband's workplace gave us a credit there for dinner, and as we'd spent all week eating amazing authentic Japanese food in the Japan Center we were expecting something special. This turned out to be more like a bar which served what we called "American-Japanese fusion" (it was the only place in the area which served us water instead of green tea by default, for example), which was a bit lackluster. Don't let that stop you from staying at Kabuki though - just eat at the Japan Center!
review.positiveRemarks: Location was fantastic, the staff were nice and the whirlpool tub was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The water temperature was all over the place, which made showers a scary experience. The hotel restaurant was disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: Japan Center - can't say it enough! The place is awesome from shopping to relaxing and definitely eating!

review.positiveRemarks: It was easy to catch the bus down to the Mascone Center and walk two blocks. Great deal for a $2 bus fare. Bill, the bartender, is a nice guy.
Very clean, nice Asian decor and windows can open for fresh air!
review.locationRemarks: Great location at Japan Center. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Japantown.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Going to The Fillmore for a Show?
review.reviewText: Stay at The Kabuki! You can walk to the venue in less than 10 min. The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant, but there are also lots of places close by. It's in the heart of Japantown, so it's got that going for it, too.

review.title: very clean, close to Japan town, great parking
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Kabuki on many occasions from the time it was the Miyako. The overall experience has always been very positive and having it attached to Japan town is a chance to experience more of the cultural side to the city. Having an underground parking lot which is reasonably priced is a huge bonus in SF. No need to drive all over looking for parking or worrying that you'll get a ticket because the meter ran out. There are numerous restaurants and shops within J-town making eating and shopping very easy. You can get slightly larger room for same price if you stay in the garden level side instead of trying to get a room on a higher floor in the tower since the view isn't that special to begin with - not bad but I'd opt for more space.
review.positiveRemarks: it is a nice cultural experience - the rooms are decorated with a Japanese flavor
review.locationRemarks: the location is excellent with access to Japanese restaurants and shops as well as very reasonable parking rates for garage

review.title: Love this hotel!
review.reviewText: Love the Japanese decor the rooms are so cute and comfortable and live that they have a balcony!

review.title: Birthday graciousness
review.reviewText: When we checked into the hotel, the staff noticed my birth date and offered me a celebratory bottle of wine. It was unexpected, and graciously done. The Kabuki is already my favorite hotel in San Francisco, and now it is more than ever.

review.title: Nice hotel in centre of Japantown
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hotel Kabuki for two nights at the end of a two week roadtrip. We were hoping for a relaxing stay in a luxury hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Union Square and we weren't disappointed.

Staff were welcoming and efficient. Our room was clean and well equipped. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well stocked with lovely toiletries including bath salts for our Japanese soak tub. We also had the added bonus of a small balcony overlooking the street.

The hotel was right next to the Japancenter shopping mall and close to a delicious array of restaurants on Filmore Street.

We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Kabuki and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends. Perhaps not the most convenient hotel for all the sights, but great if you don't want to be in the heart of touristville!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff. Décor. Bed. Toiletries. Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Overpriced mini-bar (although fairly typical of a San Francisco hotel)
review.locationRemarks: Located right next to Japancenter. Five minutes walk from bars and restaurants of Filmore Street.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of Japantown
review.reviewText: Very nice stay, quiet room, excellent staff. The location is convenient and there are many restaurants and shops within walking distance to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful location, excellent hotel restaurant, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a tiny bit worn. Sink was cracked from something heavy dropped in it.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for numerous Japanese restaurants and proximity to the shopping center. Many things are a convenient walk.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Great theme. Affordable and good japanese dining. Self parking at max 23 bucks was helpful. Walking dist to california st cable car. Rooms were great but need some updating. Loved the deep soak tub!

review.title: A very tired couple checking in...
review.reviewText: PRO: Long trip, very tired from driving and arrived in late afternoon on a weekday. The front desk was friendly and concerned. They sped us through checkin and the bell service helped us to our room. Services were explained but when the bellman saw how tired we were he said just to go and call the belldesk for anything we might need and he'll take care of it. The room was clean and smelled fresh. Large clean bathtub. Good lighting and climate control. We fell asleep and woke up later that evening. Very close to Japantown (in it, actually) and we wandered out to eat. Came back and was greeted by another bellman and another front desk staff. The service was felt like a B&B somewhere. Anyway, this was our second time in this hotel and we'll be staying here again. CON: The only thing I can think of is the parking situation stinks. It seriously stinks. Underground parking and the entrance is not at the hotel. We always found a stall to park in but the hike back to the hotel wasn't fun. Not the hotel's fault but definitely not the fun part of coming here.
review.positiveRemarks: My wife and I cannot think of a single thing to improve. Friendly, courteous and concerned staff. Clean facilities and the room service food was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. Parking. Parking. Have I mentioned Parking?
review.locationRemarks: Japantown and good food. A happy place in the City.

review.title: Quiet business hotel in the heart of Japantown are
review.reviewText: Very nice room with Japanese architecture, well fitted and comfortable and good view
review.positiveRemarks: Underground parking in Japan Center - elevator to hotel - inexpensive and handy
review.locationRemarks: Great Japanese food in the mall attached. Many good restaurants and shops. I'll be back soon.

review.title: Not Your "Average" Tourist Stay
review.reviewText: This Japanese themed hotel is a little 'out of the way' from the average tourist locations, but San Francisco is easy to get around. Great location in quiet (and safe) Japantown and close to Fillmore St. Our room was large and very comfortable. The hotel has everything that you need and there are shops and cafes within a few blocks. Internet is fast and reliable; staff helpful. A shared van to the airport can be easily booked.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the ambiance of this hotel and it is a great base. This is the 3rd time I've chosen to stay here, and I will happily keep going back.
review.locationRemarks: Explore the shops along Fillmore St (towards Pacific Heights). Buy a 1, 3 or 7 day MUNI pass and use public transport to get around easily.

review.title: Wonderful area for eating walking
review.reviewText: Wonderful area for eating walking and feeling like U R in Japan. Good public transportation and taxi service around.
review.positiveRemarks: Special atmospher and location. Breakfast at the Resturant is good and reasonably priced
review.negativeRemarks: Light in the room needs more attention

review.title: Excellent location near Filmore Street
review.reviewText: Nice hotel- a little dated interiors but with great views of the city from the balconies- ask for a corner unit and get an exceptional view.
review.positiveRemarks: Great views, parking beneath the hotel, very helpful and knowledgeable staff
review.negativeRemarks: interior finishes are tired and need attention
review.locationRemarks: Filmore street is great for restaurants and shops- lots of locals eat and shop here. On a direct bus route to Union Square- 5 minutes.

review.title: Unreliable television reception
review.reviewText: The TV kept loosing its signal despite assistance and repeated calls to engineering. Was very disappointed because it made me miss the season premier of my favorite TV show. The personnel were helpful but they were not able to fix.

review.title: Like a quick trip to Tokyo
review.reviewText: My room had a gorgeous city view and was surprisingly quiet. Really enjoyed the deep soaking tub and comfortable bed. I felt like I had taken a quick trip to Tokyo by just going downstairs to the shops and restaurants of Japantown!
review.positiveRemarks: Deep soaking tub and location adjacent to Japantown
review.negativeRemarks: It's a little pricey.
review.locationRemarks: See a show at the Fillmore or just go shopping on Fillmore Street

review.title: A/C doesn't work
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel on Sept. 11 for 1 night, upon returning from dinner we were ready to take a good night sleep, to our surprise we couldn't cool down the temperature in the room because the A/C doesn't work if the outside temperature is 65 degrees or less. We called the front desk and the only alternative they gave us was to open the balcony door so that fresh air came in, not only didn't this work but in addition to air lot's of noise came in so our expected good night sleep didn't happen.
So if you are planning to sleep with A/C stay away from this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, never been in a hotel like this
review.reviewText: Great hotel that has good places to take pictures, staff is wonderful

review.title: Don't rely on the pictures!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok but I was expecting much more based on the pictures. Hotel (room) felt dated and dinghy. Not sure if I was in an older wing or not. AC did not work because the building runs off of a central unit and it was set on heat. So, your only choice was to turn the heat off in your room. The size of the room and bathroom was good.

review.title: Good place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: We came in late from the Giants game and we liked that valet was still around and ready to help us, the desk people were nice and helpful and they even gave us a room with beds for the kids ( we had just booked a king bed room ). It was easy to find and in a nice neighborhood. We would definitely stay there again :)
review.positiveRemarks: 24 hour check-in Clean rooms Nice neighborhood Nice people
review.negativeRemarks: We had a hard time figuring out the air conditioner, that's about it!
review.locationRemarks: We were close to everything, and it was easy getting where we needed to get to the next day.

review.title: Bathroom problems
review.reviewText: The rooms are fine except that you can't turn on the light only in the toilet room, so you light up the whole room! There is no door between the sink room and the sleeping room, and only a clear glass door between the sink room (and bedroom) and the shower. So it doesnt work well with kids and parents unless you're all fine naked together and being lit up when someone needs the toilet.

review.title: Nice room---Don't buy anything from fridge!
review.reviewText: I got the upgraded room with a view and large tub. The view was limited---the tub was nice. Not much room to walk around----tripped over the office chair that was at foot of bed and under the desk against the wall. The staff were very friendly and efficient. DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THE KEYED REFRIG!!!! I had one small bottle---maybe 2 small glasses of white wine-----$28.00!!!!! Buffet breakfast was almost $20.00 and not worth it. The room was expensive enough---seems as though they shouldn't stick it to you on everything else.

review.title: Needs renovation
review.reviewText: Pleasant and peaceful stay but rooms are in need of many cosmetic updates.
review.positiveRemarks: Ease of parking and very attentive staff. Close to the function we needed to attend.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to be updated: bigger tv's, touch up paint in bathroom, new carpet, lamps.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki - San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with the hotel and staff. The front desk were extremely professional and helpful when we needed help with specific issues. We would not hesitate to book another stay at this hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean, organized and seemed to fit our needs very well. The staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that we noted.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel location allowed us to access the cities transportation system to most anything and area we selected (i.e. AT and T Park, Wharf, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel, clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this hotel alot. I didn't go for the hotel restaurant as it was overly expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant was too expensive...maybe lower priced menu.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of Japanese restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great 2nd stay...
review.reviewText: This is the 2nd visit this year...we very enjoyed the 1st time and booked again this time...as comfortable as last time, staff are just as nice and helpful, we saved on parking the same as last time by parking at the attached Japan Center Garage instead of the hotel's valet parking. Everything is close by...food, shopping, public transportation, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Awesome Japanese deep bath tub, very theraputic shampoo, and connected to shopping, snacking, eating, public transportation, and etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish the AC doesn't shut off in the wee hours, but we only noticed it the very last night we were there after almost 2 weeks.

review.title: OK for the Price
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about the Doormen at this Hotel. Not only are they professional and friendly but they all went out of their way to assist us with anything and everything we could need or want. The room itself did not live up to the photos or description. Everything seemed to need a bit of TLC. The biggest disappointment was the bathroom. The shower head outside of the tub had zero water pressure. There were no bathropes as listed on the site and we were only provided 1 of the free single use packet of bath salts during our entire stay for the soaking tub, which did not live up to the tub we expected. We were there for 5 nights and the last night we did not have wash cloths.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and again, the doormen. Can't say enough how much they made our stay there enjoyable.
review.negativeRemarks: Daily room service needs improving.
review.locationRemarks: Located right next to the Japan Center. Great shops and food.

review.title: Noisy hotel in Japantown, San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was noisy. That included street noise which is unavoidable if the windows are not double glass. Worst, actually, the room was adjacent to the ice-maker in hall and that made quite some noise. The room was also adjacent to the storing area of the staff's cleaning carts and I was not very pleased when the cleaning started at 7am on Saturday morning with much noise and clanging of the doors of this storing space.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: I don't like the smelly pillows. I like the Japanese style bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Please provide slippers

review.title: Ok for Japan town. nowhere near dt SF
review.reviewText:
Nice place, always wanted to stay here. need a car or a good cc for taxi's. no sub near. Japan town is great for restaurants. Very safe area. hotel is bit frayed at the edges, but the rates make up for that frayness. I would stay there again. Through he Japanese bathing arrangement is very different, you sure make a mess is you don't know the movements.
awfully noisy in the early AM. bang, bang doors.
review.positiveRemarks: it was pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms, newer furniture. rooms are awfully small, I guess that's a Japanese thing. Nice bar.
review.locationRemarks: shopping for Japanese stuff, eat Japanese food. Because there is nothing else you need a car/taxi. No bus nearby nor mass transit. very safe area

review.title: No privacy in the shower area (glass door).
review.reviewText: My husband and I were sharing the room with our teenage daughters (2 double beds). The door to the shower room had a glass door. the toilet was in a small separate room, but to get to the toilet, or use the bathroom sink you had to walk right by the glass shower door ! No privacy. Room was small. Public parking garage underneath hotel with no in and out privledges. We were in one of the top floors, and you could still hear a lot of street noise, and the air system was also loud. Staff was nice, and the Hotel was in decent shape
review.positiveRemarks: staff
review.negativeRemarks: Better privacy for showering in rooms with 2 beds
review.locationRemarks: It was close to Golden Gate park and Ocean Beach.

review.title: Luxurious Hotel next door to Japan Center Mall
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 8th floor with a balcony overlooking the City..beautiful views!! Hotel has beautiful Japanese Motif screens as drapes. The hotel is next door to Japan Center Mall which has numerous restaurants and stores. Although the room is rather small but the restroom makes up for the size and they provide a silk kimono bathrobe. Also, you have to try their massage facility next to the Hotel...for $15/30 minutes you get a highly professional massage. We ate across the street...highly recommend this and very reasonably priced. There is a theater one block from the Hotel and other nearby stores and restaurants. The beds were immaculately clean and comfortable!!! One concern is the parking is very expensive....valet parking fee is $40 ++ tax and be prepared to tip.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean beds, pristine restrooms, and Japanese room decor
review.negativeRemarks: Parking & Hotel is too expensive!!!
review.locationRemarks: Japan Center Mall right next door, theater, shopping, and restaurants.

review.title: Good Value and Location
review.reviewText: Great location to CPMC( Med Center) and/or Japantown. Also within walking distance in Fillmore Street. Lots of dining choices and shopping. Hotel is clean, nice service , room was bright and a good size for the Bay Area. Only slight issue with the tiny TV..otherwise no complaints.

review.title: Good quality hotel in a good area of the city
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel on a three day visit to San Fransisco . It was really comfortable and the staff were very pleasant and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The public areas were spacious and our room was clean and comfortable. We had a an enjoyable meal in the restaurant/ bar in the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant/ bar was closed on two out of the three days we were there. We feel that large reputable hotels should have this available every day.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was located in Japantown which is about a 15 minute walk from Union Square

review.title: Great hotel, very large King room on 5th floor
review.reviewText: Stay was excellent and amenities were amazing for the price. We accessed Japantown easily for all of our meals and some shopping on the way out. Parking was convenient in the garage below, and wireless internet access was free and worked even with tablets (some hotels had issues with tablets).
review.positiveRemarks: Free Internet, big room, large window with a view, nice garden
review.negativeRemarks: Poor lighting around the hotel, and we saw a car being broken into from our hotel room on the 5th floor. We called the front desk, but he took off.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown for sure, other local restaurants and shops, travel via car to anywhere in SF.

review.title: We wanted to visited Japantown and we did.
review.reviewText: Great. We love this hotel. I can't say enough about this hotel. We are always comfortable here.
review.positiveRemarks: We have stayed in this hotel many many times. We like the cheaper parking if you park yourself in the underground lot adjacent to the hotel.

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great wabi-Sabin and Shabui design elements and overall feel at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location , staff, and attention to design of bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Awkwardness of operation of the bathroom door.
review.locationRemarks: Great public transit to tourist area. Even walkable, believe it or not, for this hilly city.

review.title: Parking a joke
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and not very well renovated to meet the japanese style. Dark rooms due to decorative window coverings but the room was large enough. Not much of a gym and the parking was shocking at $23 per day without in/out privileges.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathtub
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, sucked for the price point. They should advertise the parking fee so that a traveller can include it in their hotel price consideration.
review.locationRemarks: Loads! Very close to bus tours but had to walk through projects to get there, fairly safe during daylight hours though.

review.title: Japanese hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the authentic decor, staff helpful. Room fantastic.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Nob hill, downtown, Chinatown

review.title: overall it is a very good hotel
review.reviewText:
great location right at the Japan town with lots of Japanese restaurants.
room is clean and comfortable. Staff service is just so so.

review.title: In the middle of Japantown
review.reviewText: We stayed for 7 days, staff was helpful and rooms were clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very hekpful, room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Next to japanese mall.

review.title: Japantown Jewel
review.reviewText: we chose this hotel because of its closeness to Japantown and because of its decor...it was a birthday celebration for our son, who loves japanese culture. He was very pleased as were we all. the accomodations were nice , the staff very friendly and helpful. the garden on the first floor was really nice and the restaraunt had very good food.
review.positiveRemarks: the closeness to japantown, the comfortable rooms, the hotel restaraunt food, the beverage and snack bar in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: the room and the restaraunt downstairs were slightly dusty.
review.locationRemarks: next to japantown, which has excellent restaraunts like over the bridge, and shopping. Not too far from japanese tea garden.

review.title: SFO trip with family
review.reviewText: Hotel was pretty pricey but worth it. I would go back if the price was lower.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were super clean.
review.locationRemarks: Visit Japan center for great sushi.

review.title: Good choice SF
review.reviewText: Good location, lovely ambience, courteous staff, not overly expensive.

review.title: Great hotel in the city
review.reviewText: Perfect for family - great experience, great staff and perfect location. (cheap compare to other hotels)

review.title: Great location and Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in hours early and even got an upgrade, on a very busy weekend. Wonderful views. Great Japanese food steps away. Convenient and reasonable self parking in the garage under the Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and convenience!
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Good Hotel but no parking
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to the shopping district. However, parking is not included in the hotel cost.

review.title: Odd hotel with comfy bed
review.reviewText: I usually like hotels within this chain. The lobby was redone nicely. But the hallways and rooms are a strange combination of remodel. The bathroom was ok. But my room had water damage and peeling wall paper. The bed was very comfortable
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location in Japantown and the view was fantastic
review.negativeRemarks: A consistent remodeling and refresh on rooms and hallways. It felt like the hotel was overlooked compared to others.

review.title: nice neighbor with fair price
review.reviewText: very small room on the main building the last time that i stayed in the back builduing much bigger room and better blankets on the bed
review.positiveRemarks: breakfast

review.title: Nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to stay in. Very clean amd thw staff was very helpful and nice when ever we had a queation or request. And i must say the bed was really comfortable. Overall i wouls recomend tjis hotel to any of my friends and would defenetly stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very confortable. Room was very clean and the staff very helpful.

review.title: Great place to stay for business.
review.reviewText: I contemplated many hotels on Expedia before booking Kabuki. For a hotel stay everyone wants clean and aesthetic. Clean, comfortable and pleasant, and the balcony (while small) was a nice way to breathe that cool SF air! When you are spending a few nights on business Especially in SF where being out of the hotel is better than in, if you can get the above 3 and add in economical then why stay anywhere else?
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, pleasant staff, comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi was sufficient but could be improved,
review.locationRemarks: Japan Town

review.title: Good location. People Friendly.
review.reviewText:
Perhaps because of the space in the room, furniture was very limited. No chair, other than the one at the desk. Somewhat inconvenient.

We had a little trouble with the shower adjustments. Ours had jets coming out of the wall and was difficult to adjust. Some instructions on the desk would have been helpful. Once we figured the shower out (we were in the hotel 5 nights), everything was fine.

People at the front desk, restaurant, room maids, etc., were all very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great Asian Motif Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Asian motif hotel. Loved the Japanese style shower/soaking tub. The front desk staff were very friendly and professional.
