review.negativeRemarks: The Izakaya lounge wait staff were not very customer service oriented. Parking was also an issue due to limited on site space.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, CA

review.title: great hotel for both business and pleasure
review.reviewText: very clean and perfectly located hotel, staff was very helpful and kind except Andrea, I was lucky not to have noisy guests in close rooms, excellent choice for the money
review.positiveRemarks: cleanless and quietness
review.locationRemarks: perfect location if you drive

review.title: Hotel location was great!
review.reviewText: The hotel and grounds were beautiful and within walking distance to many resturants and shops. Our only issue was the air conditioner in the room seemed to controlled and never felt cool enough, especially at night.

review.title: reasonable and well located, room lacked comfort.
review.reviewText:
There was not a comfortable chair in our rather large room. When we asked for one they said there were none available. the room looked empty and felt so as well. There is an
attractive lobby. restaurant was adequate.

review.title: Loved it. Highly recommend Kabuki.
review.reviewText: Staff was great. Hotel clean and well located for easy driving in all directions. Nice rooms for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive but understood for SF. Normal it seems.
review.locationRemarks: Location is central to all freeways across bridges, to downtown to the Richmond to GG Park and anything SF.

review.title: Close to Hays valley shops and restaurants
review.reviewText: The business center still charges for internet. Get with it! Even starbucks provides free internet access. Printer out of paper, none stored on site.....For this type of hotel, it is overpriced.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: The whole energy thing is over played. Even our lamps had to be plugged in.
review.locationRemarks: Hayes Valley access to shops and sights.

review.title: Japan Town Favorite
review.reviewText: Great place! It's easy to get around the city from this location. Japan town is very low key. Love the deep bathtubs.

review.title: Access to UCSF
review.reviewText: Need a one night stay to make an early morning appointment at UCSF. This hotel is an excellent choice. Would definitely stay here again. Very easy access to hospital.

review.title: Centrally Located, Comfy & Friendly
review.reviewText:
The staff at the Hotel Kabuki was amazing. They were responsive and went over and above: prompt with all requests, very helpful, cheerful and accomodating.

The Kabuki is a good hotel... centrally located in Japantown. Easy access to cable cars and therefore the Wharf, Ghiradelli, the Pier and Chinatown. Great breakfast on Polk at a place called Toast which was within walking distance and worth the wait. If you are into Japanese Cuisine, all the sushi you could want everywhere the eye can see.

Some things in the room were a little worn but the things that really mattered weren't (bedding, furtniture, television). It was a very nice and comfortable stay. The bedding, linens and pillows were of good quality and comfortable. The towels plush. Even being on a main street, we slept well.

Our daughter was 8 and she liked the food and the shopping nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room (sitting room and bedroom area), the staff and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Things that are worn need to be touched up or disposed of. Chipped paint, sinks or rusted metal tend to immediately downgrade a room.
review.locationRemarks: California St is only four blocks up Laguna. Restaurants and cable cars & restaurants are easily accessible from here past Van Ness.

review.title: Really Acceptable
review.reviewText: Situation and Staff is good..Roums should be better and also I dont want to pay more many than hotel for parking...
review.positiveRemarks: Reception Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Free Parking
review.locationRemarks: Acceptable

review.title: A nice hotel in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: I was at a conference at the hotel and it was a good place to stay. I usually stay near Union square but this was a nice change of pace.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable. The hotel is located `quite centrally with good access to transportation. Good food nearby and a safe feeling evening environment in the neighborhood.

review.title: Bad Service. Overpriced
review.reviewText: The light in the bathroom was flicking on and off. I called the staff to fix it when i went to lunch, came back it didnt turn on at all. Called again, and they fixed it 3 hours later. I had to take a shower in the dark. Asked a friend how much he paid at the Westin. I paid more than double. Way too much for this old hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good
review.negativeRemarks: Service!

review.title: Quiet
review.reviewText: Loved the Sauna in our room. Peaceful, and had just the right amenities
review.locationRemarks: Great to walk the neighborhood

review.title: Another content stay
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff. Valet parking was $40/night, but much more convenient then parking under ground and walking around the block. Great location, pretty much in the middle of everything in San Francisco.

review.title: Peaceful environment and lovely experience
review.reviewText: The staff was very courteous and the room was lovely. Used the fitness center and for a smal fitness center, it had adequate equipment and was very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Very energy efficient which impressed me - keycard activating many of the electrical outlets, request to indicate usage of linens, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking because of space limitations is VERY expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Walking around Japantown was convenient - lots of places to vist.

review.title: Elevator
review.reviewText: Need to fix the broken elevator, too long of a wait for a crowded hotel
review.positiveRemarks: Ambience
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: a little rundown but ti did the job
review.reviewText: The staff were very nice. The room was comfortable but rundown. There was a lot of chipped wood, it just needs a little revamp. The a/c in my friends room was a little testy so it was warm in there.

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and appreciated the kind staff. I thought the showering/bathing area was a bonus! The $8 bottles of water were out of my budget and I wished the water was complimentary. The Kabuki Spa can't be skipped - it is such a special gem in the middle of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: the showering area
review.negativeRemarks: free bottles of water
review.locationRemarks: Loved the spa!

review.title: Pleasant stay in a superb location
review.reviewText:
This hotel has a lovely, bright lobby overlooking a pretty zen garden, which creates a great first impression. The staff is professional and helpful and the location is superb. Fillmore Street, which is nearby, is full of interesting shops, bars and restaurants, if Japanese fare is not what you're looking for.

Our room was good and had a great view overlooking the city. I enjoyed the Japanese-style soaker tub. The bed was comfortable and linens nice.

Recommended. I'd stay at the Kabuki again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, zen garden, soaker tub

review.title: Someplace other than Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Staff pleasant and helpful. At check-in was upgraded to corner room and offered a small bottle of wine when cute young girl helping us was told it was my friend's birthday.
Room was clean and large enough. Very light with corner windows. Comfortable bed. Furniture in need of updating but overall a good experience

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText:
We glad we found this clean and elegant hotel and we can add only positive comments.
But unfortunately, we did not know about the Cherry Blossoms Festival in the area the day we arrived there, the roads were blocked and we had to wait for a few hours when the access to hotel was finally opened.
review.positiveRemarks: Big bathroom and mirrors and crispy clean linens.
review.locationRemarks: It was safe with plenty of places to go.

photos.caption: Our Room, Queen sized Bed and a nice view

review.title: Fantastic Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Fantastic room, clean, beautiful view and in a nice area! Would stay here again and recommend staying here!
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and the neighbor is nice. There are plenty of good places to eat and shop in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: the mini bar was too temping
review.locationRemarks: It's fantastic! Kabuki is connected to the mall with plenty of interesting shops & nice restaurants...Isobune is a great place to try with sushi boats

review.title: Perfect San Francisco location!
review.reviewText:
This is my second time here at the Kabuki and highly recommend it to everyone!!
Friendly staff and great views from the 16th floor!
review.positiveRemarks: The soaking bath!!
review.negativeRemarks: The tv, bad reception but that was okay!
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Japan-town in San Francisco!

review.title: Hotel Kabuki
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here many many times and every time have enjoyed the hotel primarily because of the location.
Every time we stay here the biggest complaint is the staff does not go out of their way to do anything extra to make your stay more enjoyable. That being said we did not have any water in the room(bottled as is normal) and no snack tray or wine opener. When I notified the front desk they brought the wine opener, but first argued with me that it must be in the room with the snack tray.They never did bring the snack tray. The heat seemed to be pre- set at 72 and when I notified them that I was cold in the room and could not get the heat to kick on I was told they would send an engineer up. That never happened in the 4 days we were there and we brought it up again the day before we checked out. This was the biggest complaint.
On the up side this is the first time upon arrival we were asked if it was a special occasion. My husband said it was our 30th anniversary they upgraded us to a corner room which I believe was a larger bed(king size). they also offered us a bottle of wine. Very nice touch and very much appreciated.
The main thing about this particular hotel is it seems to be geared towards the Japanese clientele and the prices for the room service and restaurant certainly reflect this. Valet parking is outrageous. The key with booking this hotel is to know your way around the area and try outside restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: location and ability to find free parking if you're willing to walk.
review.negativeRemarks: over priced. not attentive to guests requests.
review.locationRemarks: nice location near fillmore street and lot's of good restaurants close by.

review.title: Great hotel for a little getaway
review.reviewText: Me and my boyfriend very much enjoyed our stay at hotel kabuki. Our room was nicely decorated and we had a nice view of Japan town.
review.positiveRemarks: location and decorations
review.negativeRemarks: size of room
review.locationRemarks: right in the heart of Japan town, close to all attractions

review.title: Nice Hotel with Japanese Touches
review.reviewText: This hotel provides a unique experience with its Japanese influenced design in the room and lobby. The restaurant is also nicely designed with a great, reasonably priced for San Francisco breakfast buffet (full buffet $20).
review.locationRemarks: Near Japantown in San Francisco, good public transportation nearby.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki
review.reviewText:
Rooms were clean, house keeping was excellent, hotel desk service was really good too. Like the location, fun to walk the East and West mall.

Parking, handicap in front of the Hotel was $46 a night. When parking in the garage, you walk up about 15 stairs and your at the elevator to the hotel. The down side is if your handicap you might not be able to get up the stairs.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking to the mall, hotel service and cleanliness was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, handicap in front of the Hotel was $46 a night. Parking in the garage, you walk up about 15 stairs and your at the elevator to the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Some quirks but well positioned and comfortable
review.reviewText:
We arrived early for our check in as we had an early flight, and despite the front desk putting a rush on our room, it was still almost 3 hours before we could check in. The hotel itself was well located in the middle of Japan town. The hotel staff gave us a couple of food recommendations which were okay but nothing I'd recommend. We were two friends staying in a 2 doubles room, and found it a little unnerving that the shower had only a
Glass door in front of it. Our balcony also spanned two rooms, which we shared with some very noisy, heavy smoking people. Other than things few quirks, the hotel was super clean and well presented, the oriental touches were perfect. Our only negative experiences were not really the fault of the hotel itself, but just things that were a bit strange ( like having a smoking and non smoking room share a balcony.)
review.positiveRemarks: The view
review.negativeRemarks: A smoking and non-smoking room sharing a balcony
review.locationRemarks: Very central to Japan town

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText: We liked the location. The staff was super friendly. The only thing that left a sour taste was the expired Sake in the room..the sake was 5 months over its use by date. I guess its alcohol so it should be OK...but I think they need to pay more attention to these details

review.title: Go somewhere else!
review.reviewText: Parking is a nightmare, 35.00. A night. Then if you need to leave early, as we did, to catch a flight, they charge you another fee of 50.00' to open the gates. BIG RIP OFF! The night attendant is an idiot. Hotel was ok, nothing great. Restaurant was closed on Mondays. Valet never offered to help with luggage, in or out. Would not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Joe, Jose.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: It's ok

review.title: Easy Parking, big and clean rooms. Quiet too!
review.reviewText: This was our second night in one of the Joie de Vivre hotels (first night was in Hotel Tomo). This hotel is in much better condition and the decor is simple and clean. Self-parking is not as complicated as you might expect, since the entrance to the main parking garage is on Post, with a dedicated entrance to the hotel in the garage.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the linens...the towels were like teddy bears
review.locationRemarks: Japantown is a bit of a walk to the rest of town. Best to get a day pass for the bus, which can also be used for the cable cars... or just take a cab

review.title: Best Hotel in Japan Town Area
review.reviewText: This was our third visit to the San Francisco Japan Town area and we had stayed previously at another, nearby hotel. The Kabuki Hotel was more luxurious, from the kind parking attendant, conscientious front desk personnel, and beautiful and well-kept room. Our window overlooked the Japan Town plaza and we enjoyed the warm sunlight that filtered through the beautiful shoji screens. Unfortunatley, there was only a 12 inch patio so you couldn't truly enjoy and experience the view. But, we didn't go to San Francisco to look out of our hotel window. The Kabuki Hotel was a nice place to return home from our trips to the museums and shops.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for Japan Town access.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small and expensive valet parking, but can self-park downstairs for half the price.

review.title: Great hotel with draw backs

review.negativeRemarks: bar/restaurant closed two days, sofa bed bad, walls not really sound proof
review.locationRemarks: There is a bus going down town, but it ist quite far to walk, which contradicts the impression when the hotel says it is in the Union Square area.

review.title: Zen Haven-like Hote in the center of San Francisco

The hotel itself is nice enough, though it's getting a little old and worn and in need of some renovation. Aside from having thin walls and being a little dated, the desk staff and cleaning staff are top notch, and all do a great job of making you feel welcomed and comfortable.

review.title: Convenient and Well located

Garbage smell in hallways and room407

Former Miyako Hotel became Hotel Kabuki.

review.title: Good people, good energy!
review.reviewText: Freddie was awesome! He provided all the transportation we needed, especially on New Year's Eve when it was very difficult to find. Hotel location is great.

review.title: great hotel in the City
review.reviewText: Great place very clean, nice service, fast elevators, Staff very helpful
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Kabuki wabi sabi- some rough edges / good location
review.reviewText:
our king with a view was on the 12th floor. my first impression was that the room was a bit worn but the Japanese flavor of some of the room decor was quite nice. (wish there was an explanation of the shoji screen imagery.) some small negatives: The deep tub was great but the cold water faucet was very hard to turn and the toilet handle made flushing a trying experience. amenities were just okay. the coffee tray had to be taken out and put in front of the tv to plug in. coffee filter packs were not very good. be careful about the parking charges -- they add up to almost $40 a day and we were charged double three of the four days... but this was corrected after I pointed out the problem. the bed was very comfortable but lacked enough blankets yet when we pulled out the spare blanket the maid kindly made up the bed with the blanket each following day. the hotel restaurant is only open mornings and evenings... but there are plenty of nearby Japanese restaurants.
check out the amazing Japanese hardware store across the street. the staff--especially housekeeping--was quite good. we lost a small computer item in the bedding and miraculously the staff was able to find it and bring it up to the room in less than a half hour the next day.

review.title: Good hotel for business traveler
review.reviewText: Get an inside room. It is very noisy on the street side.
review.positiveRemarks: Supreme shower, comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast service
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Helpful and Friendly Staff!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the heart of Japantown (one of the safer locations in San Francisco), and is very convenient spot if you want to explore SF. The staff there were extremely helpful and courteous when it came to service, and I recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone who is planning on making a trip up north. Parking is always a hassle, but I highly recommend parking the car in the shopping center garage connected to the hotel. Word on the street is that South of Geary Street is very dangerous, so DO NOT park there or near there--tourists, please be cautious!

review.title: Toilet paper thin walls
review.reviewText: very thin walls - can hear outdoor noise and all the conversations in the adjoining rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: beautiful decor
review.negativeRemarks: rooms not sound proof
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Serenity
review.reviewText: I greatly enjoy the style of a traditional Japanese hotel room, from the clean design to the shower/sunken tub room. The staff was very friendly and the location is wonderful, connecting directly to Japan Center and blocks from Fillmore.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable and relaxing rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing opens for coffee nearby before 7:00am.
review.locationRemarks: Being connected to Japan Center and only a few blocks from Fillmore restaurants and shopping is ideal.

review.title: Good hotel near Civic Center, in Japantown.
review.reviewText: Room was very spacious, but needs some updating as it is showing some wear and tear. Overall, for the price and location it was a good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and large room.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is showing it needs updating.

review.title: Overcharged for shuttle; otherwise fine
review.reviewText: The shower was awesome, the room was fine. A lot of the hardware seemed old, which didn't bother me but might be disappointing for some folks. The thing that made me unhappy was that the gentleman who arranged my hotel shuttle overcharged me by $10 (he asked for $16 up front, but wrote out the ticket as though I'd payed a $6 deposit and still had a $10 balance to cover in the morning). Other than that, the hotel was unremarkable but pleasant (reasonably clean, quiet, free (slow) wifi).

review.title: beautiful but few essentials missing
review.reviewText: i was disappointed the room did not have a refrigerator. the bathroom was missing small wash cloths and a shower cap. otherwise, it is a beautiful hotel.

review.title: TERRIFIC HOTEL.
review.reviewText: Great value. Understated Japanese elegance. Spacious room with balcony and view, huge bathroom with soaking tub. Room included access to Kabuki Spa which was serene and relaxing. Very comfortable bed. Terrific, friendly staff. Polite clientele. Great location. Safe neighborhood. Easy access to Pacific Heights, Marina, Downtown & Castro. I could not have been more pleased.

review.title: needs some work
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at this hotel many times over the years. We love the Japanese motif, especially the deep tubs and roomy showers. Being in the middle of Japan town is wonderful with all the great food and culture. We stay in the corner rooms which are roomy and usually have great views.

Unfortunately I think the hotel could use a little updating and/or refurbishing. The furniture is getting pretty worn and saggy (though the bed was great). We didn't get the little amenities that we used to, like robes, sandals, and the little bath stool. The third night we were there the heater wouldn't work and there was no one in the hotel that could fix it nor were we offered another room. We were reimbursed for the night but that didn't really make up for the cold damp room in the morning. I also think they could get rid of the stupid mini bar an stuff and maybe provide a little refrigerator and a decent ice bucket. I know it is location location but ..........

review.title: Great Hotel for anyone.
review.reviewText: It was central to all the events of this particular trip to San Fran - I even had time to enjoy the spa/baths, shopping in the mall and sushi.

review.title: price reasonable for stayed.
review.reviewText: I like this hotel, closed to the Japanese town, easy to find thing around, shopping, market, restaurant.....we stayed at the top floor , quiet and nice.If I ever visit San Francisco, I think I will stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: convenience.

review.title: Not for large families
review.reviewText:
Staff overall is ok. Nothing to complain about but nothing to rave about either. The room is again, just okay. They have all the essential ammenites except for clothes storage. They have a tiny closet for just hanging your clothes but not one single dresser. We've stayed there 3 times in different categories & all 3 rooms had no dresser. I had to take out the bibles out of the night stand drawer to place my clothes.
The bright side is that there is a super market & lots of little eateries nearby. It is a fairly quiet & safe neighborhood but it is a little distant from all the SF popular sites so, car or taxi is must to get there.
review.positiveRemarks: The pub like restaurant ( Izakaya) in the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Not having sufficient clothes accommodations
review.locationRemarks: JapanTown

review.title: Positive experience!
review.reviewText: Very wonderful overall experience. Check-in and checkout process a little lengthy. Waitress for breakfast not friendly at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Internet service
review.negativeRemarks: The waitress at breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: NIce and quiet
review.reviewText: Clean room, friendly staff, deep bathtub. Breakfast could be better and the location was not too convenient for night life.

review.title: Great Value at a Great Location
review.reviewText:
We checked in after getting stranded due to Hurricane Sandy. The front desk staff was super polite and very helpful with regards to explaining the parking situation and providing a map of the city and suggestions on what to do. The rooms are decently sized and very well maintained. They also offer FREE wifi to all guests and we had a pretty strong signal in our room. Our only complaint is that the bed and pillows did not provide as much support as we've had in other hotels. Also the walls and doors are thin so we were woken up by drunk neighbors.

The hotel is located in Japan town and is in walking distance to the shops on Fillmore St and Union St. The hotel is connected to the Japan town mall and city parking so you can access both without going outside. The mall has great restaurants, cute shops, and even a small day spa.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Conveniently located.
review.negativeRemarks: Paper thin walls. We were woken up by other noisy guests in the hallway.
review.locationRemarks: In Japan town. Walking distance to great Asian restaurants and shopping areas.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Great staff. The only down side was the room was too warm and could not be adjusted by us, had to enllist the staff (didn't know this was the process). The view was beautiful but we shared the balcony with the next room. But I would stay at this hotel again, reasonable rates, clean, nice neighborhood, and the staff were very accomodating and professional.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor and staff
review.negativeRemarks: Room too warm
review.locationRemarks: Great location and safe area

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText:
Love it Love It ! This hotel is amazing. Too many thinngs
To try and tell you all about this special kept little secret of a hotel..
review.positiveRemarks: The deep jap soacking tubes

review.title: Great value in a central location
review.reviewText: Great place in a good location if you head north not south!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice overall feel and clean rooms
review.locationRemarks: good location with nice shops and food down the street

review.title: Great Hotel for an overnight get away
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, staff was wonderful!!! Loved the jacuzzi bath tub. IT was a relaxing and inviting environment. Will stay there again
review.positiveRemarks: The staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great loacation

review.title: Good choice for UCSF medical center visitors
review.reviewText: Stayed one night to attend a meeting at UCSF Cancer Research Center. It was very convenient to walk to the center. The lobby is very nice and upgraded. Parking is not very good. Valet service is $40. I was upgraded to a suite and the suite was very spacious, functional and the bed was clean and comfortable. Room was very quite. It is an older hotel with not much renovation in the rooms but it is functional.

review.title: kabuki
review.reviewText: We arrived and I asked for the parking, they said it was included and to give my keys to the valet. The night valet guy would hand us the keys and send us to get our car ourselves. The shower didn't drain, the sleep by numbers bed didn't work and was like sleeping on cement, you can't adjust the temperature yourself and the bathroom door is slotted. They charged me for valet then reversed the charges to self parking because I never asked for valet. The room was clean though

review.title: Great Location and Quiet Hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect, Quiet Location in Japanese Town with nice staffs! Just two to three blocks away to Van Ness Street in order to take public transportation to everywhere! But parking fee $35 per night plus tax 15% which was very expensive! Room as cleanliness but still having smoking smell with OLD stylish decoration condition. Restroom is very cleanliness. However, this hotel room needs some re-model on wall paper and lighting fixture as well.

review.title: Good and safe area for a family stay.
review.reviewText: Good hotel for a family stay.Direct access to Japantown center.A pleasant stay with the family.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to Japantown and
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were hard.
review.locationRemarks: Safeway,movie theater and restuarants in close proximty.

review.title: remodel needed.
review.reviewText: I lived in San Francisco several years ago and return often to viiit. I have stayed at hotel kabuki many times. I must say that I was extremely disappointed this stay. The room was very unkept. Vallay parking was less to be desired. I will not be returning.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Japan in The Bay Area without traveling the miles.
review.reviewText: Visiting from NYC on a solo trip to San Francisco, CA I was a bit nervous staying in an area I was very unfamiliar with. I arrived quite late at night from a full day of traveling and was very pleasantly surprised by hotel location and ambiance of the lobby. It felt like I just arrived in Japan. I was excited to get up to my room. It was perfect. It was cozy, clean and quiet. Exactly what I needed. I didnt have any problems at all and wish I was able to live there. I also had dinner in the restaurant in the lobby and the service and food was also very good. My stay was only for two nights. I was sad I had to checkout. Without hesitation I will definitely return. I look forward to it.
review.positiveRemarks: ambiance, location, fast wifi.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to Union Square shopping area and all tourist hot spots

review.title: Visiting Japan Town
review.reviewText: The staff was pretty marginal. The Valet was great. Room Service was non-existent. They leave a menu in the room, but nobody picks up the phone and they do not return the call...so hence, went to bed very hungry. The hotel is located in a great area and it overall was ok. I would stay there again because I love being in the heart of Japan Town.
review.positiveRemarks: The Valet
review.negativeRemarks: Room Service
review.locationRemarks: GREAT!!!

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText:
Room was attractive, the bathroom spacious. Courteous staff, with free amenities including
newspapers, tea and coffee, local phone calls.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
The room I had a moldy smell to it. The bed was not very comfortable and you have to stick your room card in a light socket to get electricity in your room.

But most disappointing was that the hotel did not have a bar and no restaurant open on Sunday or Monday. I wanted to watch a baseball game at a bar and get some food but I had to leave hotel and walk down the street to find a place to eat and have a drink. But there was no sound on the TV at the restaurant/bar I had to walk to so I ended up eating chips and watching the game in my room. A major hotel should have a bar/lounge on the premises.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: No bar on property and no restaurant open. Smelly room.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.title: Great location and price
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasing stay at Hotel Kabuki. We were in San Francisco celebrating our anniversary and the hotel staff took great care of us. We were able to check in early and the front desk staff was very helpful in making suggestions on how to get around the area and what to see. The room was a bit small, but clean and the bed was very comfortable and had ample pillows. We loved the double shower and the decor. We would definately stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, garden, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Doors in the bathroom bumped together
review.locationRemarks: Japantown, San Francisco - very close to Union Square and Chinatown

review.title: A gem!
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki is delightful, quiet, and wonderfully located. Recommended!

review.title: Hotel Kabuki good but . . .
review.reviewText:
I gave the Hotel Kabuki high marks but I wasn't totally pleased with all aspects of the hotel.

First the "gym" was nothing more than a light exercise room. There was minimal weight lifting equipment. Granted most people aren't interested but I'm a gym rat and I'm accustomed to lifting weights at least 4 times a week.

Second the hotel wi-fi is an unsecured network maintained by a third party. On arrival I had to contact the third party to get an initial connection. Repeatedly I got pop up screens wanting me to upgrade to a higher capacity network. Based on the prices for these rooms the upgraded wi-fi should be standard.
review.positiveRemarks: A quiet, clean hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The wi-fi and gym.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located in Japantown a good location within walking distance of some good restaurants.

review.title: Japan for the people not living in Japan.
review.reviewText: Was a very nice hotel with alot of japanese antiques. Reminded me alot about staying in Japan. Would love to stay again.

review.title: good hotel for a city visit
review.reviewText: Very quite. A nice lounge and restaurant area. Good all around facility
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: Japan Town is near most everything

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff was extremely pleasant to deal with. Bathroom is a bit dated, but clean and shower water pressure excellent. My biggest complaint was the super hardness of the mattress. The room could have been cleaner , debris and dust under tables and in corners.
The rooms are large and well appointed. Flat screen TV , but small size.
Compared to similarly priced hotels I would stay here again
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Hard bed
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Awsome Shower
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the 5 foot square steam showers, they are incredible! the worst thing about he room was the carpet not horrible but certainly not pleasant. overall a petty nice place.
review.positiveRemarks: Shower
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet
review.locationRemarks: Japan town very little american conviences with in walking distance

review.title: Good hotel if you like Japanese & Korean food
review.reviewText: Hotel is ideally situated in Japantown, the old wing we stayed in was a bit dated but nonetheless clean and the room is a good size. good value for money on what we pay for. Will stay there again.

review.title: Bad acoustic insulation, TV not working
review.reviewText:
back acoustic insulation of the windows => noise from the street.

TV was not working

Electric appliances not easy to turn on

review.title: Great Japanese style hotel
review.reviewText: This was my 3rd time at this hotel, and it was wonderful as usual.

review.title: Very happy with experience.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Parking and food quite pricey though the room service we ordered was amazing. Room was very clean and spacious. Would not recommend paying more for a balcony - it is the size of a shoe box and is shared with the room next to yours. Location is handy, easy walk to Union Square. Overall we were pleased with the experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The food - both the steak and salmon dish from the room service menu were fantastic!
review.negativeRemarks: Balcony being adjoined to the room next-door.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location, easy walk to Union Square.

review.title: Just a very pleasant stay...
review.reviewText: Excellent valet parking/reception service. No problems overall. Took previous reviewers' advice to request an upper floor to avoid street noise and that was a good choice. Really nice place and we fully enjoyed it.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese zen feeling. Service.
review.locationRemarks: I prefer this location i Japantown to higher priced hotels near Union Square but then, I had a car so I was able to drive to where I wanted to go.

review.title: Kabuki
review.reviewText: Loved it it was a really co place to stay in Japan town I really recommend it it's close to everything
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and bath
review.locationRemarks: Japan town is awesome!!

review.title: Felt like a visit to Japan. Very nice.
review.reviewText: Kids loved the deep tub and spa shower. Our toilet was not level and slanted to the right. Also, we did not have enough towels (for two adults and two children) and I left housekeeping a note asking for more. They left one additional towel which was kind of annoying. The hotel over all is very cute with Japanese decor. There is a beautiful little garden and koi pond outside the lobby which the kids also really enjoyed. We'll definitely stay here again and I'll just call down for extra towels as soon as we get to the room.
review.locationRemarks: Japan town. All the nearby restaurants seemed to be Japanese or Korean. We never tried the hotel restaurant.

review.title: Comfortable overall
review.reviewText: I will book the hotel again in future visit of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: the comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: fair

review.title: A great Japanese experience !!
review.reviewText:
It is a great spice, No, no, no, it is a great Wasabi for our vacation in San Francisco.
It is more Japanese than a Japanese owned hotel in Union Square.
It is a ZEN world.
review.positiveRemarks: A Japanese bath, "Furo" setting.
review.negativeRemarks: a bit old infrastructure
review.locationRemarks: Interesting Japan Town

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText: This was the first time we stayed in San Francisco, our daughter recommended Hotel Kabuki. Check-in was very easy, everyone was helpful and everyone spoke good English. We had reserved a non-smoking king size bed with a corner balcony. The bathtub was very deep, as had been mentioned and the water power was forceful-this was great. My husband is over 6 foot tall and would prefer a shower, he was disappointed that the showerhead was lower on the wall. Our room had a smaller flatscreen tv, which was not facing the bed. There was 1 comfortable chair, 1 desk chair and a chaise in the room. I would have preferred the tv facing the bed or having 2 comfortable chairs. The room was pretty spacious, but the rooms were not very soundproof. We ate breakfast in the hotel dining room once, food was good but over priced, as is everything in San Francisco. The bus stops were very close to the hotel. The front desk were always helpful in telling us which bus to get on to go to our destination or advising which restaurants in the area were good. It was nice staying just outside of the busy areas, but not too far from the bus stops. We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Kabuki and San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: size of room, location, being next to the mall with an entrance into the mall from the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Smaller tv, shower head not high enough, price of breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good, near the bus stops so you could still get to all attractions in very little amount of time.

review.title: Perfect Hotel for a Stay in Japan Town or Bay Area
review.reviewText: Super cute hotel located right in Japan Town. It has an excellent Izakaya (bar/restaurant) and conveniently has an exit right into the Japan Town mall which is full of shops and restaurants far beyond what I would have imagined. The staff are all excellent and the whole hotel is filled with an amazing atmosphere to match the surrounding area.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to Japan Town and nearby landmarks. As well as excellent rooms with soaking tubs. The parking is cheap considering the city as well!

review.title: Nice hotel for weekend get-away
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and located in a good area to visit attractions. It is also very close to a well known Jazz club in JapanTown (walking distance). I would use the hotel again on my next trip to San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was well trained and very helpful in giving directions/information about attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was on the small side.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Short mass transit ride to attractions. No rental car needed!

review.title: Centrally located botique hotel with great beds
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel located in Japantown adjacent to the mall. Underground self parking was available under the mall. Signage was clear and easy to find both parking and hotel. Conveniently located for shopping and sightseeing. We had a Western style room and the beds were really comfortable. Overall, we had a great time.

review.title: Clean, Great Staff, good value. Two thumbs up.
review.reviewText: We stayed here as a last minute getaway to SF to watch a ball game. Japan town is a little out of the way, but I would stay here again for sure. The staff was very helpful, attentive, and friendly! Room was clean, and a good size for a room in San Fran. We did not dine on site or use any room service. The beds were comfortable. I liked the area around the hotel as it appearded very clean and well kept. The only drawback would maybe be that it was not within walking distance of the places where we were going so we had to taxi it. Overall a nice place for a good price.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly Staff, Clean, good size rooms"

review.title: Unique and Interesting
review.reviewText: Unique and interesting hotel - Great rooms with awesome amenities, and some of the best desk staff in the business. Expensive, but probably comparable for the SF area.

review.title: Good Japanese hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in Japan Town section of San Francisco. The staff was very helpful. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. The shower door leaked badly, but otherwise the room was fine. Valet parking was unusually expensive but otherwise we were very pleased.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese calm
review.negativeRemarks: leaking shower door; high priced valet parking
review.locationRemarks: Japan Town is interesting and near many of SF's best neighborhoods.

review.title: Not too shabby.
review.reviewText: They were painting the hotel, so the garden area remained closed off to me. The views were nice. The accomodations were comfortable and clean, but not amazing. It was a little expensive for what it was - a refurbished hotel undergoing a facelift. Service was decent and polite, but nobody went the extra mile to really help me.
review.positiveRemarks: The view.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Japantown, adjacent to the mall. Good shopping, and good food, if you like Japanese. You'll have to walk a bit to find other cuisine.

review.title: superb
review.reviewText: Small, cozy, but intimate room. The hotel is conveniently located in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: the shoji, the shower area that has both the tub & just the regular faucet
review.negativeRemarks: no parking
review.locationRemarks: very conveniently located

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: My wife and I were very happy with this choice. Hotel was clean and pleasant. Location was quiet and on a short bus ride to downtown. Unexpected bonus was the proximity of the beautiful shops and restaurants along Fillmore Street. We enjoyed Japantown as well
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great. Fillmore Street is great. Hotel was clean and convenient.
review.locationRemarks:
Location was great. Fillmore Street is great.
Short bus ride to downtown.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The first room I was assigned had soaking wet carpet. A return to the same clerk at the front desk lead to his giving me a second room - when I went to that room there was a guest already checked into it, with suitcase and clothes spread out on bed, etc. The third room was fine. The same clerk at the front desk told me an address I was seeking was a 10 minute walk and when I returned later for specific directions another desk clerk told me it was too far to walk and helped me get a cab - the second clerk was correct, the cab ride was 20 minutes and about 5 miles! The problematic desk clerk left me a gift of apology in my room - one that was too bulky for me to pack but nonetheless was well-intentioned. There was also considerable noise due to the outside of the hotel being painted. I would hesitate to stay again although it was well-located and likely would have been quiet.

review.title: enjoy the furo
review.reviewText: You've got to spend time enjoying the Japanese bath
review.positiveRemarks: location, efficient staff, furo

review.title: Great japanese themed hotel for exploring S F
review.reviewText:
I was travelling with 4 teenagers so it's hard to find a room to accommodate 5 comfortably, but the Kabuki was perfect for us... We got a great deal on expedia on an executive sauna suite, had a cute little private sauna and Japanese bath as well as great shower. The room was really clean and spacious until we installed a rollaway bed and had the sofabed made up! There was a king size bed enclosed within paper screen sliding doors.
You can park in the Japan center car park one floor down from the hotel, has its own access to the hotel via lifts, and we had breakfast in the coffee shop in the adjacent mall, which had lots of hello kitty type shops to entertain the kids. There's also a multiplex cinema next door. The hotel is great for buses around San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Style & comfort
review.negativeRemarks: Minimal staffing - didn't bother us but others might prefer more attention!
review.locationRemarks: Great location with convenient mall and car park

review.title: PLEASANT, CLEAN(!) STAY
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff !!! THe room was clean and comfortable. THe bathroom was marvelous!!

review.title: Title
review.reviewText: The bath tub was uncomfortable and the balcony didn't have a patio or chair to sit and enjoy the gorgeous weather.
review.locationRemarks: Loved all the delicious places to eat around the area.

review.title: not worth your money!
review.reviewText:
first impressions make it or break it!!!
we got there on our Harley Davidson and pulled up to a hotel registration spot, we were immediately rudely asked to move our bike to a walkway.
while this was all happening two other employees spoke in japanese and laughed as they pointed at us, this made us feel unconfortable, we had not only made a reservation but had already payed for a night at this hotel.
we had payed for fours guests and there was only 1 robe, no bed runner on neither bed.
the room "balcony" was shared with the room next door, giving very little pirvacy, the wall s were very thin and we could hear everything.
very dissapointed in this Boutique hotel, never going back or recommending it to a friend!!!!

review.title: Hotel Kabuki review
review.reviewText: Hotel is good for the price range. It's a small and comfy hotel. I picked it mostly because of the location and the garage close by. Hotel is in Japan Center. The Japan Center garage has elevators that go directly to the hotel lobby. Parking rate is only $19 a day. I just parked my car there and bought a bus pass in the Holiday Inn gift shop that's a few blocks away. (I did not pick Holiday Inn because the parking rate is $43 a day over there) Bus 38 and 38L has a stop just around the corner of the hotel. It takes you to downtown in only 15 min. There is also a lot of Japanese restaurants close by. My room was a double/double. Not very big but enough for me and my family. Condition is ok. At least it looks clean. We even got a city view. Overall, it was a very good experience for me. If I go to San Francisco again, I'll stay in Kabuki again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good. Public transportation is very convenient. Parking rate at Japan Center Garage is only $19 a day. Very good rate in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Closet is not very big
review.locationRemarks: Not too far from downtown. Bus 38 is just around the corner and it takes you to downtown in about 15 min. I did not drive at all.

review.title: My stay
review.reviewText: Staff was nice, room was fine, but when i booked it they said it had a pull out bed. Instead we had a small couch that an adult couldnt sleep on.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and look
review.negativeRemarks: couch / bed?
review.locationRemarks: it was easy to find and easy to park

review.title: Cute hotel and the theme does not feel slapped on
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel for an overnight stay based on Expedia reviews, and I was very happy. The room was very cute and had a good view (I did have the 16th floor though!!) Room was clean and everything was in good shape. Modern television with lots of inputs, desktop power and USB power as well. Hotel itself was nice and is attached to a large mall. Staff was very friendly except for one concierge who I'd only rate as somewhat friendly (I dealt with three of them) ;). Hotel has their own little car service which was about half the cost of taxi for short trips, they told me that includes airport runs but I didn't use it for the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and quiet
review.negativeRemarks: Walking up hill to get there ;)
review.locationRemarks: Well placed and attached to a large Japantown mall

review.title: A week in March at the Hotel Kabuki
review.reviewText: Everyone at the Hotel Kabuki was helpful and professional. The hotel itself was pleasant and our room was large and full of light from the windows. We enjoy Japan Town; it is quiet and clean and convenient to the MUNI.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and the Japanese decor
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant has a very expensive breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for getting about town . We took the bus everywhere

review.title: Unique space to spend a vacation
review.reviewText: Fun decor! Very clean. We liked it a lot and would recommend it to family and friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The unique decor and great shower/bathtub room!
review.negativeRemarks: The double bed room was a bit small.
review.locationRemarks: Fun Japantown location, but if you're not into sushi it can be challenging to find a kid friendly place to eat nearby.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Stayed a week and overall the Hotel Kabuki was great. Would have been greater if there was a small table in the room and a microwave would have been nice. Loud, obnoxious guests with a barking dog, and heavy smell of incense from the room across the hall one night, but the other 6 nights were quiet. Felt safe walking the neighborhood at night. Large selection of Japanese eateries close by, but also a wider variety of cuisine 2blocks away on Fillmore. Friendly, helpful staff. We would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, reasonable cost, well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: No table or microwave in room.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to public transportation. Reasonable parking (for SF) in adjacent lot.

review.title: JT
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay very much. Good value for a San Francisco hotel.

review.title: overall, it was pleasant stay.
review.reviewText:
Depends on floor, on lower levels traffic noise was loud even at night.

Parking fee for the hotel guests were hefty, $19 per day.

Nearby food court & shopping arcades were within easy access and that was plus.
review.positiveRemarks: location & experiencing different culture nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of beddings.
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: My review
review.reviewText:
The one thing I dislike the most is the scratchiness of the towels. I know that to completly sanitize them, almost all hotel towels are scratchy.
The other thing , which is not a big deal, is if one person is sitting at the desk working and another person come out of the bathroom and needs to go to the closet, the person at the desk has to get up and move to the side of the bed. Slight inconveince, but not enough to bring the rating down.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathroom layout.
review.negativeRemarks: The price
review.locationRemarks: I thought the location was fine. My wife on the other hand was not impressed. No place within walking distance to get a breakfast that was reasonable

review.title: Not a good hotel for business travel
review.reviewText: the hotel room had water marks so large they were bulging and pretty brown on the ceiling. Pretty Gross. Also, the hotel does not offer taxi service, and instead has a towncar service - which does not accept credit cards, so is basically useless for business travelers.

review.title: BAD EXPERIENCE
review.reviewText:
I booked the deluxe room with two double beds for four adults. arrived to find room to be extremely small and not acceptable for four people- no closets or place for luggage, no door to sink/shower portion of bathroom, no privacy. Also, I was not aware that our balcony was shared..so if your balcony door was open for fresh air at night, your room was open for your neighbours to come in! The air quality was very poor- no circulation or cool air coming in, hence us having the balcony door open....the end result was that our room smelled like fried foods, cigarettes and pot by morning!
I called Expedia to report our complaints and then spoke with the Hotel Manager that morning. He was very polite and tried to help but the only option was to move us to a family suite, which would have given us two rooms- one with a King size bed and an adjoining room with two tatame mats on the floor. Really? Not an acceptable option for accomodating four adults! We ended leaving the hotel after one night and moving to the Westin at considerable cost to us.
This hotel should NOT book rooms for four adults....they do NOT have acceptable rooms for more than two adult travelers.
On another note- the lobby of the hotel is very nice but the rooms show their age, with flaking paint, banged up walls and poor air quality. This does not seem like a 3.5 star hotel to me. Next time I will be way more careful when checking out 'deals' on Expedia!
review.positiveRemarks: None
review.negativeRemarks: Too many to list...
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Lovely, just fine hotel
review.reviewText:
All of the reviews for Hotel Kabuki were glowing, so I guess our expectations were too high. It is a great hotel, don't get me wrong. We had a lovely couple days there, but it isn't amazing. There was always someone really helpful at the front desk, they directed us to everything from perfect restaurants to the buses we needed to take. The room was clean and simple. The soaking tub was just a regular tub that was a little bit deeper than usual. The traffic outside was noisy and constant, since it is in between two main roads. I recommend a room higher up. I think the biggest disappointment was that we upgraded to a room with "a private patio" and sacrificed being higher up (where you share a patio) to have our own. Turns out the patio is just a sliding door with a footstep of a concrete square outside. No room for chairs or relaxing, just room enough to step outside and back in. The other negative was that it wasn't near a BART station so our plan to ride the BART into town from the airport ended up in a 2 mile uphill walk through not the nicest, optimistic parts of town.

We got a good price and are pleased with the experience, but not wowed and will probably look elsewhere for luxury next time we are in San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff offered really helpful dinner suggestions and traveling recommendations
review.negativeRemarks: The patio was not a patio and the traffic was loud
review.locationRemarks: Not BART accessible, but good restaurants within walking distance and buses give easy access to the rest of the city

review.title: Nice, pleasant hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at Kabuki and we were very pleased with this hotel. If you have a car with you park it at the Parking Center adjacent to the hotel and forget about till the day you live SF. It is only $19 for the whole stay, no in and out privileges though. Public transportation system in SF is superb, a lot better then driving. The room was extra clean, the bathroom is japanese style, the tub was clean enough to take a bath, not just a shower. Breakfast is too expensive on the premises but they are a lot of choices in 10 min walk around the hotel (Try Stacks).
review.positiveRemarks: the bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: the valet
review.locationRemarks: Japantown

review.title: Zen Experience
review.reviewText: Friendly, accommodating staff. Creative, Japanese decor and style. Great location. Relaxing atmosphere. Loved it!
review.positiveRemarks: The Zen decor.

review.title: Grande expérience
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly. The rooms and the views were very good. Television could use
more channels. (That's what you need when you have a comfortable room such as theirs)
Location was very good. Excellent neighborhood and yet close to the Geary bus line to get downtown and taxi's readily available to go somewhere in a hurry.
review.positiveRemarks: (1) a great location (Japan Town) (2) Very friendly staff (3) local neighborhood very goodThe
review.negativeRemarks: There were none of huge importance. I don't consider minor design flaws. They're not going to get fixed
review.locationRemarks: Japan town is a great place. I use to live close to this neighborhood. The "Filmore" at the bottom of the hill, adds variety to the mix.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki - SF - a small tourist escape
review.reviewText: Rooms were smaller than I expected although clean and comfortable. The hotel did not have air conditioning and the fan did not seem to provide a great deal of air so the room was stuffy and hot at night. One could open the window (sliding patio door) however the room next to ours shared the same balcony so it was not particularly safe to do so and the traffic noise was loud with the patio doors open. The view was fabulous, small beds but comfortable and clean. I loved the Japanese style bathroom. I was disappointed that the the hotel restaurant was not open on Sunday or Monday however there are several Japanese restaurants nearby. It was a good hotel for the price and the staff was very friendly although we did have to ask the cleaning staff for coffee or little items every morning they were more than happy to provide it.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff, view and Japanese decor.
review.negativeRemarks: stuffy rooms, hotel restaurant and bar closed Sunday and Monday.
review.locationRemarks: Japan town. We cabbed or walked most places, it is a bit out of the way of the usual tourist attractions but nice to be away from that.

review.title: a little tired
review.reviewText: The hotel is tired and the staff generally seem to be the same. Lifts are slow and prone to breaking down. It's a fair way from downtown - not an easy walk and cabs are necessary.

review.title: Perfect night in the City.
review.reviewText: Starting at the valet, he was so helpful, friendly and courteous. Then the check in was easy, and the room was ready, and everything was just perfect for our stay in SF. We had breakfast in the morning and it was delicious and the price was right. Couldn't have been a better stay. We had stayed there before and wanted to come back. We had our 50th high school reunion there 2 years ago, and they did an excellent job for us. I would stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Convenient. Easy parking, either valet or garage.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Not downtown.

review.title: Very Good hotel, skip the valet parking
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. Comfortable firm bed, good shower, nice aesthetics, quiet, good location IF Japantown appeals to you--it's literally connected to the plaza. Clean and reasonable. Carl the maintenance guy was AWESOME--we ran into him in the hallway and told him we had plugged our toilet (our fault) and he acted like we had made his day. He took care of it within 5 minutes.

Only caveat: valet parking is pretty much a rip-off. $40 to park your car in the outdoor tiny front lot 5 steps from the front door (who needs their car fetched from 5 feet away?) Go with the very reasonable overnight, underground covered parking associated with the plaza--again, *attached to* the hotel with an elevator from the parking levels to the main lobby--no stairs at all if you park on P2. 24 hours for $18. Pro-rated when you exit and enter. So much better.
review.positiveRemarks: Firm bed
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Japantown. Basically Central to all of SF.

review.title: Everything that can go wrong...
review.reviewText: ...did go wrong, at least that's what it seemed. Overall, the look and atmosphere of the hotel is nice and cute as a Japanese boutique hotel. We read about the recent renovations of the hotel through some of the reviews, so we were excited that we were going to get a nice room. First impression of the room, however, was just harbringer of bad things to come. The key card entrance was so beat up, it looked like it bore witness to WWII. The room itself, though spacious and clean, appeared like it was from the 1970's. Things continued to go downhill. First, the air conditioning system appeared from the 1950's. It was so old, that we couldn't at first figure it out and thought it was broken (it wasn't). The telephone didn't work initially (maintenance came and quickly fixed it - cord was not plugged in correctly). The last night we stayed, there was a big leak from the ceiling of our room (there was heavy rain), which prompted us to change rooms in the middle of the night (we received 2 free breakfast tickets for this inconvenience). The new one was much nicer...likely one of the newly renovated ones. Last, but not least, my daughter drank a drink from the mini-bar, then we then realized it was ONE YEAR expired (after she finished it). Overall, disappointing. Only positive thing was the location, right in the middle of a huge Japanese strip mall.
review.locationRemarks: Near Japanese strip mall with lots of restaurants and cute shops.

review.title: escape from LA
review.reviewText: TV was small. Bar had weird hours. Front desk staff was super nice and I would definitely stay here when I return to SF. Tranquility garden was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Tranquility Garden
review.negativeRemarks: Television in the room - Bar's weird hours
review.locationRemarks: Perfect - walking distance from so much neat stuff

review.title: Favorite in Japantown
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Kabuki (formerly the Miyako) several times. I find the location handy to downtown but somewhat removed from the noise and traffic. The hotel has been well maintained, though it does show some age. The location is also handy relative to Japantown, as the hotel is connected to a large shopping and restaurant mall and across the street from an open air shopping area. If you're a light sleeper and/or not an early riser, ask for an interior room as the backside of the hotel (which faces Laguna St.) is pretty active in the morning as the trash trucks and delivery trucks service the neighboring high-rise condo.
review.positiveRemarks: Japanese feel, service, access to Japantown, Union Square and downtown. For great sushi eat at KISS, one block away
review.negativeRemarks: A little noisy, small TV in room, lack of consistent cab service in the morning
review.locationRemarks: Attached to Japantown mall and great Japanese grocery.

review.title: Decent option
review.reviewText: Room furnishings are dated. No air conditioning, or at least it wasn't working. Relatively quiet location. Staff was friendly.

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText: Very clean. Great views of the city. Traditional Japanese decor and bathroom - character, clarity, rich yet minimalist. Age of the building shows through, however. Located in the heart of Japan town - walking distance from many Japanese restaurants, cafes, Kabuki spa and baths, etc. You can self-park in the garage (access from Geary) and take elevators to your room.

review.title: Nice neighborhood property
review.reviewText: Good value, nice rooms. Located in a neighborhood about a 10 minute taxi ride from Union Square and other tourist areas.
review.positiveRemarks: Large rooms, recently updated
review.negativeRemarks: Small TV, parking can be an issue. Valet/on site parking is limited and expensive, $35.00
review.locationRemarks: Nice neighborhood location but not in walking distance to traditional tourist areas. For some a plus, for others may be a negative.

review.title: Great vacation
review.reviewText: This place was amazing from the room to the parking attendants.

review.title: AWESOME!
review.reviewText: great hotel. friendly staff. awesome rooms! location is great. everthing was so close.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: room too close to ice machine and service elevator
review.locationRemarks: best of all that's japanese so many places to dine, shop and relax. massages just next door too.

review.title: Wonderful vacation in a wonderful place!
review.reviewText: Though I have been to the Bay Area a few times, this is the first time I have stayed in San Francisco proper, and the first time for the rest of the family, and when we go back, we will definitely stay at The Hotel Kabuki. It was convenient to all the places we wanted to go in the area, it was clean and well maintained and the staff was wonderful, from the front desk people who helped us with directions to the doorman who recommended the Japanese place in the attached mall (fantastic ramen and shabu shabu, BTW).
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location, the staff, the fact that it was in Japantown
review.negativeRemarks: Clearly the room cleaner hadn't done a thorough job of checking the mini fridge. A guest before us drank a water and then put back the empty bottle.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located, the hotel is close to just about anything you can think of.

review.title: So-So
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly, but AC didn't work in room and phone didn't work as well. Was only there for a few hours and then for sleeping. Pretty basic hotel; nothing special.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Get a room with a Japanese tub -- it's worth it!! Wonderful service and great location for events at the Fillmore. Easy parking and self-park is reasonable.

review.title: Needs a refresh/renovation.
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, great location, but needs a refresh. Feels old, nothing too bad though.

review.title: oo la la
review.reviewText: excellent choice
review.locationRemarks: japantown

review.title: Adjacent to Japan Town
review.reviewText: Obviously updated nicely themed older hotel. One open outlet other than bathroom, awkward bathroom layout. Beautiful shoji screens and geisha/warrior painted screens. Really convenient location with inexpensive, underground parking (didn't realize that was possible in San Francisco).

review.title: Fantastic for us!! Perfect location,close to everything! Clean and comfortable!
review.reviewText: My new husband and I had a wonderful time at Hotel Kabuki!!! We were there for our honeymoon and to see the Rip Curl surf contest in Ocean Beach. The hotel is located perfectly in between the beach and all the attractions of the city!! Parking was easy, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We used the gym facilities everyday. Our room was clean. And the restaurants in the the mall connected came in very handy when we didnt want to leave the parking garage later at night. We will for sure go back!!!
review.locationRemarks: Everything and everywhere you have time to do in your stay!! We even drove to Lake Tahoe for a night! If your that far from home, do it all!!

review.title: japantown is a great location for city manuvering.
review.reviewText: Terrific hotel overall. The staff has always been very helpful. The location is centrally located in the city. As a single woman traveling, I feel very comfortable in Japantown. I will stay hear again. Oh if your not use to Japanese style bathrooms, ask the desk persons how to work the shower and bath controls.
review.locationRemarks: Haoantiwn

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and staff was helpful. The only fault we had is there is no room service or place to get food on Monday and Tuesday. There is no parking at the hotel but the attached city garage is convenient and is cheaper than most hotels in the city.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown was nice.

review.title: Great hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hotel Kabuki for 2 nights only. The room was very bright and spacious with a separate bedroom to the lounge area. The room even had it's own sauna! It's situated right in the middle of Japan town near the malls. There are some promising Japanese resturants in the area which we didn't get the chance to try out on our short stay. The area is very safe compared to a lof ot San Francisco.
Public transport was a bit hard to use but if you bring a good pair of walking shoes and feel like a brisk walk, you can walk to some locations. We walked to Grace Catherdral and then Chinatown right after we checked in! We had access to a car and Filmore street was a short drive (if not walk) with great boutiques and cafes.
Overall we had a great time in SF and Hotel Kabuki!

review.title: Cute, Comfortable
review.reviewText: It's a cute place, and it's very comfortable. We spent 2 wonderful nights there.

review.title: like to go back there
review.reviewText: We would like to go back there on 10/31/11 with the same rate, but they don't accept my reservation with that rate, can you help me with that...it's so convenient to Japan Town and the food there are goooooood....

review.title: Terry's Kabuki review
review.reviewText: If you find yourself having stuff to do around Japan town in San Francisco..the Kabuki is an awesome place to stay. Great appointments in the room remind be of some of the nicer hotels I have stayed at in Tokyo.

review.title: I LOVE Japantown!
review.reviewText: I was surprised that the hotel was older than I expected. I thought it was pricey until I found out we had a sauna in our room! Our friends had the king suite with balconies/view, which was a better room to hang out in, but I loved our sauna. That feature plus the location would bring me back. We ate shabu shabu for dinner and got a private karaoke room across the street. We didn't leave a few block radius because the location was so fantastic. I highly recommend it!

review.title: A Touch of Japan in the U.S.
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel in the heart of Japantown. Love that it's connected to the Japanese mall. The deep soak tubs are heaven.

review.title: San francisco amazing....pity hotel was disappointing
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel as I had never stayed in japantown in SF before. It was a mistake. It looks ok from the outside but I must confess that it's a little tatty inside which I am not used to. The gym was poorly maintained, the bedrooms noisy and to be honest the place is very overprice for what it is. Breakfast is $20 a day which seemed to put off a number of guests. The windows of my refurbished king room were filthy and the room could hardly be described as a king size. It was vastly overpriced for what it was and I have never been disappointed with booking thru expedia who I rate highly, but this was not a great hotel. It's 12 blocks from union square for those who are looking for somewhere close to the action, this is not the place. Great muni provision tho which is just as well. Overall a bit disappointed. Certainly was not worth the amount of money I had paid.

review.title: a quiet peaceful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the quiet surrounds of Japanese Center and although further from downtown than anticipated the 38 bus in Geary St had you downtown in minutes. A peaceful pleasant place to stay surrounded by quality restaurants.

review.title: Minor updates needed
review.reviewText:
Centrally located in the heart of San Francisco's Japantown, this hotel is ideal for a fun night out in the city. Beautiful outdoor grounds, lobby and restaurant. Guest rooms could use some touch-up paint and astro turf on balcony was gross, but loved the Japanese shoji doors and bath area. Open balcony itself was a plus with a fantastic view, although awkward with no simple divider to separate the guests next door.

Arrived at 9:30 PM only to be told by valet attendant that parking was full and instructed us to park in the adjacent garage. Not too bad since I'm familiar with layout of garage, but to any out-of-towner it might have proved to be a challenge.

Stopped by O Izakaya for a late night snack. Awesome eats but not-so-great dirty martini.

Would definitely return, espcially to O Izakaya for more food with perhaps a different bartender.

review.title: Will always stay here whenever I'm in SF
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kabuki has a great Japanese style deep bath great for soaking after a day out in the cold SF weather. There is Japanese supermarket across the street that sell staples like drinks, snacks, and Japanese goodies. It is a block away from the bus stop that goes downtown and stop right in front of Union Square or you can take the 2 bus that goes into China town. It is also two block away from the bus stop that can take you toward the Marina area. The hotel is also near Fillmore street which if full of cafes, good eats (Mexican, hamburgers, Japanese, Mediterranean, Cajun, and a couple of great Jazz bars). The hotel is in a very quiet and safe location away from the hustle and bustle of the downtown area. The front desk, cleaning crew, and door man are always friendly and work really hard to meet your needs. This hotel is a bit on the pricey side but well worth it!

review.title: An out-of-the-way gem
review.reviewText: The Kabuki offers great ambience in a location central to most points of interest in San Francisco. The rooms are small but comfortable, with nice amenities such as lounge chairs, balconies and beautiful in-room bath and shower. Valet parking is available, but expensive. A more economical option is the underground garage. The dining room was a disappointment; poorly organized and expensive. However, there are many good places to eat cheaply in the adjacent mall. Try May's Coffee Shop for breakfast. Overall, we truly enjoyed our stay at this unusual hotel.

review.title: "Not very quiet and looking tired"
review.reviewText:
We had booked a refurbed room but we found that paint was chipped off a lot of the doors and some of the fittings were looking a bit tired.
The windows were only single glazed and therefore really noisy.
Staff were good even though we had to wait to get some of the problems with the room sorted.

review.title: A Mixed Bag
review.reviewText:
The hotel's location is okay and is in the heart of Japan Town. This is great if you want to be in Japan Town but is not so good if you want to get to Fisherman's Wharf and other tourist attractions. One advantage of the hotel's location is that it is surrounded by some great restaurant's and there is parking for $18 a day next door.

The room was good, but the bathroom was not clean and the tea and coffee cups were not cleaned during our stay and dirty items from other rooms were left on the landing.

The room could be designed better as there is no door on the bathroom and the shower was weak.

review.title: Kabuki is Noh slouch
review.reviewText: Aside from a brief difficulty over the parking policy, a very satisfying visit.

review.title: A true ˜Joie de Vivre˜
review.reviewText:
Excellent location and very confortable
The japanese decor is very romantic.
Must go!

review.title: Wouldn't pay those prices again.
review.reviewText:
Having spent a much larger sum than expected for two nights at this hotel, we was disappointed to find that the bed wasn't very comfortable, the room was smaller than expected, and our balcony was a SHARED BALCONY. The person in the room next to ours smoked - even though this was a "smoke free" hotel - halfway in their room, and halfway on to the balcony. Had the balcony not been shared (which we didn't see anywhere on our reservation), this wouldn't have been an issue. HOWEVER, they were very adamant about taking care of it because no one is supposed to smoke on the property. The air conditioning also didn't work in our room for more than ten minutes when you first turned it on; other than that, the room stayed muggy and hot.

Also, they advertise a refrigerator in their rooms, yet when you arrive it's stocked full of overpriced beverages - why advertise a refrigerator in the room if you're using ALL of its space for a "mini bar" instead of us being able to put leftovers and food of our own in it?

However, the hotel was very clean. Our room was also very clean and nicely made up. The decor of the hotel and the room was comfortable and chic - really enjoyed the Japanese style to everything. The koi pond and garden area was a nice retreat, and the deep-soaking Japanese style tub was AMAZING! The staff was friendly, the doormen were very polite and helpful, and overall the experience wasn't bad. Just priced for luxury when it wasn't very luxurious at all - way too expensive.

review.title: A regular stop for a frequent traveler
review.reviewText: The Kabuki, our regular port of call in SF, is blessed with an elegant, understated Japanese aesthetic atmosphere. The rooms are small but lovely, and the bathrooms boast a Japanese-style deep tub delicious for relaxation after a shower. Staff is gracious and competent. Cabs are no problem. Just outside of the heart of downtown, the hotel is on the main Geary bus route and an easy walk from other key bus lines. Its "Japantown" neighborhood is filled with interesting stores and restaurants. But the hotel restaurant itself, at least for breakfast, is overpriced and unimpressive.

review.title: Maybe an off-weekend
review.reviewText:
We got to the hotel (myself and my two teenagers) and our room was only half-cleaned. I went down to the front desk and told them we needed another room. We got one, but it was not set up for three people. Sets of towels, glasses, etc. for two. The service folk took care of it the next day.

The sliding glass windows were smudged and dirty -- window cleaning is not a daily event, clearly.

People getting room service set their trays outside their rooms, and these were present until the following day.

I went to the Hotel Kabuki last year and was pleased. This year, I don't feel I got my money's worth. And I paid more this year.

review.title: Needs a little work
