review.reviewText: The hotel itself is generally clean, however housekeeping of the individual room needs some refinement. Missed emptying coffee pots, towels thrown haphazardly in the bath room, floor outside of room had debris for over a day. But this is a high 3 star hotel not a 4 or a 5 so with that I wouldn't expect much more. If your looking for a bit of exotic the hotel is fine, in Japantown so you get a good perspective of another culture. Easy to get to buses and cabs to go and tour the city. Not much to do around the hotel at night, every thing is pretty much shut down at 9:30 to 10, if your looking for night life stay in another area of the city. The experience would not keep me from staying there again.

review.title: Very good hotel near edge of JapanTown
review.reviewText:
I foundd this to be a very comfortable hotel for a week-stay in San Francisco. It is right on Japan Town, so there were lots of good choices for highly recommended restaurants -- Is also a 10 to 15 minute walk to Fillmore Street with many other good restaurants.

Location of hotel is OK -- about 10 minute walk to Van Ness busses.

Hotel had helpful staff and room was very nicely maintained.

Definitely recommend it!

review.title: Beautiful setting, loved the gardens and koi pond.
review.reviewText: Well worth the money, a little out of the way from Fishermans Wharf, but we had fun taking the Cable car there. Loved the value for the money. Great service, excellent parking garage right next door, easy access and only $16/day.

review.title: Second Time Back
review.reviewText: This was our second time back to the hotel. Convenient underground parking. Closeby to stores and restaurants. I'd recommend this hotel to others!

review.title: Safe for female traveling solo
review.reviewText:
Very good hotel but three complaints: there was constant noise from a machine outside; although mocha and cappuccino were on the breakfast menu, neither was available because they did not have a machine--so why is it on the menu?
I like to have a window that I can open, even on a limited basis. There was no window, only a sliding glass door, with a sign on it that discourages you from opening it, for security reasons.

review.title: Alrite
review.reviewText:
Everything was alright. The location was pretty good in J-town. I luv jap products n food so it was great. There is also a jap supermarket nearby.
The bus stops were close enuf. and pretty easy to get around.

Only thing was it pretty noisy. I guess our room was facing the street so it can get pretty noisy at nite.

The wifi was kinda slow. but seemed like they fixed on my second last nite, then it work fine.

review.title: Great Bed
review.reviewText: The hotel has great king size bed and great bedding. We found the room very comfortable and quiet. You cannot hear the next room's plumbing. We want to make it our choice place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: reasonable and well appointed rooms
review.reviewText:
The sauna suite was large enough for the four of us--one bedroom and sleep sofa in living room. the bathroom is well designed with soak bath, shower and suana and fairly large..
The loung-restaurant is very noisy but the service is good.
Good location being next to the Japanese Cultural Center which has intersting shops and a number of good restaurants.

review.title: Stacy Dean
review.reviewText:
While this is a lovely hotel in a nice neighborhood, I cannot recommend it to business travelers. The business center charged me $5 for 20 minutes of service for computers that weren't linked up to the printer, wouldn't print docx documents and that were very slow. I spent 25 minutes on the phone with tech services trying to get my credit card refunded. The front desk was indifferent and wouldn't let me print out my materials from their office.

The door man tried to charge me for the time that I was unloading my bags and bringing them to the room.

they should just raise the prices and leave customers alone.

review.title: Great time and comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: We took a sudden trip to San Francisco and booked the hotel the night before we got there. It was a very comfortable room, clean, quiet and the location was perfect. It made the trip even more memorable. The cleaning room lady, Socorro was very helpful and friendly. Thanks a bunch. We will definitle be coming back there to stay.

review.title: Kabuki Review
review.reviewText: This is a really nice hotel if you are meeting with or entertaining asian customers, since there are numerous Korean and Japanese restaurants, bars, shops, etc. Taxi to downtown is only 6.00, only 2.5 miles away. It is far enough away from Union Square that it is much quieter with very few pure tourists.

review.title: Japantown beauty
review.reviewText: Kabuki is a bit away from the city centre but the local bus stops on the next corner and returns in the next street - fares are only $2 each direction. The hotel itself was a surprise - very much in the Japanese style but the rooms were very clean and functional. Good restaurants close by and cheap. Breakfast was not included but reasonably priced in the restaurant (bar) area. Reception staff went out of their way to help when I needed a power adaptor. Very impressed.

review.title: Good alternative to pricier downtown
review.reviewText: Good alternative to downtown hotels with added advantage of Japanese touches like deep soaking tubs on rooms. Good Japanese food in and around the hotel. Hotel is long walking distance from Union Square, and San Francisco bus service is very good from this location. Short walk to shops and restaurants in Pacific Heights, plus spectacular views of the Bay if you walk west up the hill. Rooms are small but comfortable.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in Japan Town
review.reviewText: My sister and I loved this hotel so much we stayed an extra day! It is very conveniently located in the center of San Francisco's Japan Town with tons of Japanese restaurants and shopping just steps away. It is just four blocks from bus lines to go to the wharf and other fun activities. The service was great and the staff helpful and kind. My only recommendation would be to be sure to park in the Japan Center parking ramp rather than the valet parking. It is much cheaper and there is an entrance to the hotel at the back of the ramp were the elevator will get you straight to the hotel lobby.

review.title: Japantown SF Kabuki Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice and relaxing hotel. Plenty of restaurants and good walking area.

review.title: A nice place to stay in Japan Town
review.reviewText:
A very nice hotel in Japan Town. I was there during the Cherry Blossom Festival which really added to my stay.
A few blocks from the Filmore, and Filmore St. Enjoyed wandering the little shops and watching the neighborhood come to life on a late Sunday morning. Some nice looking restaurants as well, but didn't have an opportunity to try.
The Kabuki Hotel is on the very convenient #2 and #38 bus routes- 10 minutes to downtown. A taxi was never more than $10, which included a good tip.
Lots of Japanese restaurants and cute Japanese shops nearby, and 2 Starbucks on Filmore a few blocks away.
The O Izakaya was really nice. The martini's and food was great!
Stayed in Fisherman's Wharf during my first visit to SF, really enjoyed this area to see a bit of the real SF.
Staff were friendly and helpful. I was able to store my bags as I arrived early, and the doorman arranged a car to take me to the airport early in the morning.
You could hear other guests in the hallway at times, but they were respectful not making excessive noise.
A nice place to stay!

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText:
+
Quiet location
Internet works well in room
Reasonable price
Staff helpful
Hotel restaurant has tasty food & good microbrews
A large supermarket 2 blocks away

-
$21 for breakfast is pricey
Fitness room is small
Housecleaning is noisy before 9am

review.title: Very nice ambience.
review.reviewText: We stay at Kabuki because there's a shuttle to CPMC hospital - very convenient.

review.title: Relaxation in Japantown
review.reviewText: The Kabuiki is away from the hub-bub of downtown, has a self-contained mall/promenade with restaurants, shops, a bookstore, etc. -- worked out great for us as it rained half our stay in March 2011. Staff is especially well-trained...very professional and polite and mannerly.

review.title: Perfect for me
review.reviewText:
I chose Kabuki for it's convenient location. I had no idea it was close to so many interesting districts/neighborhoods (Fillmore, especially). I found the shopping in the attached mall to be interesting--Japanese for sure. The underground parking on Saturday night was quite full, but at other times very open and available.

I found my room to be charming, I liked the shower/tub combination. There was enough city noise to make it feel like I was part of the hustle and bustle, and it never woke me.

I hope to visit The City again, I would definitely stay at Kabuki again! It was an expensive hotel for me, but it was well worth the cost in terms of safety, convenience, and charm.

review.title: Delightful gem
review.reviewText: This hotel reminded me of staying in Japan. The rooms are very small, but well appointed and decorated. The underground passage to the parking garage and the mall was a life safer as it rained our entire trip. The location is great, next to the Japanese cultural center, lots of great restaurants nearby. The hotel has a beautiful little garden with Koi ponds and stone paths. Small, charming and affordable. VERY CLEAN and well kept up.

review.title: great deal for SF
review.reviewText: very comfortable hotel. I enjoyed a massage from the shop on the first floor. We walked over to 1300 Filmore (restaurant) and had an excellent meal.

review.title: Tranquility amidst the rush
review.reviewText: This is a lovely little piece of peace in a busy city! Staff most courteous, gardens lovely, location close to bus transportation and walking to lots of attractions. Our room was a little bit in need of some freshening in paint etc. but hardly noticeable and all in all quite comfortable. We will def stay here again.

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco's Japantown
review.reviewText:
We greatly enjoyed the atmosphere and serene ambiance Hotel Kabuki provides in all details throughout the hotel property. The Japanese culture felt authentic and welcoming.

Only unpleasant item is that the continental breakfast is not included in the rate, which it should be based on the price per night cost. The Hotel Kabuki should definitely create a free continental breakfast for guests and make that a perk of staying at their hotel. San Francisco is an expensive city and it feels cheap on the hotel's part to nickel and dime guests on breakfast.

Overall though, we loved our experience at Hotel Kabuki and will recommend it to friends.

review.title: The Kabuki is just what I look for in a hotel!
review.reviewText: I really like the Kabuki. It's in a nice neighborhood with easy access to just about anywhere in the city. I usually walk but have used the bus service too. I find the people of SF to be very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Love this place! Great hotel if you want a bit of luxury but not go overboard.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located near the Fillmore which if full of cute shops, cafes, places to eat with a wide range of prices. This hotel is great if you are done doing the tourist thing and just want to have a relaxing time in your room or pamper yourself. Very short cab ride to downtown area (15 min) or you can take the MUNI public downtown for a bit of shopping. The bus stop is only a block away and come frequently. The parking fee is a bit steep, but since there is no place to park in the city I suggest you take the bus downtown and then cab it back.
You can also reserve a nice town car to drive you back to the airport for $45. Normally costs about $40 with tip if you take a taxi. This is great place for a short stay if you want to stay in a quiet, safe, and relaxing area with great service. This is the only place I stay when I come once a year to visit friends. Expedia has great deals on this place sometimes if you stay more than 3 days.

review.title: Japan in SF
review.reviewText: Small room but calming enviroment. The lobby is very relaxing.

review.title: excellent choice
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff is helpful and very attentive. Just avoid the hotel restaurant which is extremely expensive.

review.title: I got a great deal!
review.reviewText: I wouldn't say that the Kabuki is the best hotel in the city but if you get a great deal it's a fantastic place to stay.

review.title: Great Hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: The hotel was really good, the room was excellent and the King-size bed very comfortable. Parking was a bit of an issue at first as we arrived on President Day weekend and the hotel had a conference, but once we found the off-site garage on Geary, there is a lift directly into the hotel. The only comment for us was it was a fair way from the centre of town - too far to walk, which would have been nice. Lots of asian restaurants nearby though, expecially recomment Juban.

review.title: Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: Everyone at the Hotel Kabuki was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable.We had no trouble getting transportation to get around town and some of the shops are in walking distance. We were there for three weeks and would stay there again if we were to go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: I look forward to my next stay in this charming hotel. We loved the hotel and the location. Personnel in the hotel was helpful at all times. And easy transportation anywhere in town was a definite plus.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText:
I upgraded myself to the premier floor as the origianl room was small.

The King size bed seemed old as it was very lump and there is a connector door to the room next door. So you can hear the parties going on there. Not impressed

review.title: okay but not for me
review.reviewText: First, I had to change rooms because of noise. The hotel graciously made the change. Most problematic, the hotel lacks amenities such as available newspapers (nor directions to the closest newsstand), a shop or even kiosk to purchase necessaries such as tooth paste. The only in-house restaurant is rather expensive, especially for breakfast, and all of the surrounding shops are totally Asian! Not a surprise given the restaurant's location but that gives it limited appeal to non-Asian guests.

review.title: My Stay in San Francisco Hotel Kabuki
review.reviewText: We were given a corner room. Unfortunately, they were not able to provide two separate beds, so we had to contend with a small king. The room amenities are adequate and came with bathrobes that are definitely the most comfortable ones I've ever come across, especially considering the season. I did think the room condition is just only slightly dated, which did not distract from being comfortable. The bathroom consisted of 3 separate areas, which is nice! The toilet has it's own door, and the bath area has got a Japanese-style bath fronted a large washing/shower. Other than the bed, we were unable to use the bar fridge, which was locked and I felt the power outlets could have been more conveniently located. And no we didn't bother to ask them to unlock the fridge, we just used the small balcony, hanging our stuff in a plastic bag on the door handle. And the small balcony area was filthy! Since we had no use for it, we made no complaint. The hotel is smack in the middle of Japan Town, not very lively at this time of the year (Christmas). And free car parking is problematic.

review.title: lower price, but high quality
review.reviewText: everything is perfect, a very lovely hotel. if you wish to find a high quality hotel w/ lower price than those 5 stars, this is it.

review.title: Peace and Quiet in a Bustling City
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Hotel Kabuki was wonderful. We were offered great service, a beautiful view, and high end amenities. We were a little disappointed that the hotel restaurant was not open until later in the week, but there were plenty of other options around us to make up for that. I especially enjoyed the Japanese soaking tub and king size bed with just the softest sheets! It made it hard to get up in the morning, but somehow we managed. We did have one minor issue while we were there but it was handled immediately and with grace. It is a little far from some of the big tourist attractions, but in some ways that was very nice since it gave us refuge from the hustle and bustle of the busier parts of the city. Definitely recommend this hotel to singles, couples, or small families interested in visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable hotel convenient to lots of places, thanks to being a block from Geary (the 38 bus runs constantly).

review.title: Kabuki needs self parking structure!
review.reviewText:
Hotel room and service is just perfect.
But lack of self parking is only the problem.
Hotel itself, overall very nice to stay. Definitely will stay Kabuki again.

review.title: San Fran's Best Hotel for the Price!
review.reviewText:
Do not let anyone fool you on these reviews! Hotel Kabuki was amazing! For the price, you cannot go wrong. The hotel was clean, great service, and in one of the best parts of San Francisco. It is an easy walk to wherever you want to go, or an easy bus ride. The hotel is attached to a neat, small, mall that is fun to walk around and get a bite to eat.

The bathroom is amazing! Dual shower, with a deep soak tub. My girlfriend and I loved it. The bed is so comfortable, the sheets are clean, and that is all I needed!

review.title: We have gone back twice already and will do again
review.reviewText: Very pleased, see above... we could open windows and get fresh air, neighborhood is quiet and loaded with excellent Korean and Japanese restaurants, which are inexpensive. The hotel is close to the Muni line, we were minutes away from downtown, Golden Gate Park , the beach, The room was kept very clean and the shower was unbelievable , a whole room with sit down bench.

review.title: Quiet, Japanese-style
review.reviewText: A good choice if you are visiting S.F. friends and are not a first-time tourist. The hotel is not close enough to most "attractions" to walk (and parking in the city is very expensive) but it is in the center of Japantown, where restaurants, cafes and shops have their own special flavor.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I had family from Japan visiting and it was our first time in San Francisco so the hotel was a great pick for us because we had both the comforts of Japantown centrally located and easily accessible to many of the tourist attractions. Hotel staff were also friendly and helpful.

review.title: It's OK.
review.reviewText: It's OK.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. Exterior is a bit dated, but the interior and rooms are well-furnished and modern. Reception is helpful and hotel has plenty of amenities. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel the next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki- Great hotel, but hard to find a taxi
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed everything about the Hotel Kabuki except for trying to get a taxi at 8 a.m. to take me to my office. The hotel doorman had called the taxi service, but the line was always busy. Eventually there was a small crowd of us on the street waiting to hail passing taxis, which never came. I finally took a city bus.

review.title: Clean, affordable, nice area
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel within walking distance to many great restaurants and shops on fillmore.

Only complaint was the car valet, who EVERYTIME acted as if I was bothering him, just to get my keys.

review.title: Definitely will go back again!
review.reviewText:
Very impressive with the rate and decor of this hotel! The location is very central right in the Japan Town. Room is really clean and well lay out.

If you are planning to rent a car, parking is expensive at the hotel but you can find street parking close by, just watch for the parking signs as they clean streets first thing in the morning.

review.title: Thanksgiving Trip
review.reviewText: We stay here every year and it is always pleasant. Proximity to Japan Town is ideal.

review.title: hungry kabuki
review.reviewText: Great hotel, beautiful , peaceful ambience, great location in Japantown. Limited room service some days of the week was a problem. Check out the days it's available if that's important to you.

review.title: Good location for Fillmore Shows
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel ,clean,good location for what we were doing.My main complaint was there was no coffee pot in the room,the restaurant hours limited and because it was "JapanCenter"- no Starbucks anywhere near...or for that matter no place to buy coffee near! Okay if you like tea-they had a nice tea pot in the room.We stay at the Nikko in SF often and I would rate the Kabuki a whole star less .

review.title: You get more than you pay I assure you of that :)
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved the Hotel it was everything me and my fiance could have asked for. We booked the flight and hotel for barely anything and both helped make the travel experience. The hotel was clean and had two balconies with sliding panels so we could decided on the amount of light or noise that came inside. I also recommened getting a room with the soaking tub, I was in it every night and they replenished not only our normal toiletrees but also the soaking salts. Ther is an amazing coffee shop directly across the street and the entire area is clean and feels very safe. I would recommened this hotel to anyone traveling to San francisco, Everyone was extremely friendly. Its a good place for a tight budget you get more than you pay for.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
~ We like the decor of the hotel and the rooms
~ It would be nice if the bath tub and washrooms are cleaner (e.g. the drainage in the tub looks dirty)
~ Love the location of the hotel; very close to everywhere
~ The beds are comfortable and the pillows are very hard to sleep on (my neck hurts for a day after sleeping on them the second day of my trip)
~ Hotel staff are super nice and helpful

review.title: I Felt Really Great
review.reviewText: This is a place where I felt really at home. Everything was in order and very comfortable. The place is not exactly central, but is on the bus route, with buses running every 5 minutes or so. Actually Union Square is within walking distance, and it is a great walk, but I had a tight program of walking, so I preferred the bus. The neighborhood seemed very interesting and is a tourist destination in its own right. Unfortunately, I was on the jet lag, so instead of heading for dinner at 7.00 pm I just switched off.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good value

review.title: Lovely hotel - can't recommend it enough.
review.reviewText:
Lovely, clean hotel. Big room. Good shower, free wifi. A bit of a walk from Downtown, but very central for all areas overall. Near to Pacific Heights, Haight Ashbury, Cow Hollow and Castro/Mission. Loved it.

Room cleaned really well each day, friendly staff, quick elevators. Surrounding area not the most exciting, but safe. Walk from Downtown to hotel at night not the most pleasant, but certainly never felt unsafe.

Would stay here every time from now on, loved it.

review.title: very clean facility
review.reviewText: I don't have any complains. However the breakfast is not free. Be ready to spend around $20 for breakfast per person.

review.title: Nothing Special
review.reviewText: Nothing special, I would've paid more to stay at a well known hotel near-by. No microwave or fridge, parking was EXPENSIVE!!

review.title: Won't be going back
review.reviewText: We arrived on the later side of normal check in, 8PM. Knowing we had pre-paid for our room thru Expedia, I was'nt worried they would give our room away. They hadn't... yet... they took us to a room that was not even close to the picture promised (we paid for the upgrade) and it frankly gave me the creeps. One of the big back rest pillows from the couch was on the floor and the room was poorly decorated and very cold feeling. Again, not at all like the glamorous photo portrayed. We immediately called down for another room and luckily they had one. As we were walking to our new (un-glamorous-not-like-the-photo) room the bellman told us because we booked thru Expedia we get the "low end" of the totem pole rooms. I was really disappointed to hear this.... and am quite certain you will be too. Hotel Kabuki was rough around the edges. We will not be staying there again.

review.title: Would definitely return
review.reviewText: Kabuki Hotel is in the perfect spot in Japan Town. The rooms are nicely decorated, although could be a little cleaner, it's a bit rough around the edges. Love the shoji screens over the windows, and the Japanese style soaking tub. The restaurant is convenient for breakfast, although a bit expensive for a very basic buffet. The rooms are fairly spacious. Can't use the refrigerators for food brought into the hotel, however, as they are kept locked. Minor inconvenience. All in all, a nice place to stay.

review.title: Great Deal in a Great Location
review.reviewText:
First of all, what I think most travelers to San Francisco don't realize is that a LOT of the hotels are in tourist-heavy, less-pretty areas of the city. Hotel Kabuki is in Japantown, which is far less congested and busy than Chinatown, but still has its own unique feel.

Fillmore Street is two blocks west and going north and south on that there are plenty of good shops and restaurants.

The only caveat I would strongly ask others to keep in mind is that the rooms are not spacious. I had a King City View and was there by myself and it was PERFECT. The view was impressive and the balcony was a corner, so I had multiple views. BUT if two people were staying in that room, I could see things getting a little cramped. Not a lot of storage space.

But even with that factored in, it's still a great deal.

review.title: Hairs on bathroom floor. For that reason I just cant return
review.reviewText: I am torn about my experience. I found a pubic hair on the floor of the bathroom as soon as I checked in and went to use the bathroom. Then when I went to take a shower there was another hair on the side of the tub. When I left the cleaning lady was in the hall and I explained it to her and she assured me she would clean the floors really well. (Werent they supposed to anyways?). The room was cute and I loved the restaurant (for breakfast) and having the cool Japanese Malls next door however because I am germaphobe I will probably not return. Something else that freaked me out was a sign at a store at the mall next door saying how the store may be toxic or something like that.

review.title: Good hotel for price.
review.reviewText: We found Hotel Kabuki to be a very nice choice for the price. The corner king seemed a bit larger than the regular king room and had two sliding doors with narrow decks. The west view was beautiful especially at sunset. My husband is a stickler for cleanliness and this room almost met his standards (there were a few finger prints on the mirror in the bathroom and shower doors). I found the room to be very clean. The bed was super comfortable and we had a late check out of 1pm. We ordered the chicken ramen noddle soup from room service but it was a bit bland. The food arrived promptly and the service was fine. The parking was very easy in the underground garage at Benihana's and was only $16. The valet parking is $40. We didn't explore the area much but it was clean and safe. We will definitely use this hotel again when we come to the city if the price is right.

review.title: Highly recommended!
review.reviewText: The Kabuki Hotel provides very good service and the hotel is kept in good condition. The room was very well kept and room service responded very quickly when called. Although the location of the hotel is a little over a mile from Union Square, the excellent City bus system makes it easy to get around. The hotel is right in Japan Town so there are a lot of Oriental restaraunts and little shops in easy walking distance. If you rent a car, the parking rates at the hotel are about half the price of most hotels in San Francisco. This was our second stay at the hotel and we highly recommend it if you can get it at the special rates offered by Expedia.

review.title: Very good ecuation.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, good service , very fast check in/out, good rooms and baths.

review.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText:
Excellent location. You're away from the major tourist areas and near two major bus lines. Tons of restaurants literally across the street. A short walk to Fillmore street and there are even more restaurants.

As this is a Japanese style hotel, there are a few differences. My bathroom had a whole body soaking tub and well as a shower. The hot water was really hot and abundant. A soak after a long day of walking was an unexpected treat. Also, my room had a shrine in it.

The room could have used a larger bureau for clothes. This is the only negative but it was easily worked around.

I travel to San Francisco 1 to 2 times per year and have stayed in a number of hotels in various price ranges and locations. I definitely will stay here again. This hotel is an excellent value in a great location.

review.title: Great, as always
review.reviewText: I've stayed here many times. It's clean and has a right, quiet energy about it. The parking garage nearby as increased it's fee to $16 overnight parking. And it could be much more expensive! Kabuki hotel is definitely convenient when i comes to restaurants. It's out by itself, away from downtown, so either a car is needed or you must possess a willigness to ride the questionable bus service (called MUNI). It is known by locals as the "funk express", and we're not talking music. Expect to hear plenty of sirens throughout the night, as well as rabid motorcycle riders. The main street nearby, named Geary, is wide open at night, so these particular riders like to floor it. The front desk is generally willing to help you. Guests seem friendly and classy on average. Noise in the hotel itself is slight. There are sooo many Japanese restaurants, as I am sure the other reviewers have mentioned. But I recommend Toraya, which is off of Post Street, or Juban, which is in the western end of the mall.

review.title: Great when going to the Fillmore for a concert
review.reviewText: On the date we needed a room (09/23/2010), Most rooms in SF (expecially Asian themed) were completely booked because of a big Oracle thing. We had a concert to go to (UB40) at the Fillmore. I went on line, Kabuki booked. I called, same thing. Went to Expedia.com and got a room for less than their on-line rate. When we checked in, they handed me keys to a 15th floor (out of 16) room with a 2-sided corner balcony. We were very pleased!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but location was not optimal, and service was limited

review.title: Good for business travel
review.reviewText: I go to San Francisco regularly for work and always try to stay at Hotel Kabuki. The location is convenient and the staff is always friendly and professional.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We brought friends to SF and they were stunned at the beauty and amenities in the hotel It was the highlight of their visit as they had been taking a cross country car trip and motelling their way around. My husband and I were very happy with the hotel and with the ease of public transportation as well as the gracious ambience and the rooms.

review.title: parking not included
review.reviewText: every thing went well, except parking was 40 dollars per day extra. I was able to find parking on the street. I felt a discount would have been appropiate.

review.title: Alright hotel, minus air quality in the room
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice, located in Japan town which was a unique experience. It was great to have many Japanese restaurants so close to the hotel, and the shops were also interesting to look at and shop in. The bar in the hotel isn't bad either, especially with their specials.
The location of the hotel was pretty decent, despite having to take public transportation, the buses seems to run quite frequently. And there are many bus stops located close to the hotel.
The downfalls to the hotel was that the room seemed really dry, it didn't feel comfortable even with changing the temperature. The vents were poorly located in the room, and the air circulation was poor, and this had created a poor sleeping environment for me, where only at night (where majority of the time is spent in the room) I would cough and keep my bf up due to the dryness in the air. Thank goodness for that Safeway located nearby - I was able to buy cough syrup, Safeway was also convenient in buying snacks and other foods.
Another downfall about the hotel was that we were keen on having a mini fridge in the room, so that we could store beverages and any other foods that needed to be chilled - however the fridge was so jam packed with beverages that you had to pay for that there was no room left for anything else. Not to mention, overpriced beverages.
Also, my bf forgot shaving cream, and they provided complimentary shaving cream and razors. Overall, the hotel wasn't too bad, however I wouldn't stay there again.

review.title: Do this again
review.reviewText: Exceptionally good experience at a quality hotel in a very nice neighborhood. Conveniet public transportation.

review.title: If you enjoy JTown like we did, definitely a yes!
review.reviewText: The hotel entrance was not clearly indicated. Finally, after going one whole round of the building, we found one entrance from within the mall. Inside though, it's as beautiful as it's seen on pictures, just wish it's newer & cleaner. But considering it's an old building/hotel, I guess that's expected. and considering the price I got and where it is (in Japan Town), it's very good deal!

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: Didn't care for the bed, room was good sized otherwise not cozy.

review.title: Felt like we were really away
review.reviewText: Japantown is a bit off the beaten track but worth it to get that feeling of ' being away'. The Hotel Kabuki reinforces that feeling. The deep tub and room with a view were worthwhile extras. The eucalyptous soap and hair products were in keeping with the experience. The breakfast was not a good choice being expensive and a small crowded area. An amazing mall of hidden restaurants is available across the road and is a better breakfast choice. Would return.

review.title: Would stay here again...
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, has been remodelled but signs of hotels age were noticeable (water stains on the ceiling). Staff were helpful, room was clean. Hotel is further away from some of the city's attractions, but neighbourhood felt safe. Bus stop across the street and was easy to use to get around. Japan Center is beside hotel and has some shopping, plenty of Japanese restaurants, a coffee shop, and a pastry shop. There is a Safeway a few blocks away which was great break from restaurant food. I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The room was not very clean and the towels were ripped and dirty.

review.title: Nice hotel - but not close to much
review.reviewText:
Although the hotel is beautiful, it's not really close to anything. I am comfortable with public transportation and since I have been to San Fran several times, I knew which buses to take to get to certain areas. One issue, though, is that the bus stops aren't close to the hotel, so you need to figure out which direction to walk in to get the right bus, etc.
The room was nice but the temperature controls didn't work very well.
The staff was great - very friendly and professional.

review.title: Great Hotel, very helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Very Nice accomedations, Very comfortable beds, nice veiw from room. Centralized location in San Fransisco, easy access to public transportation, which we as a family of 4, from the Midwest highly recommend. Counter staff were very helpful even helping locate tourist activity. We recommend this hotel, beautiful simple yet elegant surroundings. While the lounge had breakfast we fell in Love with Mel's. We loved our San Fransisco vacation, celebrated our childrens 16th birthday, only wish we had 2 more months to see all aeras of interest.

review.title: love Japantown
review.reviewText:
I enjoy Japantown...safe neighborhood, convenient to many areas. Great movie theater right next door, as is the Japanese style bath/spa.

The rooms are pretty large, as are the bathrooms. Some of the fixtures (such as the shoji screens) have not held up well, and are a bit damaged.

They expanded the number of TV channels, and there was free wi-fi in the room.

Buffet breakfast was okay, not great.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very serene. Lots of shopping nearby (Fillmore St, and cute stores in Japan center). Nearby public transportation which we used as well as walked because you see a lot more that way. If you are in the city for more than 3 days get a Muni pass it is worth it. We were basically out all day and go back to the hotel to sleep so we did not go down to breakfast or dinner at the hotel. We'll probably do that next time. Thinking about coming back in October and staying here again.

review.title: A good hotel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: I thought it was a great hotel. Our room was really clean and when we asked the maid for extra blankets she had someone bring them right away. We didn't interact with the staff very much but when we did, they were very friendly. I didn't have a problem with noisy neighbors. The walk from the hotel to union square wasn't too bad and it was great having the mall right next door with plenty of restaurants.

review.title: Take time out of San Francisco craziness to enjoy this hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kabuki was a wonderful escape from the madness of other San Francisco neighborhoods. The staff was wonderful and helpful. We had a great room with great beds and linens and a definite Japanese feel. The malls next to the hotel were quiet, but totally served our shopping needs. The best find was the Daisio $1.50 store, we were there 3 days in a row. The food choices were really good and like comfort after a long day of exploring all of the other sites of San Francisco. A cable car line is only 6 blocks away and Union Square was a 15 minute walk in the morning from our hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, great location. We loved the Japanese style bath and the convivial atmosphere. Parking was so easy and the Kabuki Springs Spa (just a few blocks away) was an amazing experience.

review.title: Serenity in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We had some issues with things breaking or not working, but calls to the front desk resulted in someone coming up promptly to help. The bathroom area is a little awkward as the bath area has a glass door and we were sharing the room with our teenage son. We improvised by opening the door to the water closet and leaving that open in front of the bathing area door so that we could each have privacy when bathing or showering.

The location was awesome, very central, in a nice quiet neighborhood close to bus lines. Staff was wonderful, especially the doormen and bellhops. They were always friendly, helpful and accommodating. The lounge is fun and they serve up a tasty burger if you have had your fill of sushi and traditional Japanese food.

Would definitely stay there again, but would probably book a larger room or two individual rooms. The Japanese soak tub was wonderful and the bath salts they provide are soothing and relaxing. It was also nice to have access to tea and a hot water kettle and tea set.

review.title: Spacious room in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was quiet and spacious for S.F. The shower was a little weird. Reminded me of a gym shower with tiled floor and you walked in and there was no door or curtain. Other than that it was a nice room.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: We had a "Corner King" and it had tons of room. The room was newly renovated and tastefully decorated. The only drawback was the location. It was fine but a bit far from the areas we wanted to see. But given the deal we got on Expedia and the size of the room it was worth it. Fantastic!

review.title: Cleanliness is the issue
review.reviewText:
This place was just too dirty for me. I stayed several nights and only required that my sheets be changed once. In spite of having a bit more time to take care of the rest of the room, nothing was ever done well. I don't believe they wiped down the bathroom sink, counter, or mirrors. The carpet was never vacuumed. Nothing that could have been dusted in the main room was ever dusted.

I believe the only thing done each day during cleaning was towel replacement and drying the bathtub.

The glass doors were filthy. The lamp shades covered with dust. Basically, this hotel has a management problem. All it would take is for a manager to spot check a couple of rooms each day and give feedback on quality. I can't imagine this is ever done.

What's to conclude except that attention to detail and basic sanitation is not important here. It's a shame....it could be a great hotel. Very visually relaxing. Lovely. Just dirty. Too dirty for me.

review.title: comfortable room , safe neighborhood
review.reviewText:
I loved the room as soon as I walked in, a safe neighborhood for a woman travelling alone. The only complaint was the smell of smoke. Although my floor, possibly the entire hotel, is "non smoking", obviously, they are unable to enforce it. I had to call twice about the smell of smoke which I cannot tolerate.
I chose the location of this hotel because it is between UCSF Parnassus and Mt Zion Divisadero campuses and I had appointments at both campuses.
Normally, I would stay at a hotel walking distance to a BART station which is nowhere to be seen in this neighborhood.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: Convenient location in between to Haight Ashbury and Fisherman's warf, my two destinations. Ambiance was great, the bed was super comfy and the bathroom was marvelous. The cleaning service was noisy in the morning, however. Also they leave munch food in the room for very expensive prices and that is just not fair! I will stay here again however on my trip because everything else was great!

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, location is ok, you can easily join all the neighborhood by bus ot taxi

review.title: excellent hotel and wonderful experience
review.reviewText:
what a great hotel! Japantown is a lovely area, and the hotel is a great find. We arrived tired from flying all day and found helpful and welcoming employees, a clean and well appointed room, a wonderfully deep Japanese style bathtub to soak away all our cares, and thick silk/terry cloth robes to relax in.
The hotel adjoins a large underground mall for good shopping and easy access to snacks (so we were never tempted to use the high priced drinks and snacks in the hotel room refrigerator). There are a number of great Japanese restaurants nearby, both satisfying and cheap noodle houses and more upscale options.
There is easy and inexpensive parking, a little Japanese garden, and clerks who know the bus system and can provide good information for wide eyed tourists. I look forward to staying there the next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText: I would certainly go back. Nice hotel, great bed and bathroom, just a few ants to disturb, must be because of the bamboos...

review.title: Fair value
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, was disappointedthat the restaurant was not open for dinner but found great restaurants in the adjoing shopping center.

review.title: Four nights at the Kabuki
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the central location (in Japantown) and the relative ease and cost of parking in the Japantown parking garage. We would have liked having coffee in the room, but we survived. The room was quiet and clean. we would definitely consider a return stay.

review.title: Best place to stay to avoid the chaos of downtown.
review.reviewText: The Kabuki hotel is perfectly located between Geary and Post. It is far enough away from the Union Square area to be calm, but close enough that you are only five minutes away from great shopping and the financial district. My girlfriend and I stayed in a corner king room. It was perfect, with the exception of the sliding glass doors to the private balcony. They were so old that it was a battle just to open them. The staff were courteous and friendly. All in all it was a great place to stay. It is the perfect way to avoid the madness of the Union Square area. Plus you cant beat Japantown for great food that is dirt cheap.

review.title: A So So Experience
review.reviewText:
I am a SF native and always enjoy returning to the city of my birth.
The Kubuki positives are the location and the ability to park on Geary without paying garage fees, a biggee in SF. The rest is not so positive. The hotel is tired and worn. The carpeting and furnishings almost don't look clean, which may be largely due to the need for refurbishing. Some of the staff are less than accomodating. I would, however, consider the hotel based on the ability to do street parking, should I be in SF with a car. Hotel garage rates can run $45 per night in SF. I usually do not rent a car when traveling to SF and would then find many more suitable and luxurious choices in the same price range.

review.title: Fine.
review.reviewText: It was fine for a short stay but inconvenient that the restaurant was closed on Mon and Tue.

review.title: Favorite hotel - but a bit dissapointed this time
review.reviewText:
We love Kabuki hotel, and this is where we usually stay when we come to SF. However, all these times we actually didn't know that not all the rooms come with a Japanese-style deep soaking tub with a wash area... We got a big room with two double beds, which said 'newly renovated', but the room looked like it wasn't renovated at all. The room was dusty and the toilet had cracks (!). The saddest part was that the bath tub was a regular 'western-style' one.

We still like Kabuki hotel, and we sure will come back again. Only, we will make sure about getting a room that has a Japanese-style bath next time.

review.title: Pleasant respite in Japantown
review.reviewText:
Booked hotel based on location and description. It was pleasant, clean and conveniently located. We had a great view of Japantown and felt we were staying in the cleanest part of the city.

We felt the continental breakfast while not expensive should have been included with our room rate. Other than that, the staff was efficient, friendly and helpful as we had to change rooms soon after check-in due to an air-conditioner leaking into the closet.

review.title: Satisfied In San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great experience in a beautiful city. The Kabuki delivered on all account. Will definitely stay ther again!

review.title: "A Pleasant Cup of Cha"
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Kabuki is situated about 5 miles from the epicenter of San Fran's busy commercial area. It's quiet elegance, represented by its central serenity garden is a wonderful reprieve from the city. At times, I felt like I went to Japan for the night.
The room decor was exquisite with the tatami sliding doors installed over the large window in my room. I used the japanese bath and it was quite relaxing after a long day of travel. In addition, the Kabuki Bath and Spa was about 3 blocks away which was a wonderful feeling of cultural immersion, without going all the way to Japan. There were many different Asian shops and restaurants in the near vicinity. The front desk and especially the bellman were wonderful. They went out of their way to be kind to everyone!
The only negative, I had breakfast there once and it was OK, not great!
I stayed a total of 3 days, and I'll try to come back next year. I would like to thank everyone at the Hotel Kabuki for making my stay so special!

review.title: Relaxing and interesting
review.reviewText:
Hotel Kabuki is at one end of the Japanese Centre near the Civic area of San Francisco. It is in what appeared to be a quiet and safe area of the city to use as a touring base.
The rooms were well appointed and the hotel decorated in at traditional Japanese style,
It is 15-20min taxi ride from any of the key places of interest in the city, and there are bus services available too.
I felt relaxed and comfortable there after a long flight from London, UK, and would recommend Hotel Kabuki for a short break in the city!

review.title: Great location if you bring earplugs
review.reviewText: Great location, the Hotel was maintained well. The rooms facing Geary Blvd are not well insulated from road noise. The suites on the ground floor were well laid out but there was a strange vibration every few minutes that could bother a light sleeper. Bring your earplugs. Limited on site parking, but even with all that I could see myself staying there again.

review.title: One of my favorites
review.reviewText: Anytime you get to take your 6 year old grandson to a new place, it is going to be a good trip. The hotel is centrally located for all the places I wanted to take him. It is quiet and well kept up. New mangement (used to be the Miyako) is upgrading the property. The Japanese garden in the center of the property is a great place to sit and relax.

review.title: Definitely Coming back to stay here
review.reviewText: Very cosy. The Japantown neighbourhood has many good restaurants such as Tanpopo ramen, Mum's cafe shabu shabu, Sophie's Crepes, etc

review.title: Satisfied. Would stay again, but on a higher floor
review.reviewText:
Stayed in one of the Corner rooms. They placed me on the 4th floor, which turned out to be extremely noisy as the late night people out on the street were extremely loud before they dispersed. If possible, stay on a much higher floor.

The room was very nice overall. They strangely gave me a key to a minibar, but there was no minibar present. They noticed that I was taking baths in the extremely deep Japanese style bathtub, so they left a packet of bath salts for me for my second night in the hotel. Very thoughtful.

The valet parking is overly expensive. That fee raised the overall hotel stay by an additional 33%. Ouch. Park it yourself downstairs.

Of complete mystery was the absolute absence of a place to put my clothes away. There were no cabinets, closets, or even a hanger of any kind in the room. I had to leave my clothes in the suitcase.

Other than that, I loved the room! It had gorgeous sliding screen doors. The bathroom was exactly what I wanted, with a deeeeeep bathtub that you can soak in for hours. Japanese style stool to sit out and shower before you jump into the bath completed the experience.

A ton of great restaurants either in the complex or in the surrounding neighborhood. Spoiled for choice.

A definite recommendation to anyone staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Japantown central
review.reviewText: Japantown is a great location for SF. Not only is it within easy distance of Muni's main buses on Geary and Van Ness, it's got great Japantown stores like Benkyodo (mochi) and Ichiban Kan(irresistable cute things) for shopping nearby.

review.title: Fillmore Close
review.reviewText: This hotel is really close to the Fillmore and is a great place to stay after a show. There are many restaurants in the area. There is plenty of garage parking, but it's not obvious and you'll have to park on the street and get instructions from the hotel staff. We had a corner room with a King. It was roomy and had large windows. The decor was beautiful.

review.title: excellent location, comfort
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in Japantown. Was pleasantly surprised with the restaurant attached to the hotel -- the $20 Japanese bento breakfast was just outstanding, as was the dinner meal. I am going to make this my main hotel when I return to San Fran.

review.title: SF Secret
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful! Great location and good customer service.

review.title: We will return to this hotel.
review.reviewText: We will return to this hotel but ask for a larger room. The location is great, the parking arrangement is excellent and the staff is friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our breakfast. Our room was a bit too warm but we had a sliding door that opened to allow air into the surroundings. We enjoyed the convenience of the parking and the price for parking at the adjacent garage was reasonable.

review.title: Centrally located, excellent parking and walk to great restaurants. Will return again!
review.reviewText: Our new favorite hotel. Centrally located in Japantown in SF with abundant parking that doesn't cost a night's stay! The rooms were large, we were in the 4 story portion, with adequare room for two adults, two children, and our small dog. They allow small dogs which is the clincher for us! My husband loved the large tub, beds were great with lots of extra pillows. There was even a small lounger in our room which one of our kids slept on. We stayed during the week, and secured free street parking no problem, but the parking garage attached to the hotel is only 16/night. Can't beat that anywhere in SF. Will stay here again and again, highly recommended!

review.title: Rock on at the Fillmore and the Kabuki
review.reviewText: The Kabuki was great. From the door man to the desk, everyone was helpful and polite. The room was nice. Good place to take your wife when going to see a show at the Fillmore. Quiet, clean, and nicely remodeled. I stayed at the Tomo down the street last time and had a good experience, but this site was more upscale. I'd stay here again. Hint: Take the upgrade on expedia. It's 3x more expensive at the hotel.

review.title: Staying in Japantown SF
review.reviewText: SF Japantown experience.

review.title: Valentine's Weekend
review.reviewText:
So we had stayed here at the Kabuki Hotel last summer for my bday and they had a good special for Valentines so we thought why not? Well we were a little disappointed - the room was smaller than we had the last time. We had an issue with the slider off the track but they took care of that pretty quick. The view was not so great but whatever.
The restaurant downstairs was the worst part. The food was not great and the price was really way too high for what we got. It was a buffet, the waitress did not explain that there was another section with traditional American breakfast, we saw other people going that way and figured it out for ourselves. She did not automatically come around with coffee, we had to ask a couple of times. The second morning we went somewhere else for breakfast.
Overall the hotel is a delight and I would stay there again but I would make sure I asked for the larger of the corner rooms.
Oh I almost forgot - I left my belt in the room and called the same day we checked out to see if it was found but 'housekeeping' said they couldn't find it. I know for a fact I left it there so I was pretty disappointed they said that. It wasn't an expensive belt but it had sentimental value.

review.title: if you are local would recommend otherwise we would not recommend for the first time visit to s.f.
review.reviewText:
the valet parking was the highest we have experienced at 40.00 plus per day at hotel. no "in and out" parking in area and garages are expensive. if you know the area you can park on out of the way neighborhood streets for free, but if not familiar you wouldn't know where to look(bad area).
the front desk and hotel staff is not very accommodating or friendly.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: not good

review.title: Convenient parking, comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with Hotel. Good service, good location, convenient parking and can even park overnight on street for free if you find a stall. Many good shops and restaurants in the area. Comfortable bed. Nice shower and furo.

review.title: Nice place to stay in Japantown
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, friendly staff, close to Japantown. Don't expect luxury, but good for the price. My room was cold (Jan) had to use the extra blanket because the thin comforters weren't enough. Decor might come off a bit cheesy, but everything is nice and clean. Japanese-style deep tub is nice for a relaxing bath. It is not super easy to get there if taking public transportation but doable-take the BART from SFO, get off at Montgomery then take the 38 bus (OR get off at Powell and walk if you don't mind walking- about a 1 mi walk no crazy hills). There is a parking garage right by the hotel for a reasonable price also.

review.title: a bit let down
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this establishment for year when I'm in SF. Great neighborhood & easy access with good parking.
i don't mind spending a bit more $$ to stay here but was a bit disappointed this time.
major elevator hassles. not sure if they only have one elevator but we stood in the parking garage for 20 minutes.
Got to the room and were disturbed 5x by the "honor bar guy" that wanted to check the inventory even though we just arrived. Finally had to call the desk to tell this guy to stop.
No AC at all...fan blew hot air all night long. we had to leave the doors open to sleep

review.title: Quiet, convenience and elegance in Japantown
review.reviewText: We booked a package deal through Expedia--4 nights, non-stop r/t air and car for a great price. I had lived in Japantown area many years ago but was not really familiar with the hotel. I was extremely please, on walking into the hotel. A quiet, professional Japanese-style business hotel. We checked in immediately and were informed by the hotel that were were being given a free upgrade to a suite. Not bad!! After seeing the suite, I was absolutely thrilled. It was 2 large rooms, separated by sliding Japanese screens. The living room had lovely art work, elegant furniture, and a flat screen TV. The bedroom was beautiful, but had no windows. In the closet were 2 silk kimonos for our use. The bathroom had its own Sauna, which was quite unexpected. The air conditioning system was not always consistent, but otherwise, I found this to be an unexpected pleasure of a hotel-stay. When one sees "Boutique Hotel," one often expectes a shabby-chic renovation, but this was quite the opposite. This is a place I would definitely recommend. The neighborhood is safe and quiet and very convenient to any neighborhood in SF.

review.title: Our only base in San Francisco from now on
review.reviewText: Unbelievably fine experience. Great atmosphere and decor. Alert, caring and competent staff at every level and stage.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: no room temperature control. concierge was of no assistance

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very nice and quiet neighborhood. The staff are very knowledge, polite and friendly. The hotel is about 15 blocks from Union Square, a nice walk on a good day. It is close to everything.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel. I was very surprised by the size of the room and I love the deep soaking tub in the room. I wish they would get rid of the popcorn ceiling tho. But overall I would come back to this hotel due to the location of the hotel right by Japantown and the comfortable large rooms. It was easy to find street parking by the hotel instead of paying for parking at the hotel.

review.title: Good quality understated hotel
review.reviewText: N/A

review.title: Great Hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: It was my second time at this great hotel. Hotel staff is friendly & very helpful. Adjacent to Japanese shopping mall. Lots of restaurant options in the area.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: A very good experience, beautiful hotel , great location and very nice rooms with balconies.

review.title: We had fun at Kabuki
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the sauna in our room! Staff was friendly and very helpful. Except for a few little ants that made their way into our cookies, we all loved it. Great big room. Hate having to pay for parking on top of the Hotel rate, limited street parking.

review.title: Would definetly go back!
review.reviewText: great. Nice hotel. They upgraded me to a suite. room was clean and super modern/contemporary.

review.title: It's ok.
review.reviewText: I have to say the room was not exactly how I pictured. But given its location, I would still recommend it.

review.title: Extremly convenient
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying there.

review.title: Nice quiet hotel slightly away from Union Square
review.reviewText: We've stayed here several times and always been happy with it. We book a corner room on a high floor which is a bit more spacious more windows and has views. The staff have always been friendly and professional. Room clean and bed comfortable with good linen. We travel with a car with our two year old son so the underground shopping center parking with the elevator directly to the hotel room is a bonus, especially unloading our ever increasing luggage pile. Something we haven't found in other more central San Fran hotels. The only draw back is no in/out privileges so it can get expensive. However if you are needing to save a few bucks and overnight and during the day (2hr) free parking can be found on the local streets, but be careful you don't park on the side with the early street cleaning. If not travelling by car Union Square is only a $7 taxi or short bus ride down Geary, you could always walk if the weather is nice. The shopping center has lots of decent restaurants if you need an easy quick meal. I would recommend this hotel if you were after a nice calm not super trendy hotel slightly away from the action of Union Square.

review.title: Not dissapointed
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located in the middle of Japan Town and is decorated accordingly. There are Japanese tea gardens near the lobby. The 'city view' room did have a nice view of Japan town and a small balcony, although the balcony is shared with an ajoining room (so lock your sliding glass door at night). The room was equiped with a flat screen TV (although we never found the remote for it) and an iHome alarm clock/radio. The bathroom was a little odd in that the toilet is sectioned off with a door but the glass stall shower is not. So anyone can walk through while you're taking a shower. Not a huge deal, but I thought it was a little odd.

My ony minor complaint is that house keeping came knocking on our door at 8:15am on a Saturday AM. Granted we did forget to put the 'do not disturb' sign on the door, but still 8:15 was a little early, especially as we only stayed one night and were checking out that day anyway.

Overall a nice hotel and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient, comfortable and affordable
review.reviewText: The corner king room was spacious with nice views of the city. I chose the location to be close to Fillmore Street and away from the shopping madness around Union Square, where I've stayed before. This will now be my new preferred spot in SF. Room was clean, service adequate and adjacent parking garage was convenient. For the price, this is a great deal for SF. Ready to go again.

review.title: Japan Town Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Conveniently located to Japanese businesses, restaurants and Muni, the hotel offers excellent accommodations.

review.title: Wonderful find-great price for high quality
review.reviewText:
Near many good places to walk and shop. Japantown is a fun neighborhood close to hip streets: Pine, Jackson, Fillmore.
Hotel room was large, well appointed.
Absolutely will return.

review.title: Tranquility near the heart of the city
review.reviewText: This is a lovely well appointed hotel right next to Japan Town and only a few blocks from Union Square. The rooms are large with huge windows. The rooms and hotel are decorated with a modern Asian vibe, and there is a beautiful Japanese style garden that can be viewed from the lobby. Japantown, right next door offers lots of options for dining as well as the surrounding neighbourhood. This hotel offers terrific value in a great location. I would definitely stay there again on returns visits to the city.

review.title: Immerse in Japanese culture
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kabuki has some traditional japanese rooms and some with mixture of western with spa-like features. We had a room with a sauna, which was a nice change of pace and really helped take the chill off a rainy day! Many rooms have deep tubs, and some with whirlppol. We have stayed here several times becuase of family nearby and it is a nice, clean, quiet place to stay in the center of San Francisco without being in the middle of a city. The Japan Center is at your front door and a nice place to easily find a restaurant or shop for gifts. the only complaint is we often experience problems with hardware, such a tub drain that won't stay closed or a faucet that is loose. Some locations do hear traffic noise (busses), but we have not been bothered by it.

review.title: Great Hotel but no dresser to store clothes
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Kabuki is excellent in many ways but did not have a dresser in which to store clothes. The toilet part of the bath room had a musty odor.
Some areas could have used more attention in terms of cleanliness, i.e. revolving glass door had fingerprints and inside the elevators needed polishing on the door and fixtures.
Staff were excellent and helpful when asked for assistance.

Hotel Kabuki remains one of my favorite hotels and I would stay there again and recommend to friends.

review.title: a
review.reviewText: a

review.title: Quite hotel in the heart of Japantown!
review.reviewText:
Overall this is a nice quite, clean hotel in the heart of Japantown. We wanted to stay at Hotel Kabuki for our honeymoon because we love japanese decor, furniture, food, etc. The Japanese style shower and tub are so cool...we plan to copy it when renovating our bathroom at home. The bed was too firm, very uncomfortable for us...we have a temperpedic at home. The pillows were too soft and smooshie...we have firmer pillows at home.

No coffee maker in the room, a pot of room service coffee will cost about $20, no Starbucks near by. We did find an amazing little bakery inside the mall to the left of the hotel. The "Anderson Bakery" has wonderful pastries and great coffee to start your day! This hotel is close to bus lines and lots of little Japanese restaurants.

Next time we will try a different hotel.

review.title: Recommend this Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was formerly the Miyako Hotel, familiar to me from many visits to San Francisco. This was the first time that I stayed there, however, and based on my experience, I would definitely go back. The front desk staff were courteous, pleasant, and helpful (printing my airline boarding pass for me, for example). The room was just right, nicely decorated, and very comfortable. The deep tub was nice. If you want a clean, comfortable place to stay near Japantown and not far from downtown, I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Sauna in the room!
review.reviewText: Got a good deal and stayed in a room with built-in sauna. It's amazing. Loved it!

review.title: Kabuki made our stay perfect
review.reviewText: We located this hotel because our daughter said it was near Fillmore Street, a favorite neighborhood packed with small shops, great restaurants and bars. We were looking for a thrifty room rate and thanks to Expedia, we got a great deal. The Hotel Kabuki staff was pleasant, efficient, and unobtrusive. Our room was serene and lovely -- a wonderful Asian experience with all the high-tech amenities. The neighborhood is safe and quiet and a great place to begin and end the day. I can't say enough about how much Hotel Kabuki enhanced our San Francisco experience. We will indeed stay there again.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Hotel itself is great with oriental (Japanese) touch. Restaurant was so-so and parking is expensive and a short walk, albeit directly connecting the garage to the lowest floor of the hotel. Nice central location to whatever we wanted to attend and see.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
I attended a meeting held in this hotel and stayed here for convenience. The meeting room was exceptionally well decorated, not just a box. The lobby, meeting facility, and restaurant were very well done. The support staff was very responsive in setting up additional seating, as there were last minute attendees. The AV people were very capable. The Continental breakfast was excellent.

The rooms, however, were a disappointment. Everything had a slight musty smell, which is consistent with the fog, but made the part of the hotel where the rooms are just smell old. The hotel advertises recent renovation, which is obviously true for the public areas. The rooms have been given some cosmetic upgrades, but they still seem dated and run down. For example, there are old bifold closet doors and beat up wood work with a new coat of paint. The bathtub is out of the 1950's but now surrounded with marble.

The renovation of the public areas is very well done. The rooms look like they were done half way and on a limited budget.

review.title: Nice room but lack in details
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is quite convenience. When I stepped in the hotel lobby, it is really nice and inviting. The parking attendant is nice but very vague, he would give you valet parking ticket without giving out clear directions. Do asked because you can park there to check-in for about an hour or more. fyi. Everything in the room looks perfect until ... I looked at the linen/bed cover, it is not thoroughly cleaned and someone hair is all over on both of our queen beds. The shower knob is broken. When I turned on it. It fell right off, there is not fridge (you have to pay) or ice bucket, the radio ipod is lousy producing static sound. The room tend to be hot so you have to set AC higher than normal.

review.title: Good for Staying in Japantown
review.reviewText: This hotel suited our needs -- wanting to stay in Japantown and yet have easy access to public transport and facilities. Parking is ridiculously expensive! But by parking on the street at night and moving it into the lot during the day, we got around that. The rooms were ok, but not nearly as nice as represented on the website. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant -- very helpful. For what we wanted this trip, it worked out well for us.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kabuki was not at all what I was expecting. It was listed as 4 stars but it fell very short. The first room we were given was smelly, the smoke alert was falling of the ceiling,there were broken fixtures in the bathroom. The second room while it was better still had issues. Peeling wallpaper,broken closet doors, broken thermostat.The website stated the hotel rooms as being remodeled. They did not look at all remodeled or look like the photos on the website. They still have not answered the email I sent to the hotel.Plus we had to pay to park and did not even get a break on the fees since we were hotel guests. I will not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: An excellent room for getting it super cheap by booking with the flight. We almost bought the pillows off the bed, very comfortable. Was going to explore SF at night but stayed in instead. Great bathrooms and shower and tub. Kimono bathrobes. Beautiful views of Japantown and Pacific Heights. Would definately stay again.

review.title: Lovely Japantown experience
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Kabuki for our 5 year anniversary trip to San Francisco. My husband grows bonsai trees and we both love Japanese culture, so this was a perfect fit. The Kabuki has a beautiful bonsai garden in the courtyard and lovely oriental decor in the lobby. Although we booked a corner room, we ended up with a standard king room with a view, which ended up being a fine room, considering it was ready several hours before check-in. The Japanese decor in the room was a nice change from standard hotel rooms and the sliding glass door opening to the balcony was great at night - I love to have fresh air when I sleep rather than the standard air conditioning found in most hotels. Japantown is a great, quiet neighborhood for sleeping and we didn't hear our neighbors within the hotel at all during our stay. As others have suggested, skip the breakfast buffet - $18 per person is ridiculous for such average fare. We did enjoy happy hour in the bar however, as the prices and service were great. Although the hotel is a bit off the beaten track, we would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very Pleasant Hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location for finding litle places to eat. Room we stayed was very pleasant and clean. We already recommended to our friends a place to stay in SF.

review.title: best japan town in U.S
review.reviewText: the good point of this hotel is right in the japan town,good expierence to have japanese rstaurants and shops like so many and so closed to you.

review.title: SF Japantown's best hotel
review.reviewText: From the checking in to our departure, we could not ask for a nicer hotel. The hotel is beautifully maintained, very clean, personel is most helpful and friendly.We were most satisfied.

review.title: Chic and comfortable
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel in Japantown, far enough removed from the louder, busier tourist areas but still vibrant and offering plenty of things to see. Our bed was cozy, our shower refreshing, and every person with whom we interacted on staff was warm and professional. The hotel is physically connected to one small shopping center,with three more "sections" of mall reached by walking through a small outdoor plaza: plenty of restaurants and shopping opportunities right outside your door. We two thirtysomethings and our three-year-old would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Completely Satisfied
review.reviewText: I saw this hotel online and found it very interesting, I hoped that the pictures did it justice, so we booked our stay. When we arrived, we were amazed to finally see everything in person. Everything was great, from the parking lot to the lobby, from the concierge to the receptionists, from our bed to even the bathroom, everything was exceptional! Actually, when we had gone into the original room we had booked, we were disappointed. Not at the hotel, but because of the guests in the next room. They were extremely loud and noisy, so we called the front desk and they promptly moved us. Great customer service! Also, we loved the O Izakaya lounge! Good food, good drinks, and the bartender was great! I have never stayed at a hotel with a theme, so this Japan theme was really fun! Our expectations were met and more and we were completely satisfied with our stay! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: I would definitely stay there again. Location and Price for San Francisco was terrific
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my brief stay at Hotel Kabuki. The overnight parking was expensive per day. The good news is there is a parking garage right next to the hotel which is much more reasonable.

review.title: Zen-like hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: Very relaxing hotel right next to Japantown. The room and bath were large. The decor was not the ordinary. Sliding panels allowed you to make the room very dark....great for afternoon naps. The bath featured a Japanese-style tub and a separate shower. It was great to be able to walk straight through the lobby and into Japantown. The only complaint is the restaurant/ bar was closed on Tuesday.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: Close to downtown. 5 min bus ride to union square. Clean, wireless internet included.

review.title: LOVE it
review.reviewText: The only complaint I had with this hotel was that the restaurant was closed when I was there- thus no room service. Other than that- great room, great view and there were alot of restaurants really close by. great value for the money

review.title: Not impressed...
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel and the front desk person didn't even greet us and made us wait...They immediately asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a diff. room so we said NO. We get into our room and look outside and there's a huge vent that made a really loud noise. I was going to put up w/it but our wireless internet wasn't working. My Bf went downstairs to complain and they asked him if we wanted to pay extra to upgrade since the hotel is completely full. My smart BF asked to see their upgraded room before making the decision and he told me that the room was exactly the same but w/ a city view. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. On their website it says that their hotel was remodeled but nothing has been remodeled and let me just say that they took some nice photos of the rooms because it looks nothing like the photos.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in the past when it was The Miyako. After a year plus remodel (and corresponding rate increase) the hotel is really not much different on the surface. My room didn't have a hair dryer and when I requested one from the front desk, it never materialized, requiring a trip downstairs to pick one up. Rooms are OK but nothing special On the plus side, the bell staff is excellent, the free wifi is handy and the location of the hotel is great: out of the way but quickly accessible to everything in the city via proximity to bus lines. Bottom line..too expensive and seemingly justified by a "remodel" that really doesn't seem particularly extensive to those who stayed here prior to same. However, I would recommend the hotel for its plus factors.

review.title: very impressive
review.reviewText: very satisfied overall except the bed is too soft which caused the shoreness of my back. i'm end up sleep on the floor in the middle of the night.

review.title: Will come back again
review.reviewText: Very good hotel next to restaurants and shopping on Fillmore St. Close access to public transport on Geary St, 24/7 direct line to downtown San Francisco. Comfortable and spacious room for an excellent price. Overall, a very good stay.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, interesting decor, great views

review.title: So Beautiful
