review.reviewText: My husband and I went for our honeymoon and the staff there was great! They upgraded for free to a Japanese style suite,which was just breath taking. The property is beautiful, and convenient access to japan town and all munis(buses)to major locations were only short distances away

review.title: a little taste of Japan in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the Hotel Kabuki to anyone visiting San Francisco, who is also interested in Japanese art and culture! The room was clean and comfortable with a well-stocked honor bar that contained a variety of selections. I particularly enjoyed the Japanese style soaking tub and adjoining shower, very relaxing! The hotel is conveniently located at the east end of the Japantown Center, so there is plenty of food and shopping in walking distance. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great place/good price!
review.reviewText: Stayed there for three night. Great place for the price I payed. A lot of places to eat around, you can also park your car on the street (for free at night) near the hotel and avoid 16$ a day charge. Only minus is that the pictures on the web site does not correcpont correctly to the room you are getting. But any way room was big, spacy and very comfortable!

review.title: Nice hotel to stay if you're visisting SF
review.reviewText: Very clean, nice room, so so view from the window and nicely decorated. Located near down town, within walking distance to Union Square and other tourist spots. Will definitely stay again next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: Overall it is a good place to stay
review.reviewText: It is a nice Hotel if you dont have a problem to be in a place where everithing is decorated by japannes art. Buses stops very close to the hotel but you should take a ticket for all the days youre gonna stay.. becose the hotel is in a hill so, sometimes its not very pleasent to come back by foot.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, great location in SanFrancisco, there is free parking at 16$ x day and it's near Union Square ( 10 minutes walking ).

review.title: Nice Hotel but not really close to anything.
review.reviewText: Unless you need to be in that area, stay someplace else. We have two small kids so we couldn't just take off and walk. We had to drive to everything. Not to much to do in Japantown. Self parking is $16/day. Nice hotel though. Should have paid a little more and stayed in the Union Square/Financial area or even the Wharf area.

review.title: Convenient location to Japantown
review.reviewText: Renovated location more than adequate for business and/or leisure. Two passenger elevators tend to be very slow, especially around check-out time. Self parking area often full on weekend evenings since there is a cinema complex attached. Access to hotel from parking lot is not easily handicapped accessible. Access to hotel requires backtracking and two elevator trips.

review.title: Great choice...
review.reviewText: great location, hotel with atmosphere. the near japan center offer great choice of restaurant... higly recommend.

review.title: Very very nice for the price.
review.reviewText: Great hotel and a great price. Easy access to all parts of the city on the bus. It's about a 5 min bus ride to Union square. Also, if you've got a car, this hotel is a reasonable deal. You can park at the Japan Center next door for 15 bucks a day, pretty good in San Francisco.

review.title: Comfortable!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean and comfortable. There are Japanese and Korean restotant. I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed, spacious shower/tub area, lovely decor, including shoji screens. Narrow little balcony to look out over street. My only concern would be easy access to hotel floors via the parking garage. Anyone can have access to your floor without having to enter the hotel lobby first. A consideration for women traveling alone. Loved Japan Center.

review.title: Great local
review.reviewText: Great location, bus access, parking available, eats nearby

review.title: Really lovely - would definintely stay there again
review.reviewText: I spent 5 nights at the Kabuki and had a wonderful time. The room was great. I was on the 13th floor overlooking the pagoda in Japantown's square. The bathrooms have traditional Japanese seeping bathtubs as well as foot showers and a regular shower. There is is beautiful Zen courtyard garden with koi pond off the lobby. The hotel is conveniently located so that I could travel anywhere in the city within minutes in my rental or hop on the Bart or Muni to get anywhere I needed to go. For foodies, I would highly recommend trying Dosa, a Southern Indian restaurant located just 2 blocks from the hotel on Geery and Fillmore. And, of course, there are many great Asian restaurants surrounding the hotel. I will definitely stay there again if I need a hotel in San Francisco

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We rented two of the king corner rooms. These were very nice rooms with plenty of space, lovely decor and good views. The rooms were supposed to come with a complimentary tea service. We had to specifically arrange for this our last night, and only received it for one room. We also had to request hand towels and soap which had not been left in our room, but they quickly took care of us. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel.

review.title: Superb Service
review.reviewText: After reading many reviews of the hotels in San Francisco, we chose the Hotel Kabuki, and we were happy we did. We loved the location, the cleanliness of the hotel, and the helpfulness and politeness of the entire staff. We stayed there 6 nights: the first 2 nights on the 3rd floor in the renovated 4 story section of the hotel, and the other 4 nights on the 9th floor of the main hotel. Our first room was larger but did not have a soaking tub, nor a view, so we asked for and got a somewhat smaller room with a tub (also has shower head). And had a nice view of the southeast part of SF. The front desk staff and the bellmen were quick to please, whether with directions, providing change for the MUNI, or getting transportation. Joe even loaned me his corkscrew to open a bottle of Merlot we bought at the Flora Winery in Napa Valley. We would definitely stay at the Kabuki again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Ideal location, hotel is near so many great resturants and shops. All within walking distance. Spacious room considering it's San Fran. My room was right across the street from a high-rise residential building's loading zone (also their trash pick up area), it was very noisy with loading (trucks backing up) and trash pick up in the early morning hours.

review.title: Will consider going back
review.reviewText: Was enjoyable and the location is in the vicinity of Fillmore and all other destinations in SF via public transport. No commendable view, unfortunately.... otherwise satisfactory!

review.title: A welcome change from hotel chains
review.reviewText: The Kabuki is a quick taxi ride ,or 20 minute walk,to Union Square. The rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated and the deep Japanese soaking tubs are wonderful. Avoid the breakfast buffet which is disappointing and overpriced and the coffee, which is pure acid. Walk a few blocks to the cafes on Fillmore for French pastries and delicious coffee. coffee and French pastries there.

review.title: Nice hotel, the area isn't the best
review.reviewText: The hotel is very modern and cute. I am not sure on the service, as I only spoke to a staff member when I checked in and out. It is connected to the Japan mall and there are restaurants in there offering Japanese food, but there isn't any other food type around. You have to walk pretty far in kind of shady areas to get to the attractions and shopping. Our room seemed really clean but we did find a baby cockroach in our bed right before we were leaving (I have heard that is normal for San Francisco though).

review.title: Very good location. Everywhere within 10 mins drive. Quiet and staffs are extremely friendly.
review.reviewText: We came a long way from HK to SF with 13 hours flight. My kid was also got a fever during the flight. We arrived and speedy checkin made our life a lot more easier. My kid was sick again at late night and staff was very helpful to help check the location and availability of the medical centre nearby. It was 3am in the morning but everything was easy and really appreciate the help of the staff.

review.title: a perfect hotel
review.reviewText: i fine hotel in a great, safe location. i have stayed there 3 times and will return.

review.title: Very nice hotel; can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Very clean rooms and lobby; very comfortable beds; great service!

review.title: As comfortable as Tokyo...
review.reviewText: I have been fortunate to visit Tokyo many times and have stayed at some of the finest hotels there. The Japanese style bath and furnishings of the Hotel Kabuki matched the best in Tokyo. The only thing missing was the heated toilet seat and bidet. I could almost imagine looking out towards Mt Fuji from my 8th floor window.

review.title: Loved the Japanese accents
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be very picturesque. The valet parking attendant gave us good information about where to get breakfast, etc. Park in the underground parking at the mall. Rooms are on the small side, but okay for a family of 3 or 4. Loved the Japanese soaking tub and shower combo.

review.title: Hotel Kaboki - Great Showers
review.reviewText: Shower was great, room walls very thin.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Plesant stay. Clean and comfortable. But got a 2 queen bed room instead of 1 king bed room that I booked for.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very lovely hotel. Beautiful Japanese decor and gardens. Very comfortable...the beds were the best I have slept on in a hotel. This hotel is located in the heart of Japantown within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. Even in the non-city view rooms the view was very nice. Only a couple of items were a bit negative. The clerk at check-in wasn't very specific about parking causing a couple of extra trips around the block to locate it. The hallway smelled very strongly of cleaning products for a couple of hours. Then finally the restaurant was closed the evening we arrived. I strongly encourage anyone interested to stay at this hotel. It made for a great stay in Japantown.

review.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel in a Great Part of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki really is a great place to stay in San Francisco. Japantown is a quiet and clean part of town, with none of the aggressive homeless people you have to deal with in other parts of town. So, it's relatively safe to walk around at night. In addition, you're surrounded by some excellent shops and restaurants, so you don't have to really leave the area to eat. The room that I stayed in was very nice. I loved the shoji sliding screen window accents and the wooden black-out panels. The separate shower and soaking tub was very reminiscent of my stay in Japan. The hotel service was good for the most part, though they seem to employ the better doormen on the weekends. The daytime weekday guy was pretty apathetic. The hotel is in an aging edifice, and that much is evident if you look too closely, but it is clean, and the decor makes up for it. Frankly, if you're taking advantage of all of the tourist opportunities in San Francisco, you won't be in your room much anyway. ... The interior Japanese garden was lovely. You're just a 5 minute cab ride to just about anything in San Francisco (The Embarcadero, Union Square, the ball park, etc.), so Hotel Kabuki is convenient too. Overall, I highly recommend staying here. I loved Japantown, and the Hotel Kabuki was a wonderful place to come "home" to each night.

review.title: Looking forward to our next trip
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Kabuki. With it's central location, it was convenient to all of San Francisco. The staff was friendly and helpful and we will be returning to Hotel Kabuki when we re-visit.

review.title: Nice hotel in Japantown
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in the suite. We had 2 children with us and they got a kick out of the shoji screen dividing the rooms. We also had a dry sauna in the room, which was a treat for my husband, who had never been in one. Overall it was a great time in Japantown. Good location too, close to everything.

review.title: great hotel!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I decided to stay in Japan town for a change.We were walking distance to all- night sushi and really felt as if we were in Japan.The room was clean and the Japanese soak tub was a real treat!We were next to the ice machine and a coupe of honeymooners who didn't want to sleep at night=( other then that no city noise and very serene-which was great!The breakfast buffet was pricey-and not worth the taste-Overall it was an amazing hotel,great atmosphere and a change from your typical SF stay=))

review.title: Amazing Trip!
review.reviewText: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Kabuki for a week over the 4th of July holiday and had nothing but great service and and awesome experience. Continental breakfast is overpriced at $18 dollars for all you can eat pancakes, bacon, toast, etc however everything else was great. Bill the bartender is super nice and makes great drinks and all staff is pretty friendly. We had a corner king deluxe room on the 14th floor which they upgraded us to for free and provided more then enough space for the two of us. Also, being on the 14th floor provided a great view towards to the water. Central to everything- less then a 10 cab ride to fishermans wharf and most of the main attractions. Had a great time in SF and met cool people and the lounge. Try the spicy fries! Loved it and wish we were still there! Decent area- didn't feel scared or nervous like friends who stayed towards civic center. would definitely recommend- hope you have as a great a stay as we did. Ashley --- SF June 30th- July 6th 2009

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Will definitely stay on next trip to San Francisco

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: The beds were comfortable and the rooms were pretty clean. The bathroom was large with a wet room and a bathtub; however, some of the bath fixtures were old/dirty looking. You also have to valet park your cars for about $35 a day (which seems to be standard for hotels in the area). It was walking distance to some attractions in San Francisco, but we still had to drive to other parts like Fisherman's Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Rookie parents finally recharge at Kabuki!
review.reviewText: We were hoping for a couple of nights' respite from our newborn son who for the past five months, has kept us up most nights with his crying. We wanted to relax, be away from him a little bit, and not have to worry about making our beds, changing his diapers, or noisy neighbors. Kabuki Hotel upgraded us to a corner suite for free, also probably because we were celebrating our sixth wedding anniversary. The room was clean, smelled very nice, and was very comfy. The front desk always answered our calls within just a couple of rings, and was unfailingly polite. They gave me several bars of soap because I told them I loved the scent -- for free! They never minded when I was very repetitive with my questions --- my befuddled brain just couldn't process the information properly. I loved how it was in the heart of Japantown, so fresh and affordable fish was always within a stone's throw! LOVED OUR STAY! We'll definitely be back next year, for sure!

review.title: Great hotel but they miss the details
review.reviewText: Overall, I really like this hotel. I've styed 3 times in the past 12 months. The Japanese ambience, including the Japanese bathtub in the room, is really lovely. The location in Japan town is great, with lots of wonderful Japanese restaurants within a couple of blocks. The hotel restaurant is overpriced but there are so many alternatives it is not a problem. The desk staff are courteous and helpful. My only real complaint is that small stuff is not well attended to. Dishes from room service left in the hall for 2 or 3 days, a missing bath stool not replaced, a missing hotel directory not replaced despite several requests and promises "it was on its way." Like I said, small stuff but for the price, it should be taken care of. Otherwise, I'd gladly return and probably will.

review.title: we had a great time
review.reviewText: Had a great time, rooms great, staff friendly and helpful, problems rectified promptly, doorman especially helpful - great location, close to public transport.

review.title: Stay at the Hotel Kabuki
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and clean. Though the rooms were very small, it was still nice! The door service was excellent and bent over backwards to please. The front desk service was cordial and always helpful. The surrounding area was safe enough as well. The only minor circumstance I did not like was that, at checkout time, there were room charges for items we did not use from the mini bar totaling $15. We called the front desk though and this was quickly corrected without any further questioning. We did like the Hotel Kabuki a great deal!! I would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay away from the big, over-priced chains and go with a theme for their stay.

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, very comfortable bed, clean room, jacuzzi included and the service was excellent, close to everything. Waking distance to Union Square and Chinatonwn.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The Kabuki offers an excellent safe location away from the busyness of Union Square. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel in Pacific Heights
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to stay in Pacific Heights. We were looking for hotels in the area and found that this one was the best option.

review.title: Met expectations
review.reviewText: We had a really good stay. The location was perfect for us. When we make future trips to the bay area, this will be our choice.

review.title: Kabuki - lishious
review.reviewText: The Kabuki hotel in San Francisco's Japantown neighborhood is quite a treat. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well by the staff and it just got better. Our room was a "corner king" and it was spacious and very comfortable. It even had a traditional Japanese soaking tub. The hotel restaurant and bar had tasty Asian fusion food and great drinks as well. The bartender was exceptional and made us feel like we were regular customers on our first visit. You just can't beat the service and comfort that we experienced. We will be making this our regular place to stay in the city.

review.title: Wonderful Honeymoon!
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Kabuki for our honeymoon. The room and hotel were beautiful and I enjoyed every minute of our time there. The traditional Japanese soaking tub was a wonderful surprise and great for baths! Our corner room had double sliding doors that led to a small balcony that was great for looking out at the city and taking pictures. The staff was polite and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great Find in Japantown
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel that exceeded my expectations. I booked here to get away from the hustle and bustle of Market Street on my last day of a 7 day trip. I enjoyed a wonderful massage and body scrub at the Kabuki spa and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel is located in Japantown, so no BART station nearby. The hotel towncar driver drove my friend and I to the airport for $30.00, which was great and saved us both time. The rooms were very comfortable and have a balcony, which was a nice feature. The bathrooms are all travertine tile with a very deep tub with bath salts provided as well as an all glass enclosed shower-very nice. I will definately stay again for futher R & R...

review.title: Kabuki Hotel
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel, very friendly staff and very clean. The only issue I had was that the key to the room did not operate properly. I will definately go back to the same hotel.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Comfortable beds, always clean,good service, right in the middle of the city and excellent bar...I would recommend the sake mojito. If you want you can experience the traditional Japanese bath. They also have a beautiful Japanese garden in the midle of the hotel. the breakfast seems pricy but is buffet so you ca neat as much as you want.

review.title: Unique and very enjoyable
review.reviewText: Our room felt luxurious. It was roomy, very well decorated, and had a very comfortable bed. I would recommend this hotel!

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: I time at this hotel was fantastic, you walk through the revolving door and were whisked away to Japan. i totally enjoyed my stay

review.title: nice place to stay
review.reviewText: I felt it was a nice place to stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, short bus ride or 20 min walk from Union Square. Room was clean and comfortable. Lots of great places to eat close by. Would stay here again.

review.title: Get a room with the Soaking Tub
review.reviewText: What makes this hotle unique is that some of the rooms have Japaneese soaking tubs in the rooms and all have deep tubs with bath salts provided.

review.title: Always a great time
review.reviewText: My family and I have stayed at the hotel once before. We love its proximity not only to the Japantown Mall but also to other restaurants and the Safeway which are all in walking distance. We love the soaking tubs, the tea service, and the beautiful Shoji screens. We can't wait until we have another chance to visit.

review.title: Style, Convenience and Comfort
review.reviewText: Service - excellent Bed - very comfortable Traditional Japanese bath in-room - my wife adored it! Balcony with a view - added to the experience Convenience to the Fillmore - ideal location Staff - well-trained and friendly Lounge/Restaurant - cozy and friendly Overall experience - Exceptional!

review.title: Great Location in JapanTown.
review.reviewText: Clean room. Great view in room 1402. A little too close to the elevator though (ding). Exercise room works well.

review.title: staff good hotel needs some tlc.
review.reviewText: I like the hotel it needs some care but it seems the staff is over worked and can't quite get to everything.The room service not being available two nites a week is inconvient.

review.title: Very comfortable, great location
review.reviewText: In the heart of the Japantown shopping complex, the Kabuki reflects Japanese design -- down to a small Japanese garden on the ground floor. The rooms were very nice with perhaps the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Reasonable parking in nearby underground Japan center garage. Only downside for coffee drinkers: in-room instant coffee only! (Plenty of coffee shops nearby, though.)

review.title: The place to stay in San Francisco's Japantown
review.reviewText: Convenience, cleanliness and price are just a few reasons as to why I'd return to Hotel Kabuki. Being an older hotel, the room was not overly spacious, but it had all the amenities of a newer one. Free Wi-Fi should be offered in every room and is not. You have to purchase a card with pre-paid online minutes. It wasn't worth looking into, especially since I typically stay at hotels that offer HSI.

review.title: The Kubuki hotel
review.reviewText: The Kubuki hotel is a very nice, clean, and comfortable hotel, and reasonably priced. We enjoyed are stay there. Its close and handy to everything in Japantown, which was our main destination. We will stay there again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is well situated however the cleaning service is not good at all. When we return to the hotel the day after we checked-in the room was not clean, not our friends, we asked to the front desk for the service and they said that "unfortunately it will not be possible due the cleaning personnel were not at the hotel at that hour", so we have to wait until the next day. Besides this in general the hotel is good.

review.title: Cool hotel in a nice district
review.reviewText: Granted the japantown district is very small in san francisco, this is one of the highlights of it. Literally right next door, and I say this because there is a door connecting the two, is the miyako mall where you can find a ton of japanese style restaurants and shops, selling everything from food and household items to toys, manga, and anime. Overall the room was awesome. My only complaint was that the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling a little bit, but nothing serious. Best of all, its just a short walking distance to a lot of nice things, like Lafayette park, Alta Plaza park, Market St, Chinatown, Financial District, and South Pacific Heights.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Perfect location and extremely helpful staff. Could not have made the stay any more pleasant. Definitely my place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: The Tub Was Incredible, we will go back!
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable, the balcony was narrow but ok. The Tub was an experience! You must go with your loved one! WOW! Great little sushi restaurants all around, Yoshi's Jazz Club is down the street! We loved it. The parking is limited, we had to park, around the corner underground $15 overnight, decent compared to most of the parking in San Francisco, parking in SF sucks!

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The rooms are large and very comfortable. The free internet is a plus. Overnight garaged parking is just $15. I prefer this Hotel to any downtown location, less congestion.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Was a great hotel for the price at the time, and best of all, a great location. We had stayed in a bed and breakfast and various hotels in union square and thought the location was the best. It is away from the hectic,crowded feeling of downtown yet was very accessible to various parts of the city by the cable car system or by walking.

review.title: Best In Japan Town
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel! It's beautifully decorated from the lobby and gardens to the rooms. I had a corner room with a soaking tub and loved it. The soji screens in place of drapes were wonderful. The room was very spacious and clean. The king bed was made with fablous linens and had a very good mattress as well as good quality, fresh pillows. The staff was very helpful. The lounge was a nice spot to relax with a cocktail. I did not try the restaurant. Be sure to get the complimentery tea service on your arrival day. I usually stay on Nob Hill during my monthly visits to the city, but will stay at the Kabuki from now on. This part of town is quiet and restful, but offers some excellent shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Heaven in Japantown
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kaubki was such a treat. Everything was luxurious and comfortable. The rooms were very large. The location was somewhat odd in that all stores and restaurants in the area are truly Asian in character but that didn't affect our overall satisfaction with the hotel. The hotel, however, did not have a refrigerator in the room which we would have appreciated.

review.title: Great Japan Town Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was quiet for being in the middle of the city. The City view from our room was fabulous! And, it was in Japan Town where I had business engagements for the weekend which was very convenient for walking about. Taxis were only around $10.00 one way w/out tip to Fisherman's Wharf. The room was small but the bed extremely comfortable. No Fridge, bring a cooler.

review.title: loved the kabuki
review.reviewText: i wish we had had more time to just relax in our hotel room because it was so comfortable and relaxing. we arrived a few hours early, so our room was not yet ready. instead of making us wait, we got a free upgrade. it came with a continental breakfast that had delicious muffins and a jacuzzi tub which i used right away. the staff was friendly and accomodating.

review.title: Wonderful location in the middle of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Kabuki was too short! We actually were given an upgraded room with an in-room sauna i addition to the deep Japanese tub. The room was very large with two queen beds.

review.title: valet parking?
review.reviewText: When we got there, they had a sign saying valet parking. But, nobody was there to do it. I walked in and asked the front desk and they said somebody would be right there. We were blocking the area, not enough room. After waiting 20 minutes, somebody came up and said there was no more valet parking and you need to drive down the block and park in a public parking place. We had to walk a 1/2 mile with our bags. Plus, my friends room was not clean (we check in at 4:30).

review.title: Good for price, mixed bag
review.reviewText: A mix: beautiful lobby, good price per night, great location and unique room decor on the one hand and lack of amenities for customers (poorly equipped room, lack of bathroom fan and air conditioning, small exercise area, costly coffee and breakfast and service provided as if you interupted something more important. When at the front desk with others to have keys renewed, I noticed that everyone of different ages and backgrounds was treated equally - poorly. Still, who really cares when the city is really why we visit and there is much to be seen in Japan Town around the hotel as well.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Both the hotel and room were very good. The desk service was excellent and they were able to answer all of my questions. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel renovation was not done correctly by our standards. Rooms are small and service was lacking every time we returned to our rooms in the evenings.

review.title: My favorite SF hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel several times and have been impressed everytime. It's right next to Benihana's and the Filmore so it's great place to stay for a fun night of good food and good music. It's far from the tourist centers so it's not over-priced but still nice. A parking garage is right next door and isn't expensive. I suggest you spend the extra money for the rooms with the soaker tubs. Very cool.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice place. Loved the bathroom! Nice room too! Would go there again anytime. Great location!!!

review.title: Wouldn't waste my money...
review.reviewText: The hotel idea was very neat. However, the staff was unavailable to assist us. We had to wait forever to even check in. The lock on the doors kept malfunctioning. There were a lot of people down in the lobby having to get replacement keys. It is basically an older hotel that they slapped some paint on and nailed some new molding up. Frankly its not worth what they charge.

review.title: Good but not great
review.reviewText: Had a problem with dampness on the carpet. We had to change rooms but the hotel did so without a problem.

review.title: Will definitely go back!!
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki was in a great location, near some really fantastic Japanese restaurants. The hotel was really well kept and very clean. Also close to the city and other attractions of San Francisco

review.title: Trip to San Francisco-Correction to previous Post
review.reviewText: Hotel Great but I put our tour was by Royal but it was by Regal Tours.

review.title: awesome!
review.reviewText: My gf and I booked the corner king and could not have been happier!!! The room was very very spacious even with a king size bed in it! We've stayed 3 or 4 times at various hotels around SF and non can compare to this. you'll love it too!

review.title: Beutiful and comfortable room in a great area of SF
review.reviewText: The Kabuki is a beautiful hotel, service was excellent -though in room svc is quite expensive- and the Japan town neighborhood has it all...you dont need to go to the crowded streets downtown to find an excellent restaurant, shop, movie theater or whatever. We had an amazing king corner view room, comfortable to work in (free wifi) and to rest after a long day. We are planning to go back to the Kabuki soon.

review.title: Respite from the usual chains
review.reviewText: Stayed just one weekend night in January 2008. The hotel is part of the Joie de Vivre group of independent hotels. I have stayed at 3 of their locations in the SF Bay Area and have found each to be refreshing, unique, a bit upscale, and, with Expedia's special rates, excellent values. Our room at The Kabuki (formerly the Miyako) in San Francisco was very nicely furnished, with a light and airy feel. The King/jacuzzi room felt large, very comfortable. The bed had the adjustable firmness Sleep Number mattress. The iPod clock-radio was also a nice perk. On the minus side, wi-fi reception was very weak in the room, although you can ask the front desk for a repeater (amplifier) that fixes the problem. As in nearly all places in SF, the streets are congested and parking can be an issue. Hotel parking is in the Japantown center's lot under the hotel and is often crowded, but cost less than half of what you would pay to park at most hotels in SF. If your business or leisure takes you to this part of town, I highly recommend The Kabuki Hotel.

review.title: Very good location. Will be back if possible.
review.reviewText: We were staying 4 days in San Francisco. I asked for a room with views but none was available when we arrived. We were offered a change next morning. We went out to visit the city and when we were back they had moved all our staff to a very nice room with views. Overall, a very nice place to stay, not in the busy downtown but well comunicated with two buses very near the hotel.

review.title: Great location, Japanese style bath - cultural experience!!
review.reviewText: We booked a room with a king size bed. Great location with city view. LOVED the Japanese style bath - deep tub with a washing area on the side. Only complaints are: 1) strange room structure around the bathroom area and 2)balcony not cleaned. Overall, great room with low parking fee. Will go back there again!

review.title: Kabuki Japantown
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki is excellent. Staff helpul and friendly. Room clean and bright and modern. 15 mins from Union Square by bus, excellent local Japanese shops/restaurants and of course if you are going to a gig at the Fillmore, it's just a 5 minute walk away! Will be going back when I go back to San Fran!

review.title: A little piece of Japan
review.reviewText: Experience a little piece of Japan from the deep tub with hand oke, washing station to the cramped toe-stubbing chair and desk. Location is fantastic if you are planning some shopping and eating in Japan town or venturing to The Filmore to catch a concert. Not so convenient if you are planning to visit Union Square or Pier 39. The hotel is not really tall enough to provide a spectacular city view, especially if fogged in. Parking is convenient if you are planning to just dump the car and walk.

review.title: Nice hotel, if a little in disrepair
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a convenient location to Japantown. We had a Corner King room with the deep Japansese-style bathtub - very comfy! The bathroom was a little shabby. They could stand to do some tile repair. The room itself was comfortable, mattress and bed linens were perfect. For a remodeled, older hotel it was fine.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: The hotel was renovated. I stayed for two nights and it was a good experience. Toilets were big and clean, just not enough light for applying make up.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The hotel is in process of renovation, and there are rooms which have no heat or AC working. This could be OK in San Francisco, except for street noise. We were first offered such a room, and after a few minutes we asked for a different one. The second room was great, and we had a wonderful stay there.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: great clean friendly , just watch playing your music at night you might get securety comming

review.title: Sad Maintenance
review.reviewText: The overall look of the room was great and the view was nice. The problem was with the bathroom in the our room. The water pressure was weak and flushing even the smallest bit of tissue took three flushes. The shower knobs were loose which made getting the right mixture of cold and hot water difficult.

review.title: Nice little get away!!
review.reviewText: We wanted to take a short trip outta town before our new baby's arrival!! We picked Hotel Kabuki online for its location, and decor!! It was exactly what we expected, and then some. From the Zen garden, unique room design, complimentary tea service, wonderful staff, spa close by, and location we were thrilled. We left very relaxed, and we will be back!!

review.title: Kabuki was ok
review.reviewText: One thing I didn't like about the Hotel was the fact that the bathroom didn't have an exhaust fan and smelled moldy. It did have a vent for the A/C and we had to have the A/C on all the time to make the smell of mold a little more bearable. I loved the fact that they changed the linens every day and that the room was very clean.

review.title: Loved this hotel and city!!
review.reviewText: First trip to SanFran for my wife and I. At first we were not too sure about location but it worked great for us. Walking distance to bus line and trolley or if you rent a car it is an excellent location right in middle of the city. We had considered Fishermans Wharf but after visiting, too touristy. We had also considered staying in Union Square but that part of town never sleeps it seems. So Kabuki was the perfect retreat to relax after long days of doing as much as possible in this amazing city. Staff is excellent and extremely courteous. Bell hops are in the know for transportation. Excellent food at their restaurant, albeit on the pricey side. Within 1 block walking distance there is a Michelin Star certified restaurant and several authentic hibachi and sushi bars.

review.title: Relaxing
review.reviewText: Very relaxing and comfortable room. Lovely staff In the middle of Japan town, easy access to other parts of town. Very good breakfast in the hotel restaurant.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little too shabby and the location is pretty bad too.

review.title: Study in contrasts
review.reviewText: We were really looking forward to our stay, and overall we were satisfied with our stay at Hotel Kabuki. However, we found for every feature we loved about the hotel, there was something slightly off. They remodeled recently, and our room was nicely decorated and spacious--but there was mold on the ceiling in the shower, and some unsightly cracks in the baseboards. The bed was very comfortable, but the walls were thin enough for us to be woken up by the elevator across from our room in the morning. The complimentary toiletries were of the highest quality--but they only gave us one bar of soap our entire stay (it was big enough, but a bit odd). None of the issues bothered us enough to complain and we'd stay there again.

review.title: Great location but not as great as advertized
review.reviewText: The room is not as luxurious as advertised. It looks a bit old. But perfect location, lots of restaurants and groceries nearby. Maybe that's why the price is a bit high.

review.title: Fun and friendly hotel
review.reviewText: The guys on front desk were really helpful and although this hotel is showing the signs of age it is well run well located.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Kabuki Hotel. Our room was pleasant and the bath especially nice. The hotel is located near the Japan Center and the Fillmore Street area. A great location to start out exploring the city either by foot, public transportation or car. The staff was very welcoming and helpful.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Place and folks.

review.title: Perfect choice
review.reviewText: Just returned from 4 nights at the Kabuki Hotel. We wondered how we'd fare with 2 adults and 2 teenagers in one room -- but it turned out to be the perfect choice. We all fell in love with this hotel! The room was surprisingly spacious and beautifully decorated -- elegant and soothing. Two double beds were made up with soft white linens, fluffy comforters and plenty of good quality pillows. There was room for a roll-away bed too. The bathroom is large -- a walk-in shower and a separate bath with instructions for Japanese bathing. Everything you need is there, all tastefully done. Hotel staff was always responsive. Convenient location with wonderful Japanese restaurants close by. We would definitely go back!

review.title: Problems Solved
review.reviewText: I love this hotel. My second stay and I had some issues with the first room I was assigned. Within 30 minutes I was moved to another room which was excellent and had a great stay. Not in the regular tourist area and quite central if you know your way around San Francisco at all. Great ambiance and a helpful, pleasant staff.

review.title: awesome!!!!
review.reviewText: My Husband took me to this hotel for my birthday and it was amazing. we stayed in one of the corner king rooms. It had amazing views, comfortable bed. very spacious room. the decor was beautiful. we can't wait to go again. we make many trips to San Francisco and plan on staying many nights at Kabuki!!

review.title: Gorgeous hotel!
review.reviewText: An absolutely lovely hotel -- everything was gorgeous, right down to the room keys. For some reason I was given an executive suite for a regular room rate, and everything was perfect, from the Japanese style bathtub to the delicious welcoming tea to the sleep number bed. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

review.title: Luxurious Simplicity
review.reviewText: The Hotel Kabuki is an oasis in the heart of San Francisco. It is located in the Japantown area of the Fillmore District, with great shopping and dining within walking distance of 2-3 blocks. The staff exhbited the finest in Japanese politeness, and when you walked through the revolving door into the lobby, the atmosphere induced relaxation. This is a hotel that we will definetly stay in again when we make a weekend getaway to the City by the Bay.

review.title: Best Hotel In Japan Town
review.reviewText: We would stay there again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: As always visiting Hotel Kabuki is a mixture of Culture, art, music, and good food. We love its location. The staff was wonderful. I wish I could visit more often. We had a corner King room with Japanese bath. A little bliss goes a long ways.

review.title: Hotel Kabuki - 5 stars
review.reviewText: The hotel room was large, fully handicap accessible / disability freindly. The staff were amazing. A bellman met me in the hallway (on my way to the front desk) and stored my luggage and arranged transportation to the airport. Great staff, nice place!

review.title: Service needs improving
review.reviewText: Newly renovated rooms but overall experience is "motel" service, not the hotel service expected from the expedia price. Other hotels of similar price offer much better experience with no hassle when asking for service.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in Japantown in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Lovely, tranquil hotel in Japantown

review.title: Excellent Hotel...
review.reviewText: This Hotel was impressive by mixing with a stylish design and foreign cultural together. It is in great location for downtown visit, and the quality of the services was excellent. The interior design was great and I would definitely recommend my friends to stay. PS: I like the body lotion very much.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I was there for 4 nights with family, hotel is in a great area, very central, was very quiet, and clean, would definitely stay here again

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: we stayed in a corner king room with the soaking tub. the bed was comfortable, although my husband is not a big fan of feather pillows. the soaking tub was incredible. we were on the 5th floor, and could occasionally hear emergency vehicle sirens, but not too loud. we could also hear some hallway noise, but again, not too loud. the restaurant was good, though pricey. we did the valet parking for $25. i think there is a self-park garage nearby for less.

review.title: best stay ever
review.reviewText: The hotel had a charm to it that made it very easy to relax and enjoy.

review.title: Favorite Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, we got into SF very late and there was no trouble checking in. I also loved the facts about Japanese culture that you could find throughout the room. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting SF. I have stayed in many hotels in the area and this one is by far the nicest.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Kabuki is very nice and very convenient. The staff there are very nice. The room amenities were great.

review.title: Nothing works properly
review.reviewText: WLAN was down most of the time A/C did not work (until I got another room) Very few TV channels (no CNN!) Key cards had to be remagnetized every other day

review.title: A Serene Stay
review.reviewText: A little removed from the bustle of downtown but all the same highlights still easily accessible. A serene atmosphere with tasteful Japanese styling--rice paper screens, etc. Ridiculously comfortable bed.

review.title: For size ask for a Kyoto annexe room, for style get one in the main hotel building
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Kyoto annexe to the main hotel. The room was very large and light but wasn't as nicely decorated as the main hotel rooms and looked a little tired when compared to the rest of the hotel (bathroom was nice though). Generally things were clean although housekeeping kept forgetting to replace towels and one day forgot to clean altogether. The rooms in the main hotel were much smaller but the decoration was lovely and they had separate baths and showers. The staff were extremely helpful and made the stay very pleasant.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: When we got to the hotel the front staff upgraded our room to a garden suite which has a sauna, a mini bar, a spacious bedroom seperated from the living room with tatami walls. The location is very central and the staff are very friendly.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: We didn't quite know what to expect, however it ended up exceeding our expectations. You are just $1.50 bus ride, straight down Post,8 blocks, to Union Square. From there you can take the Cable Cars to the Wharf, China Town, North Beach (little Italy) and pretty much anywhere that you would like to go. In regards to the hotel, the rooms were clean, very trendy and the entire hotel did a nice job of sticking to its theme. Only item that I would mention to those traveling for the first time, there is no concierge on site, at the hotel, so make sure to research before you go for site seeing and exploring.

review.title: Basics needs meet.
review.reviewText: The location was good for the purpose of my trip. Overall the experience was positive.

review.title: Initially bad, then improved
review.reviewText: AC did not work in first room. Maintenance man told me AC working normally. Front Desk said they would bring a fan. I requested a different room. They put me in a temporary room for a night then moved me to a similar room for the remaining 6 nights. Don't tell a mechanical engineer with a refrigeration license that an AC is working normally when it is blowing 80 degree air and it is only 75 degrees outside. If the room is uncomfortable- ask for a new room. Replacement rooms were much better.

review.title: No Drawers
review.reviewText: On our last stay at the Kabuki, we found out that they don't have drawer chest in all the rooms. The mini bar cabinet is inside the closet,making even less room to store your clothing. If you pack alot keep it in your suit case.

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms and bathrooms are very spacious. The rooms are beautiful. Beds are comfortable. The walls are not thin. I have stayed in a lot of different hotels in San Francisco and the walls are like paper, but not at Kabuki. It was very peaceful. The staff is wonderful. I will be coming back to Kabuki.

review.title: ok except for room temperature
review.reviewText: The room and the hotel are nice. Managers wine reception in lobby each day is great touch. However, east-facing room boiled during the day, AC non-existent. Finally, long, dark hair from Maid (I am guessing) was on the side of tub. Gross. Free WiFi connection was poor with dial-up speed connectivity. Traffic noise is pretty loud.

review.title: Very nice and clean!
review.reviewText: The room wasn't all that big, but very comfortable and nice. Hotel staffs are very nice and helpful. Located right next to all the yummy yummy japanese food!! If I go to S.F. again, I would stay in this hotel!

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We were enticed to stay here because of its Japanese theme and we were not disappointed. The whole area is very Japanese in feel. Having said that, the one problem was that it was not to easy to find nearby eateries which were not Japanese. Our breakfast always tended to be in the hotel where western options were available but this was probably more expensive than if we'd been able to visit a diner. The area surrounding the hotel was nice but it took us 25 mins (possibly just over a mile) to walk down (well up and down!) to Union Square, so it is not in a very central location for tourists. Bus service was good, especially on Geary Street. The hotel was as we expected. The rooms are nicely done out with Japanese screens and we had a Japanese bath which was nice to try out. Good TV and stereo with adaptable ipod docking which will charge your ipod or an alternative cable for other mp3 players. Some noise was heard from people in the corridors and from the roadworks which set up the night we arrived, but it was not too much of a problem. There were signs of wear and tear in the corridor but nothing too bad. The hotel is very much geared towards conference attendees (there were a lot of events going on virtually everyday we were there) and business travellers but we were made to feel welcome.

review.title: Japantown hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in Japantown, and understand its recently been refurb'd. Very goo condition, rooms excellent, very clean, spacious in traditional japanese theme. Hotel staff all very friendly and helpful. Didn't eat in hotel bar, but had drinks, very nice, some good sake cocktails. Location in Japan town very good, some cool local restauarants just across the road, plus a japanese karaoke bar which was good fun. Only fualt would be its a reasonable way out from fishermans wharf and union square, but there is a bus stop just outside on the corner every 20 mins, so not too bad. Taxi's from fishermans wharf + union square back to hotel also not too expensive. Would throughly recommend hotel.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: As a family of four, we found the rooms to be a bit smaller than expected, but (barely) large enough. The amenities were nice. We enjoyed the bath salts, and the orange eye things. The welcome tea service was very nice, though we wouldn't have known about it had I not read the reviews and asked. Rooms were clean, view was nice. Service was fine, though nothing special. My daughter lost a retainer in the linens and it was never found. We only had breakfast in the restaurant. It was excellent, but pricey. I loved the location. Quiet neighborhood. Everywhere interesting is a quick bus hop (get a pass).

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This Japanese decor for this hotel and its rooms is lovely and this is what sets it apart from other hotels. Everything is first rate and true to what's on their website. The restaurant in the hotel also serves an excellent breakfast.

review.title: very zen
review.reviewText: the room was very zen,had nice decor, sheets, bathroom, good smelling soaps and shampoo many exrtas loved the little patio especialy at 4:20 when the sun was at its warmest. Have allready recomend this place to friends and will definitly stay again

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Really friendly staff.comfortable stay. I will recommend this hotel!

review.title: renovation half completed
review.reviewText: The lobby is very nice and you can't beat the overnight parking rate, 1/3 of what other hotels charge. Whereas the bed was very comfortable, the hallways and rooms were only redecorated. The showers, tile , wallpaper and ceilings are tired. It looks good in photos. I called for directions and the lady who answered the phone was not to be understood. When I asked her to repeat, she yelled for an associate to take the call.Complimentary Tea service was nice.

review.title: Somewhat Impressed
review.reviewText: Good location and good view for the price. The room was very well decorated and should be commended for its use of space and for its decor relative to the area that it is located. The hallways of the floors need a little bit more renovation as the lighting in the hallway is a little to dim and makes the mood in there a little too somber. Overall, I think that this is good place for the price of the City.

review.title: Excellent Hotel with Courteous Staff
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel in close proximity to downtown. The staff were fantastic and extremely helpful, with good advice given on local and not so local trips!!! Bed was, without a doubt, the most comfortable ever slept in. Transport links to major attraction a stones throw from hotel door. Would certainly recommend to friends and family who are looking for a great hotel in a safe environment away from the hustle of downtown!!!

review.title: Staff trying, but not getting there...
review.reviewText: All the people are nice and try hard, but the hotel just doesn't deliver, probably through lack of investment. The fitness room is a joke, with a few pieces of outdated and barely functioning equipment. The continental breakfast in the Club area was pathetic, and what was there wasn't refreshed/refilled during the morning, so if you get there later in the morning, don't expect much if anything to be left. Overall, for the price, a poor performance. Again, though, I give credit to the staff for trying. Unfortunately, there aren't many good choices if you want to be close to the west side of SF, so they'll probably continue to do ok...

review.title: Friendly Place
review.reviewText: Spent four nights at this place in a king room. Had a nice view of the coy pond from our window. Wine/sake tasting hour was fun (the chances we had to partake) - met nice people from around the country.

review.title: Small but NICE, large bathtub + japanese style room
review.reviewText: - Very friendly and polite stuff. - 15 mins walk to Downtown, bus stop rite accross the street too. - Fitness room is small. - Double room is standard size. Bath tub and bathroom is very nice. - very clean, with a nice little balcony too. - Cable TV, has ESPN and HBO. - Slow wireless internet. - A japanese convinentient store right next to the hotel. Also a large variety of Japanese/Korean Restaurants in the area. - Room services did a great job. Towels and body washes/shampoo are replaced constantly. - Overall speaking, Highly Recommended for small group travel. It may be little to small for a family.

review.title: Stylish Affordable Convenient
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel for travelers looking for a true San Francisco experience a bit away from the usual tourist attractions. The hotel is located in a great area of the city near public transportation, shopping and restaurants. I had a 4th floor, garden room with the most comfortable, king size bed I've ever experienced. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and gracious. The surrounding area is great. I felt safe returning on foot late at night. Plus, it's one of the cleaner areas in SF. In addition to shopping and restaurants, Japan Town has a number of interesting plaques in the 9-12 square historical blocks surrounding the hotel. Hotel Kabuki is a four star property at a great price! Traveler's Tip Category: Local attractions Traveler's Tip: Fillmore Street is an easy walk from the hotel. You'll find an amazing assortment of restaurants and unique, one of a kind boutiques and home furnishings stores on Fillmore and the surrounding streets. For a special treat, take the Fillmore bus to the top of the hill overlooking the bay and be awed by the beauty of the city, the GG Bridge and the surrounding incredible architecture.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: I stayed for 2 nights in early March 08. The staff were extremely helpful, efficient & friendly. I had a corner room which was clean, spacious & well equipped. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was excellent with a shower 'wet area', japanese soaking bath & seperate WC. The place could do with a lick of paint on the outside which is eveident when you use the balcony. There is a free happy-hour with wine & saki which gives you a cance to mingle with other guests & Virgin-Atlantic crew who use the hotel at the moment. The bar is nice & bar food good (I didn't use the restaurant).

review.title: Great hotel with $3.00 cups of coffee!
review.reviewText: The hotel was cool, clean and centrally located. The only problem was the $3.00 cup of coffee!

review.title: wonderful little hotel, excellent value
review.reviewText: would definitely stay at this hotel again. quiet neighborhood, near restaurants, centrally located, clean and well kept, great staff

review.title: Pretty Good
review.reviewText: Everything was great, people were friendly and location of hotel wasn't bad (in heart of Japantown). But the problem was there was too much sunlight in my room... and it takes a long time for the toilet to flush -_-' Overall, really great.

review.title: Kabuki is a hit!
review.reviewText: The staff at Kabuki is terrific! Great hotel, size, location and amenities. Rooms are well appointed and beds are excellent. Great value, too.

review.title: Spacious room
review.reviewText: The room is very spacious and quite comfortable. It is conveniently located in Japantown with lots of restaurants and small shops within walking distance. If the TV offers more different programs, that would be perfect.

review.title: Good quality SF Find!!!
review.reviewText: We picked the Hotel Kabuki based on reviews and I have to say it was excellent! It is not too far from the major touristy destinations, but just far enough that we felt like we are able to just relax in our room. The neighborhood was really nice and parking was not an issue. We parked on the street with no problem because the hotel lot was always full when we arrived. The hotel staff was very helpful in helping us select restaurants and overall just generally nice and inviting. When we first arrived, our room did not have a view. We went back to the front desk and they upgraded us to the 13 floor with a magnificent view at no extra charge. We had originally reserved a king room. That was a welcoming surprise after a 6 hour flight. Room service was excellent! I would definitely recommend the Hotel Kabuki.

review.title: I will come back!
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel, very kind staff, the food is delicious!

review.title: Great deal.
review.reviewText: Great location and bargain price. Parking reasonable.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: When we arrived, we were supposed to get tea service but never got it. We were supposed to be upgraded to a larger room & never got that. We didn't have a foot stool in our bathroom & they tried to charge us for that as well as 2 beers from the mini bar which we never drank. There is no dresser in the room...Where are you supposed to put your clothes. Beautiful hotel & comfortable beds though!

review.title: It was greate
review.reviewText: My husbend and I loved it.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: My family (two adults and children 5 and 2) had a very pleasant stay at Hotel Kabuki. Since it was newly renovated, it was clean, nice, beds were excellent and overall service was very good. Only minuses were the non-central location, pricey breakfast (though very good!) and slightly careless Room service. The environment in the heart of Japantown was very pleasant and there were plenty of Japanese and Korean restaurants and shops. The closest Starbucks was though a few blocks away. I can warmly rewcommend the hotel if you do not mind the distance to downtown.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The service is excellent. The corner 1 king bed room with deep soak bathtub is fabulous. The room is so spacious and comfortable.

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText: I had a very pleasant experience at the Kabuki. However, the walls are relatively thin so I was able to hear the guests in the rooms adjacent to mine. I was also disturbed by the excessive noise that the hotel staff made while working/moving through the corridor.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was great for the comfort level but the customer service was very poor.At first,we asked them to provide us with a extra coffe maker and it took them approximitly an hour to give us this small insignigicant item. But besides that,we felt very comfortable in the hotel room provided for us and thought that the cleanliness of the room was what we were attracted to that urged us to book this hotel. I really enjoyed their soaps and shampoos because the smell was so sweet and light,i felt like i was floating above the Effiel tower. I strongly suggest that you take some fo their spectacular soaps home and exprience the lightfulness of the incredible soap. I recommend this hotel to those who just want to lay back and close their eyes in a peaceful enviroment,in morden Japantown.

review.title: A different kind of experience
review.reviewText: The Kabuki hotel was an very enjoyable place to stay during my time in San Francisco. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Situated next to the Japan Centre, the location of the hotel gave me an opportunity to have some of the best Japanese food after a long day of sightseeing.

review.title: A Unique Stay
review.reviewText: The Japanese theme is quite enjoyable. I had the opportunity to stay in a western style room with the sleep number bed and whirl pool bath tub and a more eastern style room with the separate shower and deep bath tub. The sleep number bed was not as good as I had hoped for. As for the bathrooms, the deep tub was far more enjoyable. The separate shower stall allows you to soak in hot soap free water immediately after cleaning.

review.title: Nice Japantown Neighborhood Hotel
review.reviewText: You will not be disappointed here. Stayed in a corner king room with whirlpool Japanese-style tub. All amenities and bedding first-rate, and a bargain for SF. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. American-style continental breakfast is ordinary but fresh. Of course, lots of great Japanese restaurants and bars nearby, plus Fillmore Street shops.

review.title: It is convenient and comfortable.
review.reviewText: In the middle of Japan Town, Kabuki Hotel, formerly known as Miyako Hotel, is one minute away from Japanese supermarket, restaurant and the Kabuki Theatre. It is cozy, comfortable and convenient.

review.title: Kabuki
review.reviewText: Clean, great corner room.... soaking tubs are small though the shower was great. It is less than 10 dollars to anywhere in SF proper by cab. It is a fewminutes walk from Fillmore street...great neighborhood

review.title: Amazing hotel and great neighborhood!
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff was accomodating and the neighborhood was enjoyable! The bus stop to downtown was only half a block up the street, which was a great savings in taxi fares for us. The only negative was that the bathtub drain was not replaced during their otherwise outstanding and wonderful renovation.

review.title: Japanese serenity in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a lovely hotel in Japantown in San Francisco. It was undergoing some refurbishment while we were there but they were doing this very sensitively and there was no disruption or mess - just one closed restaurant and a small reduction in services. The decor is beautiful with sliding rice paper screens to filter the sun coming in the windows and beautiful Japanese furniture. I'd definitely recommend getting a room with a Japanese deep soak tub. Amenities in the hotel were great with Aveda products in the bathroom, an ipod station in the room, wireless internet access and a wine reception every day. If you ask the hotel, they will provide a refrigerator in your room - cold milk for cereal and coffee and cold white wine in our room made it very nice. The location in Japan town is great - you are away from the bustle of 'downtown' but only a few minutes away in a taxi or on a bus. The restaurants around the hotel were excellent and the Japanese shopping mall was amazing - a really interesting alternative to Chinatown, excellent for jewellery, ceramics, homewares and fun japanese hello kitty knicknacks. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very good option to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I'm really happy I picked this hotel! I had a great time. The rooms are great... I loved the Japanese decor - I actually returned to it at the end of my 7-day trip and it felt "like coming back home"... I stayed first at the concierge level (5th floor - club level, I think) it was good and included breakfast... the second time I stayed on a regular room on the 14th floor - it was great too - the rooms was smaller, but with a small balcony on both sides... excellent parking - no need to valet... you can park underground during the night and in front of the hotel during the day... I learned that after paying more to valet the first day. If you valet, it does not guarantee a spot during the day... you may have to go to the garage anyway... so, if you see a spot in front of the hotel during the day...take it! Don't forget to have free drinks from 5-6 pm - red wine, white wine or sake!!! I get no commission from Expedia...but booking online with them was cheaper than at the hotel... I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Helpful staff .Hotel a work in progress
review.reviewText: Employees were very cheerful and helpful. Our room was cramped, due to its position -there was a big closet in the hallway that robbed space from our room -I don't think all of the hotel's rooms were this small. Our shower head holder was broken. Other than that, the Japanese look of the room and the neatness was nice. Loved the Aveda products and the big, fluffy towels and Japanese bath and bathsalts. Japantown was interesting, quiet, but perhaps a little farther away from some of the sights than we might have liked. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Not worth the money now that it has been remodeled
review.reviewText: We always stayed at the Miyako Inn on our trips to San Francisco. The on-line price was great and we found the hotel to be top rate. On our recent stay, at much higher prices due to remodeling, we found the following: in our 'garden view' room , the windows were filthy and did not look onto the garden. Our room had no soap near the sink or in the bathroom. The hot faucet turned one way, the cold faucet another way in the sink. There was a lounge type couch and lamp which had to be moved in order for one lodger to get to the bathroom at night. The closet had a mini bar set up that took up almost the entire closet; there was only about 9 inches of space to hang up clothes.

review.title: It was okay.
review.reviewText: If you're accustomed to a coffeemaker in your room, this isn't the hotel for you. They had a hot pot with freeze-dried instant coffee. It's in Japantown. Not a Starbuck's in sight. When we turned on the TV, the station was set to porn. I'm sure this was an accident, but we were shocked and glad we didn't have anyone underage with us. They did have a nice complimentary wine tasting. The lack of good coffee was a big negative for us. Oh, and there's no blow dryer in the bathroom either.

review.title: Great Hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in the heart of San Fran in "Japantown". Hotel was clean and comfortable. Many restaurants within walking distance and the hotel has a little mall attached to it! Hotel is centrally located about 15 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and the downtown shops. My only complaint was that they charged for the buffet breakfast.

review.title: Safe, beautiful and restful stay
review.reviewText: Nice staff,very quiet and restful accomodations and surroundings, totally accomodating in the impressive Japan Town setting among delicious and delightful ethnic cuisines and truly gracious hosts and hostesses. This is where I will always want to stay when in San Francisco!

review.title: good hotel quiet
review.reviewText: nice stay. enjoyed it. will com back again... one small suggestion, please put some soap in bathroom..

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Pros: The room was great; nice size, nice decor, great bathroom. The staff were very helpful and kind. The location was convenient to downtown and many buslines. Cons: The details of the room were a bit sloppy; trim was cracked, wallpaper didn't cover full area of wall in certain spots, light switch panels were crooked, etc.

review.title: miyako
review.reviewText: cool asian bathroom

review.title: ok, but no pool
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok. However, while they advertise there is a pool, there isn't. They have an agreement with a fitness club two blocks down the street, but we had to pay to use it and children below 18 are not allowed.

review.title: Room Design
review.reviewText: This hotel in being remodelled, but we were in one of the remodelled rooms. I found the bath very annoying, being a mix of Japanese and western. For some reason they have chosen not to provide shower curtains on the tub so the entire bath area gets wet when showering. Another very annoying thing is that there is no door to the bathroom, so people using it at night and turning on the light disturb anyone sleeping. There were also strange noises coming from the mechanical system, and the air conditioning did not work properly. I also found it very annoying that they play very loud jazz music in the breakfast room. The staff, I must say ,were very pleasant.

review.title: A very good hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: The Miyako was in the midst of renovations and was still a great selection. The peaceful ambience of japan was evident in architecture, landscaping and service. It is well worth the trip into the city.

review.title: Improvements on the way....
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Miyako before and found it to be comfortable, quirky hotel, in a great location. I was disappointed then on my recent visit to find that it has deteriorated in quality- the rooms and hallways are looking shabby - and even more so to find that I was staying during a period of major refurbishments. That said, the staff upgraded my room and the construction seemed to be being carried out out of sight. The restaurant and bar are excellent quality and the very reasonable price of the rooms reflect their curent upgrading process.

review.title: The hotel itself is great but....
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was nice. The drawbacks were minor. We got a corner room that was spacious but with a slight musty smell my girlfriend said was in the room (personally, i didn't notice it), a cracked closet door & a tv that wasn't easily viewed from the bed. The armoir its in is perpendicular to the bed & the swivel its on didn't come out or rotate enough. The bed was large and comfortable and although the hotel is undergoing renovations, it was quiet & we didn't hear any noises that interruped our stay. The garden is nice (but very small) The soaking bathtub was a great place to soak & unwind after all the walking around, but the door to the bathroom & to the toilet were too close to each other & made getting in & out awkward at times. The other drawback was the location. Unless you are going to something at the Filmore theater, its not really close to any of the typical tourist places. Its true parking everywhere in SF is a nightmare in general (sparse and expensive) and the hotel has only 22 parking spots, but parking at the mall the hotel is connected to was actually convenient. Overall a very good place to stay, perfect for a quiet getaway. Only its location is a drawback for first time visitors unless u don't mind navigating the city a bit to get to and from places

review.title: not much to do in Japan town
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, the Doorman Freddie was extremely helpful. A kind and informative person. Apparently the area is undergoing renovation, I hope the city comes through, I was told of the pride in the area by my girlfriend; she said the side walks were steam cleaned every morning, unfortunately this was not true. She said the service in the area was unreal, but it appears the area needs to be revamped and money invested to celibrate the Japanese Culture, and maybe rival China Towne. I think the Hotel could offer a tea cermony, I have only heard how great they are. I would like Japantowne to rival China Towne!

review.title: Good value for the location
review.reviewText: Front desk employees were great,very courteous and helpful. The room was quite large, great view, a little noisy though.The hotel is going under renovation and it really needs it. The number or television channels is very limited. There was no information on the area in the room and the form to order breakfast was there the first day and never replaced.However the breakfast I ordered was great! Can't wait to see how it will look after renovation.

review.title: A whole different world in SF.
review.reviewText: Though I had been warned that the hotel was under construction, I didn't see any evidence of this. On a busy holiday weekend when the rest of the city was overrun with tourists, this was a whole different world! Quiet in a neighborhood atmosphere and only 3 blocks from Cathedral Hill. I was a wonderful change in San Francisco.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable. The bed and chairs were very nice. We stayed in a garden room on the fifth floor. The whirlpool tub was very hard to use, bordering on broken and a little dirty because it hadn't been used for a long time. Do NOT recommend the wine/sake tasting package. The bartender did not know what it was and only allowed terrible white or red house wine. Fitness center was tiny. Parking garage was easy to use and had an elevator right up to the hotel. Nice area.
